stationTime.name: stationTime
stationTime.description: This is the current time as perceived by the station. The string returned is a subset of the UTC Time as specified in the Draft Recommendation X.409 Message Handling Systems : Presentation Transfer SYNTAX and Notation (ASN.1). The formats acceptable when the time is being set are : 1. 11 Octets YYMMDDhhmmZ and 2. 13 Octets YYMMDDhhmmssZ Where YY are the two digits representing the year, MM are the two digits representing the month, DD are the two digits representing the day, hh are the two digits representing the hour, mm are the two digits representing the minute, ss are the two digits representing the second, Z is the ASCII character 'Z'. The time returned by the station in response to a Get or GetNext request will always be the 13 octet variant. It should be noted that changing this object also changes the value of timestamp objects and the value of objects which return a time-since-an-event-occurred value. Thus, if the stationTime is altered the validity of time dependent objects cannot be guaranteed.

stationActionOnNextReset.name: stationActionOnNextReset
stationActionOnNextReset.description: This object is used to configure the action to be taken the next time the station is reset. If this object has a value of coldStart(1) then the station will re-initalize itself such that the factory default configuration is loaded from memory. If this object is configured to warmStart(2) then upon the next reset the station will initialize with the same configuration, however the statistics counters and other statistics may have been reinitialized.

stationReset.name: stationReset
stationReset.description: This parameter is used to reset the station. The type of reset which occurs is dependent on the value of the stationActionOnNextReset object (station.2). The reset occurs a predefined time after the SetRequest in order that a response may be sent. Only the value reset(1) is valid for the Set operation, all other values will cause the generation of a badValue error. A value of noAction(2) is always returned in response to a GetRequest on this object.

stationSwRevision.name: stationSwRevision
stationSwRevision.description: This string identifies the current system software revision. The maximum length of the returned string is 16 characters. The returned string is in ASCII format.

stationHwRevision.name: stationHwRevision
stationHwRevision.description: This number identifies the current system hardware revision.

stationChassisType.name: stationChassisType
stationChassisType.description: This number identifies the chassis type of this system.

stationLEDIndication.name: stationLEDIndication
stationLEDIndication.description: This is a number which returns an interpretation of the state of the LEDs on the front panel of the chassis. A value of error(2) indicates that the unit has encountered some error condition. could be one of a tempreature overheat, a software failure or a diagnostic error.

stationFreePFlash.name: stationFreePFlash
stationFreePFlash.description: This is the number of free bytes remaining in Parameter Flash memory. This value can vary depending on the use of the device, as it changes as you configure the device.

stationFreeFlash.name: stationFreeFlash
stationFreeFlash.description: This is the number of bytes which remain free in Code Flash memory, this is the memory used to store the code image. This figure will be fixed between each reload of software to the device.

stationProcessorLoading.name: stationProcessorLoading
stationProcessorLoading.description: This is a measure of the loading on the RMP's processor. The processor loading is expressed as a percentage. The higher the value the greater the loading on the processor.

stationBufBytesAvailable.name: stationBufBytesAvailable
stationBufBytesAvailable.description: The value of this object indicates the number of bytes remaining on the RMP for use in buffer allocation. It is the total number of bytes which remain after all the RMP's software has been loaded.

stationBufNumOfFreeSmlBufs.name: stationBufNumOfFreeSmlBufs
stationBufNumOfFreeSmlBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the number of free small buffers which remain unused by the RMP.

stationBufNumOfFreeMedBufs.name: stationBufNumOfFreeMedBufs
stationBufNumOfFreeMedBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the number of free medium buffers which remain unused by the RMP.

stationBufNumOfFreeLgeBufs.name: stationBufNumOfFreeLgeBufs
stationBufNumOfFreeLgeBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the number of free large buffers which remain unused by the RMP.

stationBufNumOfSmlBufs.name: stationBufNumOfSmlBufs
stationBufNumOfSmlBufs.description: This is the total number of free small buffers available at the start of day or after a reinitialization of the unit.

stationBufNumOfMedBufs.name: stationBufNumOfMedBufs
stationBufNumOfMedBufs.description: This is the total number of free medium buffers available at the start of day or after a reinitialization of the unit.

stationBufNumOfLgeBufs.name: stationBufNumOfLgeBufs
stationBufNumOfLgeBufs.description: This is the total number of free large buffers available at the start of day or after a reinitialization of the unit.

stationSlotTable.name: stationSlotTable
stationSlotTable.description: A table of status and configuration parameters for the processors in each slot.

stnSlotEntry.name: stnSlotEntry
stnSlotEntry.description: This is an entry in the station Slot Entry Table.

stnSlotIndex.name: stnSlotIndex
stnSlotIndex.description: The value of this index uniquely identifies the Slot to which this entry is applicable.

stnSlotType.name: stnSlotType
stnSlotType.description: This parameter indicates the type of processing card present in a slot. It returns empty when no FP is present.

stnSlotOperState.name: stnSlotOperState
stnSlotOperState.description: This object indicates the current status of the particular processing card.

stnSlotDesiredState.name: stnSlotDesiredState
stnSlotDesiredState.description: This object is used to alter the state of the processing card and display the current state. When the user wishes to run continuous tests on a particular processing card the testing(2) state is used. If testing is complete and the users wishes to bring the card back on-line then a set with a value of operational(3) is made on this object. The partitioned(7) state is used to take a particular processing card off-line. This object can only be set with values of testing(1), operational(2), partitioned(7) and empty(8).

stnSlotProcessorLoading.name: stnSlotProcessorLoading
stnSlotProcessorLoading.description: This is a measure of the percentage loading on an FP's processor. The higher the value the greater the loading on the processor.

stationSlotBufferTable.name: stationSlotBufferTable
stationSlotBufferTable.description: This table contains configuration and statistic parameters for the buffers used by each forwarding processor card.

stnSlotBufEntry.name: stnSlotBufEntry
stnSlotBufEntry.description: This is an entry in the station Slot Buffer Entry Table.

stnSlotBufIndex.name: stnSlotBufIndex
stnSlotBufIndex.description: The value of this index uniquely identifies the Slot to which this entry is applicable. This identifies the FP to which this entry pertains.

stnSlotBufBytesAvailable.name: stnSlotBufBytesAvailable
stnSlotBufBytesAvailable.description: The value of this object indicates the number of bytes remaining on this card for use in buffer allocation. It is the total number of bytes which remain after all the processing card's software has been loaded.

stnSlotBufNumOfFreeSmlBufs.name: stnSlotBufNumOfFreeSmlBufs
stnSlotBufNumOfFreeSmlBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the number of free small buffers which remain unused by this processing card.

stnSlotBufNumOfFreeMedBufs.name: stnSlotBufNumOfFreeMedBufs
stnSlotBufNumOfFreeMedBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the number of free medium buffers which remain unused by this processing card.

stnSlotBufNumOfFreeLgeBufs.name: stnSlotBufNumOfFreeLgeBufs
stnSlotBufNumOfFreeLgeBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the number of free large buffers which remain unused by this processing card.

stnSlotBufNumOfSmlBufs.name: stnSlotBufNumOfSmlBufs
stnSlotBufNumOfSmlBufs.description: This is the total number of free small buffers available at the start of day or after a reinitialization of the unit.

stnSlotBufNumOfMedBufs.name: stnSlotBufNumOfMedBufs
stnSlotBufNumOfMedBufs.description: This is the total number of free medium buffers available at the start of day or after a reinitialization of the unit.

stnSlotBufNumOfLgeBufs.name: stnSlotBufNumOfLgeBufs
stnSlotBufNumOfLgeBufs.description: This is the total number of free large buffers available at the start of day or after a reinitialization of the unit.

stnSlotHeapBytesFree.name: stnSlotHeapBytesFree
stnSlotHeapBytesFree.description: This is the total number of free (unallocated) bytes available in this FP's heap space.

stnSlotHeapBytesUsed.name: stnSlotHeapBytesUsed
stnSlotHeapBytesUsed.description: This is the total number of used (allocated) bytes in this FP's heap space.

stnSlotBufSizeOfSmlBufs.name: stnSlotBufSizeOfSmlBufs
stnSlotBufSizeOfSmlBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the size of small buffers used by this processing card.

stnSlotBufSizeOfMedBufs.name: stnSlotBufSizeOfMedBufs
stnSlotBufSizeOfMedBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the size of medium buffers used by this processing card.

stnSlotBufSizeOfLgeBufs.name: stnSlotBufSizeOfLgeBufs
stnSlotBufSizeOfLgeBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the size of Large buffers used by this processing card.

stationTrapDestinationTable.name: stationTrapDestinationTable
stationTrapDestinationTable.description: This is the table of ip address of the stations to which the unit sends Trap PDUs. There is a maximum of eight entries in this table. To set an entry in this table, all the objects must be sent in a single SET PDU.

stationTrapDestEntry.name: stationTrapDestEntry
stationTrapDestEntry.description: This is an entry in the station trap destination table.

stationTrapDestIpAddr.name: stationTrapDestIpAddr
stationTrapDestIpAddr.description: This is the IP Address of a station/manager to which Trap PDU messages will be sent.

stationTrapDestCommunityName.name: stationTrapDestCommunityName
stationTrapDestCommunityName.description: This is the community name string which is inserted into the Trap PDU.

stationTrapDestType.name: stationTrapDestType
stationTrapDestType.description: The value of this object indicates if the requested entry is valid or invalid. The value of this parameter is used to determine if the entry is to be added or made invalid. If an entry has a type of invalid(2) then it can be overwritten. A GetNext request on this table returns all the entries and this type field indicates whether they are valid (i.e. being used) or invalid.

snmpAccessPolicyTable.name: snmpAccessPolicyTable
snmpAccessPolicyTable.description: A table of access policy entries. There is a maximum of eight entries in this table. To set an entry in this table, all the objects must be sent in a single SET PDU.

snmpAccessPolicyEntry.name: snmpAccessPolicyEntry
snmpAccessPolicyEntry.description: This is an entry in the SNMP Access Policy Table.

snmpAccessPolicyIndex.name: snmpAccessPolicyIndex
snmpAccessPolicyIndex.description: The value of this index uniquely identifies an entry in this table.

snmpAccessPolicyCommunityName.name: snmpAccessPolicyCommunityName
snmpAccessPolicyCommunityName.description: This is an octet string, against which the communityName field of the request PDU is compared. If the communityName in the request has been compared with all the community names in this table and no match has been found then authentication of the PDU fails. If there is an authentication failure than an authenticationFailure trap will be sent if the snmpEnableAuthenTraps object has a value of enabled(1).

snmpAccessPolicyAccessMode.name: snmpAccessPolicyAccessMode
snmpAccessPolicyAccessMode.description: This is a bit significant field as follows : bit 0 - read access bit 1 - write access Setting the individual bit to 1 enables the type of access, setting it to 0 disables it. Thus, a value of 3 (b11) indicates read-write access for a PDU with the corresponding communityName.

snmpAccessPolicyType.name: snmpAccessPolicyType
snmpAccessPolicyType.description: This object is used to indicate if a particular entry in the table is valid or invalid. If the entry is valid(1) then the entry's community name is used in the SNMP authentication process.

stationInitiateDownload.name: stationInitiateDownload
stationInitiateDownload.description: This object is used to initiate a parallel download of the software image to the unit. This object is set to a value of initiate(1) to begin the parallel download procedure. A value of noAction(2) is always returned to a GetRequest. This object can only be set to a value of initiate(1).

stationHeapBytesFree.name: stationHeapBytesFree
stationHeapBytesFree.description: This object indicates the number of free (unallocated) bytes in the system heap area.

stationHeapBytesUsed.name: stationHeapBytesUsed
stationHeapBytesUsed.description: This object indicates the number of bytes which are in use (allocated) by tasks using the system heap.

stationNoOfResets.name: stationNoOfResets
stationNoOfResets.description: This object is a count of the number of times this station reset since the last coldStart was performed.

stationLastResetReason.name: stationLastResetReason
stationLastResetReason.description: This string contains a description of the reason for the last station reset, this maybe power cycle, reset due to management action or some other error.

stationPowerSupplyStatus.name: stationPowerSupplyStatus
stationPowerSupplyStatus.description: This object gives an indication of the status of the unit's power supply. If this object has a value of fail(2) this means that a power supply failure has occurred. On units which do not have a redundant power supply this object will only have a value of ok(1).

stationConsolePortState.name: stationConsolePortState
stationConsolePortState.description: This object indicates if there is a Local Management Session in progress for this unit.

stationModemPortState.name: stationModemPortState
stationModemPortState.description: This object indicates if a modem port is in use.

stationNoOfTelnets.name: stationNoOfTelnets
stationNoOfTelnets.description: This object is a count of the number of active telnet sessions for the unit.

stationTelnetTable.name: stationTelnetTable
stationTelnetTable.description: This is the table of ip address of the stations to which the unit can telnet. There is a maximum of eight entries in this table. To set an entry in this table, all the objects must be sent in a single SET PDU.

stationTelnetEntry.name: stationTelnetEntry
stationTelnetEntry.description: This is an entry in the station trap destination table.

stationTelnetIpAddr.name: stationTelnetIpAddr
stationTelnetIpAddr.description: This is the IP Address of a station/manager to which you Telnet.

stationTelnetHostName.name: stationTelnetHostName
stationTelnetHostName.description: This is the community name string which is inserted into the Trap PDU.

stationTelnetType.name: stationTelnetType
stationTelnetType.description: The value of this object indicates if the requested entry is valid or invalid. The value of this parameter is used to determine if the entry is to be added or made invalid. If an entry has a type of invalid(2) then it can be overwritten. A GetNext request on this table returns all the entries and this type field indicates whether they are valid (i.e. being used) or invalid.

stationPflashServerIpAddress.name: stationPflashServerIpAddress
stationPflashServerIpAddress.description: The IP Address of the server for the Parameter Configuration Save/Restore.

stationPflashFileName.name: stationPflashFileName
stationPflashFileName.description: The path and name of the file to be save/restore for the Parameter Configuration Save/Restore.

stationPflashAction.name: stationPflashAction
stationPflashAction.description: This object is used to initiate parameter save or restore. A value of noAction is always returned to a GetRequest

stationPflashStatus.name: stationPflashStatus
stationPflashStatus.description: This is the current status of the parameter Configuration Save/Restore process.

stationInactivityTimeout.name: stationInactivityTimeout
stationInactivityTimeout.description: If a session is inactive for this length of time in minutes then it will timeout. A value of 0 means never timeout.

stationBufSizeOfSmlBufs.name: stationBufSizeOfSmlBufs
stationBufSizeOfSmlBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the size of small buffers used by the RMP.

stationBufSizeOfMedBufs.name: stationBufSizeOfMedBufs
stationBufSizeOfMedBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the size of medium buffers used by the RMP.

stationBufSizeOfLgeBufs.name: stationBufSizeOfLgeBufs
stationBufSizeOfLgeBufs.description: The value of this object indicates the size of Large buffers used by the RMP.

stationBufferExceptions.name: stationBufferExceptions
stationBufferExceptions.description: The value of this object indicates the number of times all the pools have been exhausted.

bridgingFacility.name: bridgingFacility
bridgingFacility.description: This object enables/disables the bridging element on the unit. When disabled, the unit shall not bridge any frames, nor shall it take part in the Spanning Tree protocol. Each logical port must also be enabled separately

brARSupport.name: brARSupport
brARSupport.description: This object allows you to enable/disable Retix 4000 series Adaptive Routing support on this box. If the value of this object is enabled (1) then this unit will allow an Adaptive Routing session to be set up across it.

brSNAPConversion.name: brSNAPConversion
brSNAPConversion.description: This enables/disables the conversion between Ethernet V.2 and SNAP bridged frames on the unit. When enabled, EthernetV2 frames to be bridged to Token Ring or fddi ports are converted to SNAP Encapsulation.

brSTPFacility.name: brSTPFacility
brSTPFacility.description: This enables/disables the use of Spanning Tree Protocol on the unit. When disabled, all bridging ports will forward traffic and learn addresses, regardless of network topology.

brSTPVersion.name: brSTPVersion
brSTPVersion.description: This object defines which version of Spanning Tree is running on the unit.

brSTPDomAddress.name: brSTPDomAddress
brSTPDomAddress.description: This is the MAC Address to be used for STP Draft 9 traffic. It is only meaningful when running STP Draft 9.

brSTPResetDelayTime.name: brSTPResetDelayTime
brSTPResetDelayTime.description: This is the time in seconds for which a serial port is assigned the maximum path Cost after it has reset. This is to avoid unreliable links forming the active path in Spanning Tree.

brTimeToDelete.name: brTimeToDelete
brTimeToDelete.description: This is the time in seconds after which forgotten Addresses are deleted from the Filtering Database.

brPortConfigEntry.name: brPortConfigEntry
brPortConfigEntry.description: Each entry contains configurables for each port on the system.

brPCIndex.name: brPCIndex
brPCIndex.description: This is the Logical Port Id to which this entry pertains.

brPCSecurityMode.name: brPCSecurityMode
brPCSecurityMode.description: This sets the mode of operation for this particular port. When in Security Mode, frames are forwarded only to destination addresses which appear as FIXED entries in the Filtering Database

brPCSrcAddrLearning.name: brPCSrcAddrLearning
brPCSrcAddrLearning.description: This enables/disables Source Address Learning on this port.

brPCSrcAddrFiltering.name: brPCSrcAddrFiltering
brPCSrcAddrFiltering.description: This enables/disables Source Address Filtering on this port. When enabled, frames will only be forwarded if their source address is a FIXED( non-learnt) entry in the Filtering database.

brPCAcceptMcastAddr.name: brPCAcceptMcastAddr
brPCAcceptMcastAddr.description: This configures the port to either accept or ignore broadcast/multicast packets. In a network of bridges in Security Mode, this allows a path to be provided for multicast/broadcast frames. If disabled, the port will filter these packets as normal.

brPCCustomFiltering.name: brPCCustomFiltering
brPCCustomFiltering.description: This enables/disables Custom Filtering on this port. If enabled, then Filtering is carried out according to the tests and actions described in the Custom Filter Statement Table for this port.

brPCTinygramComp.name: brPCTinygramComp
brPCTinygramComp.description: This enables/disables Tinygram Compression on this port. This is only valid for WAN ports, using Retix encapsulation, connected to other RX7000 units.

brPCSTPFacility.name: brPCSTPFacility
brPCSTPFacility.description: This enables/disables the Spanning Tree protocol on a per port basis. If disabled, the port will still forward and learn as a bridging port but will never forward or transmit spanning tree BPDUs.

brPCPathCostMode.name: brPCPathCostMode
brPCPathCostMode.description: This sets the mode for how the Port Path Cost is to be calculated. If manual, then the port Path Cost is configureable, if any of the others, then the Path Cost is calculated by the system, using the attached network's speed. Low, medium and high modes act as scaling values in this calculation.

brPCManPortPathCost.name: brPCManPortPathCost
brPCManPortPathCost.description: This is the manually configured Port Path Cost. It takes effect if the PortPathCostMode is 'manual', otherwise this value is not used.

brPCNCPState.name: brPCNCPState
brPCNCPState.description: Setting this object to a value of enable (1) causes NCP negotiation to commence for this bridging element. This is for use with Logical ports which are attached to PPP physical ports.

brPCGroupCheck.name: brPCGroupCheck
brPCGroupCheck.description: Setting this object to a value of enable (1) causes the bridging element to invoke group checking, i.e. it checks for membership of particular groups, when forwarding packets to/from this port.

brPCGroupMembership.name: brPCGroupMembership
brPCGroupMembership.description: This object is an integer which allows the user to specify which groups this port belongs to. There are 32 groups, 1 bit per group. This value initially takes the value zero, then for each of the group that the port belongs to, 2 raised to the power of the group number is added to value of the Membership object.

brCstmFilterTestEntry.name: brCstmFilterTestEntry
brCstmFilterTestEntry.description: Each entry is a Test to be applied to frames on any particular port. There can be up to 64 entries in the table. Each test is carried out in the following manner:- The position in the frame which is to be filtered is found by using the FilterStart and Offset fields. Then the Mask is applied, and the resulting value is compared with the Value field, using the Operator to define the comparison. Tests are carried out according to the the Port's Statement table. To set an entry in the table, all the objects must be present in the SET PDU.

brCFTTestIndex.name: brCFTTestIndex
brCFTTestIndex.description: This is the table index number

brCFTTestName.name: brCFTTestName
brCFTTestName.description: This is the name given to the Test, and can be up to 20 characters long. It should be an ascii string.

brCFTFilterStart.name: brCFTFilterStart
brCFTFilterStart.description: This defines the position in the frame where the offset is to be applied.

brCFTOffset.name: brCFTOffset
brCFTOffset.description: This is the offset to the position in the frame where the filter Mask is to be applied. If the FilterStart field is set to 'framelength' this field has no meaning.

brCFTMask.name: brCFTMask
brCFTMask.description: This is a bit-mask value, values 0x00..0xffff ffff This is the filter-mask, applied to the bits specified by filterStart and offset.

brCFTOperator.name: brCFTOperator
brCFTOperator.description: The operator defines the comparison check being made.

brCFTValue.name: brCFTValue
brCFTValue.description: This is the value to which the result of applying the mask is compared, using the operator.

brCstmFilterStmtEntry.name: brCstmFilterStmtEntry
brCstmFilterStmtEntry.description: Each entry is a Test statement. There are up to 16 entries per port. Each entry links a Test with the actions to be carried out depending on the test's success or failure. To set an entry in the table, all the objects must be present in the SET PDU.

brCFSPortNumber.name: brCFSPortNumber
brCFSPortNumber.description: This is the Logical Port No. for which the table exists.

brCFSStmtIndex.name: brCFSStmtIndex
brCFSStmtIndex.description: This is the table index number

brCFSTestName.name: brCFSTestName
brCFSTestName.description: This is the name of the Test to apply for this statement. It should match a Test name in the Custom Filter Test Table. It is an ascii string, of up to 20 characters.

brCFSActionOnSuccess.name: brCFSActionOnSuccess
brCFSActionOnSuccess.description: This can have the following values and meanings: Values 0..7 - Forward at priority 0..7 Value 0x7fff - Discard Values 0x8001..0x8010 - Use Statement No 1..16. This object can only be set to the values listed above.

brCFSActionOnFailure.name: brCFSActionOnFailure
brCFSActionOnFailure.description: This can have the following values and meanings: Values 0..7 - Forward at priority 0..7 Value 0x7fff - Discard Values 0x8001..0x8010 - Use Statement No 1..16. This object can only be set to the values listed above.

brFilteringDbEntry.name: brFilteringDbEntry
brFilteringDbEntry.description: Each entry comprises a MacAddress, a disposition, a port number and a type field. A Set on an entry of this table must set an entire entry. No partial sets are allowed.

brFDbPortNumber.name: brFDbPortNumber
brFDbPortNumber.description: This is the port for which this entry applies. A value of zero indicates that the entry applies to all bridge ports on the unit. All learnt entries will have a zero in this field.

brFDbDisposition.name: brFDbDisposition
brFDbDisposition.description: The disposition can have the following values :- 0 - Discard 1..253 - Port Number to forward on. 16385(0x4001)..16416(0x4020) - Group No. 1 to 32 65,534( 0xfffe ) - Internal Entry 65,535( 0xffff ) - Flood. All these values, except for the Internal Entry( 65534 ) can be used in a SET request.

brFDbType.name: brFDbType
brFDbType.description: This defines the type of the entry. A set pdu may only set this object to either fixedVolatile, fixedNonVolatile or delete, the other entries may be returned by a GET. Internal entries cannot be deleted.

brIdentifier.name: brIdentifier
brIdentifier.description: This is the bridge Identifier, which consists of an 8-byte hexadecimal string, the first 2 bytes specify the Spanning Tree priority, and the last 6, a MacAddress.

brTopologyChange.name: brTopologyChange
brTopologyChange.description: This flag indicates that there has been a change in the active topology in part of the bridged Network. When this is true, then Filtering Db entries are 'forgotten' when their age reaches the Forward delay time for the unit.

brLastTCNSource.name: brLastTCNSource
brLastTCNSource.description: This string tells us the source of the last topology change. This may be a MAC Address, if the bridge has received a TC BPDU, from another STP bridge, if it detected the change itself, then this will be a reason string indicating the cause of the TC. If no such TC has occurred then the string will have the value 'NONE'. The maximum length of this string is 20 bytes.

brLastTCN.name: brLastTCN
brLastTCN.description: The time in seconds since the last TCN. If this has never happened then this will have a value of zero.

brActiveAddresses.name: brActiveAddresses
brActiveAddresses.description: This is a count of the Active Addresses in the Filtering Db, including learnt, fixed and internal entries.

brForgottenAddresses.name: brForgottenAddresses
brForgottenAddresses.description: This is a count of the forgotten addresses in the Filtering Database.

brPortStatsTable.name: brPortStatsTable
brPortStatsTable.description: This is a table of statistics which are kept per logical port

brPortStatsEntry.name: brPortStatsEntry
brPortStatsEntry.description: An entry in the Port Statistics table.

brPSPortNumber.name: brPSPortNumber
brPSPortNumber.description: The Logical port number to which these statistics belong.

brPSPortState.name: brPSPortState
brPSPortState.description: This is the forwarding state of the port.

brPSLastReset.name: brPSLastReset
brPSLastReset.description: This is the time in seconds, since the port was last reset or initialised.

brPSTopologyChangeAck.name: brPSTopologyChangeAck
brPSTopologyChangeAck.description: This is the state of the Spanning Tree Topology change acknowledge flag.

brPSResetDelayTimer.name: brPSResetDelayTimer
brPSResetDelayTimer.description: This is the current value of this timer, in seconds, for this port. This indicates the time since the last reset for a WAN port. When the timer is running, then the portPathCost for this port is set to a maximum. When the timer reaches the Reset DelayTime, then the portPathCost is reset to its normal value, and the timer is stopped. When the timer is stopped, it has a value of 0. It also has this value if this port is a LAN port.

brPSForwardedFrames.name: brPSForwardedFrames
brPSForwardedFrames.description: This is the number of transparent bridge frames forwarded received on this port, that have been forwarded to at least one other bridge port.

brPSDeletedFrames.name: brPSDeletedFrames
brPSDeletedFrames.description: This is the no. of transparent bridge frames received in this port, that would have been forwarded, but were deleted due to a lack of resources.

brPSNCPStatus.name: brPSNCPStatus
brPSNCPStatus.description: The current status of the bridging Network Control Protocol. If this logical port is attached to a non-PPP physical port, then the value will be notApplicable(11).

brIPXConversion.name: brIPXConversion
brIPXConversion.description: When enabled, this object causes the bridging process to recognise IPX packets, and NOT perform MAC Address byte- swapping on them, when going to and from Token Ring networks. Otherwise they are treated as ordinary bridging traffic and have their addresses byte-swapped.

ipARPTimeout.name: ipARPTimeout
ipARPTimeout.description: This parameter determines the amount of time an entry can stay in the Address Resolution Table. When the specified time elapses, the entry is deleted. A value of zero disables aging of entries in the table, this object can take the following values 0, and any number from 3 to 1500 inclusive..

ipReassemblyTimeout.name: ipReassemblyTimeout
ipReassemblyTimeout.description: This parameter specifies the number of seconds that the IP layer waits for all IP fragments of an IP datagram to be received.

ipProxyARPState.name: ipProxyARPState
ipProxyARPState.description: This parameter determines whether the ipRouter Proxy ARP functionality is on or off.

ipSrcQuenchState.name: ipSrcQuenchState
ipSrcQuenchState.description: This parameter determines whether ICMP Source Quench messages will be generated by the ipRouter.

ipRedirectState.name: ipRedirectState
ipRedirectState.description: This parameter determines whether ICMP Redirect messages will be generated by the ipRouter.

ipICMPTxRate.name: ipICMPTxRate
ipICMPTxRate.description: This parameter controls the rate (in seconds) at which ICMP error messages are generated.

ipRtHashSize.name: ipRtHashSize
ipRtHashSize.description: This parameter determines the size of the IP routing hash table.

ipRIPState.name: ipRIPState
ipRIPState.description: This parameter determines if the RIP routing protocol is enabled globally. This parameter is set to DISABLED if IP routing is disabled globally.

ipBoothelperState.name: ipBoothelperState
ipBoothelperState.description: This parameter disables or enables the boothelper function in the ipRouter.

ipBoothelperFwdAddress.name: ipBoothelperFwdAddress
ipBoothelperFwdAddress.description: This parameter is the boothelper IP forwarding address

ipBoothelperHopCount.name: ipBoothelperHopCount
ipBoothelperHopCount.description: This parameter is the maximum number of hops a BOOTP packet can traverse.

ipSecurity.name: ipSecurity
ipSecurity.description: This parameter enables or disables the security mechanism.

ipRouterId.name: ipRouterId
ipRouterId.description: This Address uniquely identifies the Router in the autonomous system.

ipPortConfigTable.name: ipPortConfigTable
ipPortConfigTable.description: This is a table of configurable IP parameters.

ipPortConfigEntry.name: ipPortConfigEntry
ipPortConfigEntry.description: This is an entry of the ipPortConfigTable.

ipPortConfigIndex.name: ipPortConfigIndex
ipPortConfigIndex.description: This is the Logical Port No. to which this Table entry pertains.

ipPortForwarding.name: ipPortForwarding
ipPortForwarding.description: The indication of whether this entity is acting as a gateway in respect to the forwarding of datagrams received by, but not addressed to, this entity. IP gateways forward datagrams. IP hosts do not ( except those source-routed via the host.) Even if enabled, this port will not forward unless the global ipForwarding flag is enabled and at least one IP Address has been configured on the unit.

ipPortRIPState.name: ipPortRIPState
ipPortRIPState.description: This parameter determines if the RIP routing protocol is enabled on this interface. This parameter is set to DISABLED if IP routing is disabled on this port. If the global RIPState flag is not enabled then this port will not be enabled, no matter what value this object has.

ipPortPathCost.name: ipPortPathCost
ipPortPathCost.description: This parameter is the RIP path cost associated with logical port which is used by RIP.

ipPortMACEncapsulation.name: ipPortMACEncapsulation
ipPortMACEncapsulation.description: This parameter determines the LAN encapsulation used when transmitting a datagram on this logical port. This parameter is only applicable for logical ports which are attached to LAN physical ports.

ipPortBcastForm.name: ipPortBcastForm
ipPortBcastForm.description: This parameter determines the directed broadcast form used on this interface.

ipPortFwdBroadcast.name: ipPortFwdBroadcast
ipPortFwdBroadcast.description: This parameter determines whether directed broadcast datagrams are forwarded.

ipPortMTU.name: ipPortMTU
ipPortMTU.description: Maximum size of an IP packet that can be transferred through this interface. Ethernet packets can have a maximum size of 1500, IEEE802.3 packets have a maximum size of 1492. Token Ring have a maximum size of 4464 and FDDI has a maximum size of 4390.

ipPortDisposition.name: ipPortDisposition
ipPortDisposition.description: This parameter determines the action taken on a received IP datagram if routing is disabled for this port, and the global routing flag is set to enabled (2). If routing is disabled for this port and this object has a value of discard (2), than all IP datagrams received on this port which are not addressed to the unit, will be discarded.

ipPortAccessList1.name: ipPortAccessList1
ipPortAccessList1.description: The first set of security parameters associated with this port. This number identifies an entry in the ipAccessList table for this port. A value of 0 indicates that the default entry is used in which case no access checking is done.

ipPortAccessList2.name: ipPortAccessList2
ipPortAccessList2.description: The second set of security parameters associated with this port. This number identifies an entry in the ipAccessList table for this port. A value of 0 indicates that the default entry is used in which case no access checking is done.

ipPortHideNullNets.name: ipPortHideNullNets
ipPortHideNullNets.description: Locally connected WANs are not advertised in RIP messages. This allows subnetting over WANs without consuming large numbers of IP addresses.

ipPortUDPBroadcasts.name: ipPortUDPBroadcasts
ipPortUDPBroadcasts.description: When enabled UDP broadcasts are frowarded on this port. Set to a value of disabled (2) to prevent UDP broadcast from being forwardrd on this port and so prevent broadcast stroms arising from loops in the network etc.

ipPortAddrTable.name: ipPortAddrTable
ipPortAddrTable.description: This table is a table of IP addresses and masks associated with each logical port.

ipPortAddrEntry.name: ipPortAddrEntry
ipPortAddrEntry.description: An entry of the IP port address table. All the objects in an entry must be supplied in a single SET PDU.

ipPortAddrIndex.name: ipPortAddrIndex
ipPortAddrIndex.description: An index into the ipPortAddr Table which identifies the Logical Port No, for which the address is valid.

ipPortIpAddress.name: ipPortIpAddress
ipPortIpAddress.description: The IP Address of the logical port. There can be up to five IP addresses associated with each port. This object combined with the ipPortAddrIndex object constitutes the instance value used to uniquely identify and entry in this table.

ipPortIpAddressMask.name: ipPortIpAddressMask
ipPortIpAddressMask.description: The IP address mask associated with the IP address.

ipPortAddrType.name: ipPortAddrType
ipPortAddrType.description: If the value of this object is valid(1) and we are performing a SetRequest then this is a request to add an entry to the table. If a value of invalid(2) is passed in the SetRequest, along with the other objects in an entry then this is a request to delete the entry from the table.

ipDestUnreachLastRx.name: ipDestUnreachLastRx
ipDestUnreachLastRx.description: The last time an ICMP Destination Unreachable message was received. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipDestUnreachLastTx.name: ipDestUnreachLastTx
ipDestUnreachLastTx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Destination Unreachable Message was sent. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipSourceQuenchLastRx.name: ipSourceQuenchLastRx
ipSourceQuenchLastRx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Source Quench message was received. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipSourceQuenchLastTx.name: ipSourceQuenchLastTx
ipSourceQuenchLastTx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Source Quench message was sent. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipRedirectsLastRx.name: ipRedirectsLastRx
ipRedirectsLastRx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Redirects message was received. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipRedirectsLastTx.name: ipRedirectsLastTx
ipRedirectsLastTx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Redirects message was sent. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipEchoRequestLastRx.name: ipEchoRequestLastRx
ipEchoRequestLastRx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Echo Requests message was sent. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipEchoRequestLastTx.name: ipEchoRequestLastTx
ipEchoRequestLastTx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Echo Request message was sent. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipTimeExceededLastRx.name: ipTimeExceededLastRx
ipTimeExceededLastRx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Time Exceeded message was received. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipTimeExceededLastTx.name: ipTimeExceededLastTx
ipTimeExceededLastTx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Time Exceeded message was sent. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipParamProbLastRx.name: ipParamProbLastRx
ipParamProbLastRx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Parameter Problem message was received. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipParamProbLastTx.name: ipParamProbLastTx
ipParamProbLastTx.description: This is the last time an ICMP Parameter Problem message was sent. The format of the returned OctetString is the same as that define in section b. of the definition of the stationTime (station.1) object.

ipAccessViolations.name: ipAccessViolations
ipAccessViolations.description: This is a count of the number of access violations which have occurred for the entire unit.

ipOtherDiscards.name: ipOtherDiscards
ipOtherDiscards.description: This is the total number of IP datagrams discarded for the entire unit, for other reasons, eg the incorrect configuration of a WAN port, etc

ipOutTransmits.name: ipOutTransmits
ipOutTransmits.description: This is the total number of IP datagrams which have been transmitted by this unit.

ipPortStatsTable.name: ipPortStatsTable
ipPortStatsTable.description: This is a table of IP logical port statistics parameters.

ipPortStatsEntry.name: ipPortStatsEntry
ipPortStatsEntry.description: An entry of the Stats table.

ipPortStatsIndex.name: ipPortStatsIndex
ipPortStatsIndex.description: This index is a logical port number and uniquely identifies an entry in this table.

ipPortInReceives.name: ipPortInReceives
ipPortInReceives.description: The total number of input datagrams received on this port, including those received in errors.

ipPortInHdrErrors.name: ipPortInHdrErrors
ipPortInHdrErrors.description: The number of input datagrams discarded due to errors in their IP headers, including bad checksums, version number mismatch, other format errors, time-to-live exceeded errors, errors discovered in processing their routines, etc.

ipPortInAddrErrors.name: ipPortInAddrErrors
ipPortInAddrErrors.description: The number of input datagrams discarded because the IP headers destination field was not a valid address to be received at this entity. This count includes invalid addresses (e.g. 0.0.0.0) and addresses of unsupported classes (e.g. class E). For entities which are not IP gateways and therefore do not forward datagrams, this counter includes datagrams discarded because the destination address was not a local address.

ipPortForwDatagrams.name: ipPortForwDatagrams
ipPortForwDatagrams.description: The number of input datagrams forwarded or source-routed via this entity.

ipPortInDiscards.name: ipPortInDiscards
ipPortInDiscards.description: The number of input IP datagrams for which no problem was encountered to prevent their further processing, but were discarded (e.g. lack of buffer space). This does not include datagrams discarded while awaiting reassembly.

ipPortInDelivers.name: ipPortInDelivers
ipPortInDelivers.description: The total number of input datagrams successfully delivered to IP user protocols ( including ICMP).

ipPortOutTransmits.name: ipPortOutTransmits
ipPortOutTransmits.description: The total number of IP datagrams which have been transmitted on this port.

ipPortOutNoRoutes.name: ipPortOutNoRoutes
ipPortOutNoRoutes.description: The number of IP datagrams discarded because no route could be found to transmit them to their destination.

ipPortOtherDiscards.name: ipPortOtherDiscards
ipPortOtherDiscards.description: The number of IP datagrams discarded for other reasons, eg the incorrect configuration of a WAN port, etc

ipPortICMPInMsgs.name: ipPortICMPInMsgs
ipPortICMPInMsgs.description: The number of ICMP messages which the entity received on this port. Note that this counter includes all those counted by icmpInErrors.

ipPortICMPInErrors.name: ipPortICMPInErrors
ipPortICMPInErrors.description: The number of ICMP messages which the entity received on this port, but determined as having ICMP-specific errors (bad ICMP checksums, bad length, etc.).

ipPortICMPInDestUnreachs.name: ipPortICMPInDestUnreachs
ipPortICMPInDestUnreachs.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInTimeExcds.name: ipPortICMPInTimeExcds
ipPortICMPInTimeExcds.description: The number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInParmProbs.name: ipPortICMPInParmProbs
ipPortICMPInParmProbs.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInSrcQuenchs.name: ipPortICMPInSrcQuenchs
ipPortICMPInSrcQuenchs.description: The number of ICMP Source Quench messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInRedirects.name: ipPortICMPInRedirects
ipPortICMPInRedirects.description: The number of ICMP Redirect messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInEchos.name: ipPortICMPInEchos
ipPortICMPInEchos.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInEchoReps.name: ipPortICMPInEchoReps
ipPortICMPInEchoReps.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInTimestamps.name: ipPortICMPInTimestamps
ipPortICMPInTimestamps.description: The number of ICMP Timestamp (request) messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInTimestampReps.name: ipPortICMPInTimestampReps
ipPortICMPInTimestampReps.description: The number of ICMP Timestamp Reply messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInAddrMasks.name: ipPortICMPInAddrMasks
ipPortICMPInAddrMasks.description: The number of ICMP Address Mask Request messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPInAddrMaskReps.name: ipPortICMPInAddrMaskReps
ipPortICMPInAddrMaskReps.description: The number of ICMP Address Mask Reply messages received on this port.

ipPortICMPOutMsgs.name: ipPortICMPOutMsgs
ipPortICMPOutMsgs.description: The total number of ICMP messages which this entity attempted to send on this port. Note that this counter includes all those counted by ipPortICMPOutErrors.

ipPortICMPOutErrors.name: ipPortICMPOutErrors
ipPortICMPOutErrors.description: The number of ICMP messages which this entity did not send on this port due to problems discovered within ICMP such as a lack of buffers. This value should not include errors discovered outside the ICMP layer such as the inability of IP to route the resultant datagram. In some implementations there may be no types of error which contribute to this counter's value.

ipPortICMPOutDestUnreachs.name: ipPortICMPOutDestUnreachs
ipPortICMPOutDestUnreachs.description: The number of ICMP Destination Unreachable messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutTimeExcds.name: ipPortICMPOutTimeExcds
ipPortICMPOutTimeExcds.description: The number of ICMP Time Exceeded messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutParmProbs.name: ipPortICMPOutParmProbs
ipPortICMPOutParmProbs.description: The number of ICMP Parameter Problem messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutSrcQuenchs.name: ipPortICMPOutSrcQuenchs
ipPortICMPOutSrcQuenchs.description: The number of ICMP Source Quench messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutRedirects.name: ipPortICMPOutRedirects
ipPortICMPOutRedirects.description: The number of ICMP Redirect messages sent from this port. For a host, this object will always be zero, since hosts do not send redirects.

ipPortICMPOutEchos.name: ipPortICMPOutEchos
ipPortICMPOutEchos.description: The number of ICMP Echo (request) messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutEchoReps.name: ipPortICMPOutEchoReps
ipPortICMPOutEchoReps.description: The number of ICMP Echo Reply messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutTimestamps.name: ipPortICMPOutTimestamps
ipPortICMPOutTimestamps.description: The number of ICMP Timestamp (request) messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutTimestampReps.name: ipPortICMPOutTimestampReps
ipPortICMPOutTimestampReps.description: The number of ICMP Timestamp Reply messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutAddrMasks.name: ipPortICMPOutAddrMasks
ipPortICMPOutAddrMasks.description: The number of ICMP Address Mask Request messages sent from this port.

ipPortICMPOutAddrMaskReps.name: ipPortICMPOutAddrMaskReps
ipPortICMPOutAddrMaskReps.description: The number of ICMP Address Mask Reply messages sent from this port.

ipAccessListTable.name: ipAccessListTable
ipAccessListTable.description: This is a list of the parameters used for access checking.

ipAccessListEntry.name: ipAccessListEntry
ipAccessListEntry.description: An entry in the Access List Table. To set an entry in this table ALL the objects must be supplied in a single SET PDU.?

ipAccessListIndex.name: ipAccessListIndex
ipAccessListIndex.description: The index which uniquely identifies this entry. There is a maximum of 32 entries in this table.

ipTxCheck.name: ipTxCheck
ipTxCheck.description: Indicates whether checking of IP packets to be transmitted is enabled or not.

ipNoMatchTxAction.name: ipNoMatchTxAction
ipNoMatchTxAction.description: When an IP datagram is to be transmitted, the source and destination addresses are &ed with their masks and compared with those in the security entry. This object indicates the action to be taken if these two don't match.

ipRxCheck.name: ipRxCheck
ipRxCheck.description: If this parameter has a value of enabled(1), then all received IP packets are checked.

ipNoMatchRxAction.name: ipNoMatchRxAction
ipNoMatchRxAction.description: When an IP datagram is received, the source and destination addresses are &ed with their masks and compared with those in the security entry. This object indicates the action to be taken if these two don't match.

ipIcmpGeneration.name: ipIcmpGeneration
ipIcmpGeneration.description: This parameter indicates whether ICMP messages are generated or not.

ipIfSecurityEntry.name: ipIfSecurityEntry
ipIfSecurityEntry.description: An entry in the security table. For each entry in the Access List Table, there is a list(table) of Security entries. Therefore, as each port has 2 access List entries associated with it, then the port has access to two separate lists of security entries within this table. To set an entry in this table, ALL the objects must be supplied in a single SET PDU.

ipIfSecurityAccessListNum.name: ipIfSecurityAccessListNum
ipIfSecurityAccessListNum.description: The entry number of the Access List with which this security entry is associated.

ipIfSecurityIndex.name: ipIfSecurityIndex
ipIfSecurityIndex.description: An index into the security table.

ipIfSecurityAction.name: ipIfSecurityAction
ipIfSecurityAction.description: Indicates the action in case of a match occurring between the src/dest addr and mask in the ip packet rxd/txd and the src/dest addr and mask in the security entry.

ipIfSecurityProtocol.name: ipIfSecurityProtocol
ipIfSecurityProtocol.description: The protocol for which this entry is valid. 0 is used for IP filtering

ipIfSecuritySrcAddress.name: ipIfSecuritySrcAddress
ipIfSecuritySrcAddress.description: The IP Address of the source. A value of 0.0.0.0 means that no checking is to be done on the Source Address

ipIfSecuritySrcMask.name: ipIfSecuritySrcMask
ipIfSecuritySrcMask.description: The mask used with the source address, if SrcAddress is not null.

ipIfSecurityDestAddress.name: ipIfSecurityDestAddress
ipIfSecurityDestAddress.description: The destination IP address. A value of 0.0.0.0 means that no checking is to be done on the Destination Address

ipIfSecurityDestMask.name: ipIfSecurityDestMask
ipIfSecurityDestMask.description: The mask used with the destination address, if the address is not null.

ipIfSecurityOperator.name: ipIfSecurityOperator
ipIfSecurityOperator.description: The operator used in the comparison.

ipIfSecurityOperand.name: ipIfSecurityOperand
ipIfSecurityOperand.description: This is the destination user port number to which the IP datagram is addressed. The ipIfSecurityProtocol objects indicates whether the port is a TCP or UDP port.

ipIfSecurityOption.name: ipIfSecurityOption
ipIfSecurityOption.description: This object indicates whether access checking should be performed on an IP datagram that contains one or more IP options and match the source and destination IP addresses of this entry. If the object is set to Enabled then access checking is performed on the IP datagram containing IP Options. An IP datagrams that does not contain any options is not affected by this object.

ipIfSecurityType.name: ipIfSecurityType
ipIfSecurityType.description: If this field has a value of valid(1) then the entry in the request is added to the table. If a value of invalid(2) is used then the entry will be deleted.

portLgclPortStatusTable.name: portLgclPortStatusTable
portLgclPortStatusTable.description: This is the logical port status table.

portLgclPortStatusEntry.name: portLgclPortStatusEntry
portLgclPortStatusEntry.description: This is an entry in the logical port status table.

portLgclPortID.name: portLgclPortID
portLgclPortID.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the logical port to which this entry is applicable.

portLgclPortPartnerMacAddress.name: portLgclPortPartnerMacAddress
portLgclPortPartnerMacAddress.description: The parameter contains the MAC address of the physical port to which this logical port is mapped. In the case of WAN ports this will return the base MAC address for the RX7000 station.

portLgclPortPartnerType.name: portLgclPortPartnerType
portLgclPortPartnerType.description: This is the type of the partner to which this logical port is mapped. A value of notApplicable is returned for logical ports which are LAN ports, and for WAN ports which are not connected to any partner.

portLgclPortName.name: portLgclPortName
portLgclPortName.description: The is the name of this logical port.

portLgclPortEncaps.name: portLgclPortEncaps
portLgclPortEncaps.description: This parameter indicates the Encapsulation used for the WAN port to which this logical port is attached. The values between 9 and 14 inclusive are reserved.

portLgclPortSlotID.name: portLgclPortSlotID
portLgclPortSlotID.description: This identifies the slot on which the logical port resides.

portLgclPortType.name: portLgclPortType
portLgclPortType.description: This is the type of the underlying physical port.

portLgclPortThruput.name: portLgclPortThruput
portLgclPortThruput.description: This is the thruput measurement for the logical port.

portLgclPortMaxTransit.name: portLgclPortMaxTransit
portLgclPortMaxTransit.description: This is the value of the maximum transit delay in ******* for this port.

portLgclPortMinTransit.name: portLgclPortMinTransit
portLgclPortMinTransit.description: This is the value of the minimum transit delay in ******* for this port.

portLgclPortMaxMTUSize.name: portLgclPortMaxMTUSize
portLgclPortMaxMTUSize.description: This is the value of the maximum transmission unit size for this port.

portLgclPortStatus.name: portLgclPortStatus
portLgclPortStatus.description: This is the status of the logical port. The value other(1) represents an undefined state which may indicate that the port is not active or there has been some failure on the card. In general the only states which will be reported to a manager are notReady(3) which indicates that the port is configured but not ready to transmit and receive, and ready(4) which indicates that this logical port is configured and can receive and transmit.

portLgclPortQueueSize.name: portLgclPortQueueSize
portLgclPortQueueSize.description: This defines the maximum queue length of the logical port.

portAttachLgclPortTable.name: portAttachLgclPortTable
portAttachLgclPortTable.description: This table is used to attach a logical port to a physical port and channel on the physical port.

portAttachLgclPortEntry.name: portAttachLgclPortEntry
portAttachLgclPortEntry.description: This is an entry in the attach logical port to physical port table. An entry in this table indicates if the logical port is attached to the physical port and what channel on the physical port the logical port is attached to, if applicable. To set an entry in this table, aALL the objects in the entry must be present in a single SET PDU.

portAttachLgclPortID.name: portAttachLgclPortID
portAttachLgclPortID.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the logical port to which this entry is applicable.

portAttachPhysPortID.name: portAttachPhysPortID
portAttachPhysPortID.description: The value of this parameter is the physical port to which the logical port identified by portAttachLgclPortID is attached or it is physical port to which this logical port is to be attached.

portAttachChanID.name: portAttachChanID
portAttachChanID.description: The value of this object indicates the channel to which the port, identified by portLgclPortID, is attached or is to be attached. If the physical port has a portPhysPortLinkProtocol value of anything other than x.25(1) or framerelay(2) then this this parameter will have a value of zero.

portAttachAction.name: portAttachAction
portAttachAction.description: The value of this object indicates whether the logical port, identified by portLgclPortID, is to be attached or removed from the physical port and channel, identified by portAttachPhysPortID and portAttachChanID respectively. A value of attach has the effect of adding an entry to this table, and either to create the logical port, or to attach it to another physical port. A value of remove has the effect of removing an entry from the table and if the logical port is the last logical port attached to the physical port then the remove action has the effect of deleting the logical port also.

portPhysPortStatusTable.name: portPhysPortStatusTable
portPhysPortStatusTable.description: This table contains physical port status parameters.

portPhysPortStatusEntry.name: portPhysPortStatusEntry
portPhysPortStatusEntry.description: This is an entry in the portPhysPortStatusTable.

portPhysPortID.name: portPhysPortID
portPhysPortID.description: The value of this parameter uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is applicable.

portPhysPortSlotID.name: portPhysPortSlotID
portPhysPortSlotID.description: The value of this parameter uniquely identifies the slot where the physical port identified by the value portPhysPortID resides.

portPhysPortCardID.name: portPhysPortCardID
portPhysPortCardID.description: The value of this parameter identifies the IO card on which the physical port identified by the value portPhysPortID resides.

portPhysPortName.name: portPhysPortName
portPhysPortName.description: The used defined name for this physical port. this parameter has no operational significance, but serves to identify the port in a user friendly fashion.

portPhysPortIOCardType.name: portPhysPortIOCardType
portPhysPortIOCardType.description: The type of I/O card on which this port resides.

portPhysPortLinkProtocol.name: portPhysPortLinkProtocol
portPhysPortLinkProtocol.description: The link protocol to be run over the physical port link. The values between 9 and 14 inclusive are reserved.

portPhysPortStatus.name: portPhysPortStatus
portPhysPortStatus.description: The current operating status of the physical port. This mirrors the state of the logical port which is attached to it.

portNextUnassignedLgclPrtNum.name: portNextUnassignedLgclPrtNum
portNextUnassignedLgclPrtNum.description: This is the next unassigned number which can be used for a logical port create/attach operation.

phySerIfGeneralTable.name: phySerIfGeneralTable
phySerIfGeneralTable.description: A table of general parameters applicable to any type of serial interface physical port.

phySerIfGeneralEntry.name: phySerIfGeneralEntry
phySerIfGeneralEntry.description: An entry in the general table.

phySerIfGeneralIndex.name: phySerIfGeneralIndex
phySerIfGeneralIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is applicable.

phySerIfOperationalMode.name: phySerIfOperationalMode
phySerIfOperationalMode.description: This parameter is used to determine whether the physical port is available to the higher layers. If the value of this object is dataMode (1) then it is available otherwise a value of bertMode(2) indicates that the physical port is in a Bit Error Rate Test mode.

phySerIfPhysicalPortType.name: phySerIfPhysicalPortType
phySerIfPhysicalPortType.description: This parameter is used to determine the physical port's interface type.

phySerIfPhysicalPortState.name: phySerIfPhysicalPortState
phySerIfPhysicalPortState.description: This parameter is used to determine whether the physical port may be used to transfer data. The conditions for a physical port being reported as in a usable state are specific to the interface type and are as follows: X.21 - presence of control/indicate signal RS-449 - presence of RR, DM and CS signals V.35 - presence of RSLD, DSR and CTS signals RS-232 - presence of RSLD, DSR and CTS signals T1 - T1 interface hardware configured and no error reported from T1 line interface or framer.

phySerIfPhysicalInterfaceState.name: phySerIfPhysicalInterfaceState
phySerIfPhysicalInterfaceState.description: This parameter is used to obtain the status of the physical interface control lines. The format of bit pattern returned is physical interface specific.

phySerIfOnboardLoopback.name: phySerIfOnboardLoopback
phySerIfOnboardLoopback.description: This parameter is used to control the operation of the port hardware If the value is disabled(1) the the port hardware is configured to operate in normal mode, if the value is enabled(2) then the port is configured to operate in (on-board) loopback mode.

phySerIfNoOfLinkResets.name: phySerIfNoOfLinkResets
phySerIfNoOfLinkResets.description: This object is a count of the number of resets which have occurred on this WAN physical link, since the last reinitialization of the unit.

phySerIfLastLinkResetReason.name: phySerIfLastLinkResetReason
phySerIfLastLinkResetReason.description: This object gives the a reason code for the last reset which occurred on this WAN physical link. A value of noReason(1) is returned if the link has not reset. A value of management(2) is returned when a link reset has been caused by a management protocol (either SNMP or by LMS). A value of deviceReset(3) is returned if the link reset was caused by a hardware failure. A value of cableDrop(4) is returned when the link reset was caused by a missing or faulty cable. A value of protocol(5) is returned when the link reset is caused by the link protocol which is running on this link e.g. a Disconnet Request etc.

phySerIfTimeSinceLastLinkReset.name: phySerIfTimeSinceLastLinkReset
phySerIfTimeSinceLastLinkReset.description: This is a time (in hundredths of seconds) since the last link reset.

phySerIfSenseCtrlSgnls.name: phySerIfSenseCtrlSgnls
phySerIfSenseCtrlSgnls.description: This allows a port to be configured 'less-sensitive' to signal variations on control lines.

phySerIfX21Table.name: phySerIfX21Table
phySerIfX21Table.description: A table of parameters specific to the X21 type of physical interface.

phySerIfX21Entry.name: phySerIfX21Entry
phySerIfX21Entry.description: An entry of X21 specific parameters.

phySerIfx21Index.name: phySerIfx21Index
phySerIfx21Index.description: The value of the index which uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is applicable.

phySerIfx21DTEDCESelect.name: phySerIfx21DTEDCESelect
phySerIfx21DTEDCESelect.description: This parameter is used to control whether the port hardware provides a DTE or a DCE interface.

phySerIfBertTable.name: phySerIfBertTable
phySerIfBertTable.description: A table of Bert (Bit Error Rate Testing) specific parameters.

phySerIfBertEntry.name: phySerIfBertEntry
phySerIfBertEntry.description: An entry of Bert specific parameters. An entry exist in this table only if the object, phySerIfGenOperationalMode, has been set to a value of bertMode(2), for this interface.

phySerIfBertIndex.name: phySerIfBertIndex
phySerIfBertIndex.description: The value of the index which uniquely identifies the physical port for which this entry is applicable.

phySerIfBertUnitType.name: phySerIfBertUnitType
phySerIfBertUnitType.description: If this parameter has a value of testUnit(1) then the unit will generate and check test patterns. If the value returned is echoUnit (2) the the unit echoes received frames.

phySerIfBertPatternType.name: phySerIfBertPatternType
phySerIfBertPatternType.description: This parameter is used to select between pseudo random (prbs (1)) and fixed (fbs (2)) bit sequence test patterns.

phySerIfBertPatternLength.name: phySerIfBertPatternLength
phySerIfBertPatternLength.description: This parameter is used to control the amount of test pattern which is enclosed in a single frame. This parameter is specified in units of bytes but will be implemented with a granularity of long words.

phySerIfBertPRBSPattern.name: phySerIfBertPRBSPattern
phySerIfBertPRBSPattern.description: This parameter is used to select the size of the pseudo random sequence pattern to be used. This parameter must be set when the phySerIfBertPatternType object has a value of prbs (1).

phySerIfBertFBSPattern.name: phySerIfBertFBSPattern
phySerIfBertFBSPattern.description: This parameter is used to select the fixed bit sequence pattern to be used. This parameter must be set when the physSerIfBertPatternType object has a value of fbs(2).

phySerIfBertUserFBS.name: phySerIfBertUserFBS
phySerIfBertUserFBS.description: This parameter allows the user to define a fixed bit sequence test pattern to be used in Bert. This parameter need only be set when the phySerIfBertPatternType object has a value of fbs(2) and the phySerIfFBSPatternTye object has a value of userPattern(4).

phySerIfBertPeriod.name: phySerIfBertPeriod
phySerIfBertPeriod.description: This parameter is used to control the length of time over which the two units will perform the BER tests. This parameter is specified in units of seconds. A value of 0 is used to indicate an indefinite test period. This parameter may be configured at both the Test Unit and Echo Unit.

phySerIfBertBadLengthFrames.name: phySerIfBertBadLengthFrames
phySerIfBertBadLengthFrames.description: This parameter is used to obtain the number of frames received with an incorrect length during the BER test. This parameter is only applicable to a unit configured to act as BER Test Unit.

phySerIfBertSpurious.name: phySerIfBertSpurious
phySerIfBertSpurious.description: This parameter is used to obtain the number of frames received with an invalid sequence number during the BER test. This parameter is applicable to a unit configured to act as BER Test Unit.

phySerIfBertLostFrames.name: phySerIfBertLostFrames
phySerIfBertLostFrames.description: The Bert lost frames request parameter is used to obtain the number of frames which were not received during the BER test. This parameter is only applicable to a unit configured to act as a BER Test unit.

phySerIfBertAcceptableFrames.name: phySerIfBertAcceptableFrames
phySerIfBertAcceptableFrames.description: This parameter is used to obtain the number of frames which were received and processed during the BER test. This parameter is only applicable to a unit configured to act as BER Test Unit.

phySerIfBertErroredFrames.name: phySerIfBertErroredFrames
phySerIfBertErroredFrames.description: This parameter is used to obtain the number of processed frames which were found to contain at least one bit error during the BER test. This parameter is only applicable to a unit configured to act as BER Test Unit.

phySerIfBertTestTime.name: phySerIfBertTestTime
phySerIfBertTestTime.description: The BERT test time request parameter is used to obtain the duration (in seconds) of the BER test. This parameter is only applicable to a unit configured to act as BER Test Unit.

phySerIfBertBitErrors.name: phySerIfBertBitErrors
phySerIfBertBitErrors.description: This parameter is used to obtain the total number of bit errors seen in the BER test. This parameter is applicable to a unit configured to act as a BER Test Unit.

phySerIfBertErroredSecs.name: phySerIfBertErroredSecs
phySerIfBertErroredSecs.description: This parameter is used to obtain the number of seconds of the BERT Test in which a bit error was detected. This parameter is only applicable to a unit configured to act as BER Test Unit.

phySerIfBertFrameSizes.name: phySerIfBertFrameSizes
phySerIfBertFrameSizes.description: This is used to obtain the size of the test frames used in the BER test. (This parameter in conjunction with the number of acceptable frames is used to obtain the total number of bits received during the BER test). This parameter is only applicable to a unit configured to act as BER Test Unit.

phySerIfBertBouncedFrames.name: phySerIfBertBouncedFrames
phySerIfBertBouncedFrames.description: This parameter is used to obtain the number of frames which the BERT Echo Unit has received and sent back to the sender. This parameter is only applicable to a unit configured to act as BER Test Echo Unit.

phySerIfBertTxFrames.name: phySerIfBertTxFrames
phySerIfBertTxFrames.description: This parameter is used to obtain the number of frames that were transmitted.

phySerIfBertRxFrames.name: phySerIfBertRxFrames
phySerIfBertRxFrames.description: This parameter is used to obtain the number of frames received.

phySerIfRS449Table.name: phySerIfRS449Table
phySerIfRS449Table.description: A table of RS449 specific parameters.

phySerIfRS449Entry.name: phySerIfRS449Entry
phySerIfRS449Entry.description: An entry of RS449 specific parameters.

phySerIfRS449Index.name: phySerIfRS449Index
phySerIfRS449Index.description: The value of the index uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is applicable.

phySerIfRS449Clock.name: phySerIfRS449Clock
phySerIfRS449Clock.description: This parameter determines the rate for the internal clock.

phySerIfRS449LocalLoopback.name: phySerIfRS449LocalLoopback
phySerIfRS449LocalLoopback.description: If this object is set to a value of enable(1) then this port will request the local modem port to perform a loopback function. If the value returned is disabled(2) this indicated that the local modem port has not been requested to perform any loopback function.

phySerIfRS449RemoteLoopback.name: phySerIfRS449RemoteLoopback
phySerIfRS449RemoteLoopback.description: If this object is set to a value of enable(1) then this port will request the remote modem port to perform a loopback function. If the value returned is disabled(2) this indicated that the remote modem port has not been requested to perform any loopback function.

phySerIfRS449BackToBack.name: phySerIfRS449BackToBack
phySerIfRS449BackToBack.description: This parameter is used to enable or disable the onboard clock to allow the back to back working of two units.

phySerIfv35Table.name: phySerIfv35Table
phySerIfv35Table.description: A table of V.35 specific parameters.

phySerIfv35Entry.name: phySerIfv35Entry
phySerIfv35Entry.description: An entry of V.35 specific parameters.

phySerIfv35Index.name: phySerIfv35Index
phySerIfv35Index.description: The value of the index uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is applicable.

phySerIfv35BackToBack.name: phySerIfv35BackToBack
phySerIfv35BackToBack.description: This parameter is used to enable or disable the onboard clock to allow the back to back working of two units.

phySerIfv35Clock.name: phySerIfv35Clock
phySerIfv35Clock.description: This parameter determines the rate for the internal clock.

phySerIfv35LocalLoopback.name: phySerIfv35LocalLoopback
phySerIfv35LocalLoopback.description: If this object is set to a value of enable(1) then this port will request the local modem port to perform a loopback function. If the value returned is disabled(2) this indicated that the local modem port has not been requested to perform any loopback function.

phySerIfv35RemoteLoopback.name: phySerIfv35RemoteLoopback
phySerIfv35RemoteLoopback.description: If this object is set to a value of enable(1) then this port will request the remote modem port to perform a loopback function. If the value returned is disabled(2) this indicated that the remote modem port has not been requested to perform any loopback function.

phySerIfRS232Table.name: phySerIfRS232Table
phySerIfRS232Table.description: A table of RS232 specific parameters.

phySerIfRS232Entry.name: phySerIfRS232Entry
phySerIfRS232Entry.description: An entry of RS232 specific parameters.

phySerIfRS232Index.name: phySerIfRS232Index
phySerIfRS232Index.description: The value of the index uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is appliacble.

phySerIfRS232BackToBack.name: phySerIfRS232BackToBack
phySerIfRS232BackToBack.description: This parameter is used to enable or disable the onboard clock to allow the back to back working of two units.

phySerIfRS232Clock.name: phySerIfRS232Clock
phySerIfRS232Clock.description: This parameter determines the rate for the internal clock.

phySerIfRS232LocalLoopback.name: phySerIfRS232LocalLoopback
phySerIfRS232LocalLoopback.description: If this object is set to a value of enable(1) then this port will request the local modem port to perform a loopback function. If the value returned is disabled(2) this indicated that the local modem port has not been requested to perform any loopback function.

phySerIfRS232RemoteLoopback.name: phySerIfRS232RemoteLoopback
phySerIfRS232RemoteLoopback.description: If this object is set to a value of enable(1) then this port will request the remote modem port to perform a loopback function. If the value returned is disabled(2) this indicated that the remote modem port has not been requested to perform any loopback function.

phySerIfG703Table.name: phySerIfG703Table
phySerIfG703Table.description: A table of G703 specific parameters.

phySerIfG703Entry.name: phySerIfG703Entry
phySerIfG703Entry.description: An entry of G703 specific parameters.

phySerIfG703Index.name: phySerIfG703Index
phySerIfG703Index.description: The value of the index uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is appliacble.

phySerIfG703LocalLoopback.name: phySerIfG703LocalLoopback
phySerIfG703LocalLoopback.description: If this object is set to a value of enable(1) then this port will request the local modem port to perform a loopback function. If the value returned is disabled(2) this indicated that the local modem port has not been requested to perform any loopback function.

phySerIfG703RemoteLoopback.name: phySerIfG703RemoteLoopback
phySerIfG703RemoteLoopback.description: If this object is set to a value of enable(1) then this port will request the remote modem port to perform a loopback function. If the value returned is disabled(2) this indicated that the remote modem port has not been requested to perform any loopback function.

phySerIf10base5Index.name: phySerIf10base5Index
phySerIf10base5Index.description: The value of the index uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is applicable.

phySerIf10base5SenseSQEs.name: phySerIf10base5SenseSQEs
phySerIf10base5SenseSQEs.description: Enables or disables the SQE counter.

mlinkTable.name: mlinkTable
mlinkTable.description: The multilink Table containing all the multilink objects.

mlinkTableEntry.name: mlinkTableEntry
mlinkTableEntry.description: Each entry contains configurables for each logical port on the unit that supports multilink.

mlinkPortIndex.name: mlinkPortIndex
mlinkPortIndex.description: This is the logical port number which supports multilink. An entry for this port will only exist if the logical port is attached to a physical port which is using the Retixwan link protocol.

mlinkOperation.name: mlinkOperation
mlinkOperation.description: This object enables/disables multilink on this port.

mlinkStandbyThreshold.name: mlinkStandbyThreshold
mlinkStandbyThreshold.description: This is used to determine the line speed level at which the multilink module will check to see if channels can be made standby. If any channels have a line speed greater than this threshold value, then the multilink module picks out the best channels and makes them active, making any others standby. If no channels have line speeds greater than this, then all channels are used and there are none in standby mode.

mlinkLostFrameTimer.name: mlinkLostFrameTimer
mlinkLostFrameTimer.description: This is the Lost Frame Timer. It starts when an out of sequence frame is received, and is not reset until the next expected frame is received. If it expires then the frames between the last received, and the current out-of-sequence frame, are considered to be lost. This timer is in millisecs, but the granularity of the operating value is 50ms, so the value set, is rounded up to the nearest 50ms.

mlinkWindow.name: mlinkWindow
mlinkWindow.description: This is the multilink window size.

mlinkState.name: mlinkState
mlinkState.description: This indicates whether the multilink protocol has been established between the remote partners.

mlinkTotalThroughput.name: mlinkTotalThroughput
mlinkTotalThroughput.description: This is the sum of the line speeds for all the active channels( both standby and active ) supporting multilink on this logical port.

mlinkActiveThroughput.name: mlinkActiveThroughput
mlinkActiveThroughput.description: This is the sum of the line speeds for all the active channels supporting multilink on this logical port.

mlinkMinTransitDelay.name: mlinkMinTransitDelay
mlinkMinTransitDelay.description: This is the minimum transit delay( in millisecs) for the active channels supporting multilink. If this is not known, then this will return -1.

mlinkMaxTransitDelay.name: mlinkMaxTransitDelay
mlinkMaxTransitDelay.description: This is the maximum transit delay( in millisecs ) for the active channels supporting multilink. If this is not known, then this will return -1.

mlinkActiveChannels.name: mlinkActiveChannels
mlinkActiveChannels.description: This is the number of active channels supporting multilink for this port.

mlinkStandbyChannels.name: mlinkStandbyChannels
mlinkStandbyChannels.description: This is the number of channels which are in standby which support multilink for this port.

mlinkRxInvalidFrames.name: mlinkRxInvalidFrames
mlinkRxInvalidFrames.description: This is the number of frames received but discarded due to being too big, or having invalid seq. Numbers, etc.

mlinkTxInvalidFrames.name: mlinkTxInvalidFrames
mlinkTxInvalidFrames.description: This is the number of frames to be transmitted but discarded due to being too big, or having invalid seq. Numbers, etc.

mlinkRxDiscBadSeqNumFrames.name: mlinkRxDiscBadSeqNumFrames
mlinkRxDiscBadSeqNumFrames.description: This is the number of frames discarded due to the multilink sequence number being out of range.

mlinkLostFrames.name: mlinkLostFrames
mlinkLostFrames.description: This is the number of frames for which the Lost Frame Timer has expired.

mlinkProtocolResets.name: mlinkProtocolResets
mlinkProtocolResets.description: This is the number of multilink protocol resets that have occurred since the creation of this logical port.

lapbPortConfigTable.name: lapbPortConfigTable
