lapbPortConfigTable.description: This table contains the LAPB Port Information.

lapbPortConfigEntry.name: lapbPortConfigEntry
lapbPortConfigEntry.description: An Entry in this table contains information about each physical port in the system that is configured with lapb as its physical port protocol.

lapbPCIndex.name: lapbPCIndex
lapbPCIndex.description: This object is the Physical Port to which this table entry refers.

lapbPCT1AckTimer.name: lapbPCT1AckTimer
lapbPCT1AckTimer.description: The default T1 timer for this interface. This specifies the maximum time in Milliseconds to wait for acknowledgement of a PDU.

lapbPCT3DiscTimer.name: lapbPCT3DiscTimer
lapbPCT3DiscTimer.description: The T3 timer for this interface. This specifies the time in Milliseconds to wait before considering the link disconnected. A value of zero indicates the link will be considered disconnected upon completion of the frame exchange to disconnect the link. This value should be set larger than T1 * N2

lapbPCN2ReTxCount.name: lapbPCN2ReTxCount
lapbPCN2ReTxCount.description: The default N2 retry counter for this interface. This specifies the number of times a PDU will be resent after the T1 timer expires without an acknowledgement for the PDU.

lapbPCN1FrameSize.name: lapbPCN1FrameSize
lapbPCN1FrameSize.description: The default maximum N1 frame size desired in number of bits for a frame the DCE/remote DTE transmits to this DTE. This excludes flags and 0 bits inserted for transparency. The frame size is assumed to be the same size for both directions of data transfer.

lapbPCLocalAddress.name: lapbPCLocalAddress
lapbPCLocalAddress.description: This is the Local LAPB Address of this port. This determines the station type of the interface. The remote address will be the complement of the setting of the local address.

lapbPCSeqNumbering.name: lapbPCSeqNumbering
lapbPCSeqNumbering.description: This object tells us the sequence numbering method in use on this port. It is either modulo8, i.e. frames are numbered between 0 and 7, or modulo128, where frames are numbered between 0 and 128. This object will limit the value which can be set for lapbKWindowSize.

lapbPCKWindowSize.name: lapbPCKWindowSize
lapbPCKWindowSize.description: The window size used for both directions of data transfer on this Interface. This is the maximum number of unacknowledged sequenced PDUs that may be outstanding from this unit at any one time. This object can take values 1..7 when SeqNumbering has a value of mod8, and values 1,3,7,15,31,63,127 when SeqNumbering has a value mod128.

lapbPCMaxRxQueueLength.name: lapbPCMaxRxQueueLength
lapbPCMaxRxQueueLength.description: This is the Maximum No. of frames that can be queued up on the receive queue of the LAPB controller. Values allowed are 1,2,4,8,16,32,64,128.- what the chip supports.

lapbPCMaxTxQueueLength.name: lapbPCMaxTxQueueLength
lapbPCMaxTxQueueLength.description: This is the Maximum No. of frames that can be queued up for transmission on the transmit queue of the LAPB controller. Values allowed are 1,2,4,8,16,32,64,128. - what the chip supports.

lapbPortStatsTable.name: lapbPortStatsTable
lapbPortStatsTable.description: This table contains the LAPB Port Statistics Information.

lapbPortStatsEntry.name: lapbPortStatsEntry
lapbPortStatsEntry.description: An Entry in this table contains information about each physical port in the system that uses lapb.

lapbPSIndex.name: lapbPSIndex
lapbPSIndex.description: This object is the Physical Port to which this table entry refers.

lapbPSChannelState.name: lapbPSChannelState
lapbPSChannelState.description: This is the current state of the Lapb connection

lapbPST1Timeouts.name: lapbPST1Timeouts
lapbPST1Timeouts.description: The Count of T1 timer timeouts since the last link reset.

lapbPSTxFrames.name: lapbPSTxFrames
lapbPSTxFrames.description: The No. of LAPB frames Transmitted since the last link reset

lapbPSTxRejects.name: lapbPSTxRejects
lapbPSTxRejects.description: The No. of reject frames transmitted.

lapbPSRxFrames.name: lapbPSRxFrames
lapbPSRxFrames.description: The No. of LAPB frames Received since the last link reset

lapbPSRxRejects.name: lapbPSRxRejects
lapbPSRxRejects.description: The No. of reject frames received.

lapbPSRxFrameRejects.name: lapbPSRxFrameRejects
lapbPSRxFrameRejects.description: The No. of frame-reject frames received.

lapbPSRxRunts.name: lapbPSRxRunts
lapbPSRxRunts.description: The No of Runt frames, that is frames of length shorter than the minimum length, received.

lapbPSRxBadFrames.name: lapbPSRxBadFrames
lapbPSRxBadFrames.description: The No. of Bad frames received.

rtxWanTable.name: rtxWanTable
rtxWanTable.description: The Parameters for the Retix Wan Interface. There will be an entry in this table for each physical port which is configured with a physical port protocol - Retixwan

rtxWanEntry.name: rtxWanEntry
rtxWanEntry.description: The Parameters for the Retix Wan Interface.

rtxWanIfIndex.name: rtxWanIfIndex
rtxWanIfIndex.description: The value of the index uniquely specifies the physical port for which this entry is applicable.

rtxWanT1Mode.name: rtxWanT1Mode
rtxWanT1Mode.description: LAPB T1 Calculation. This parameter is used to enable the calculation of the value for the LAPB T1 Timer by the WAN Protocol Handler. When disabled, a pre-configured value is used. By default, the WAN Protocol Handler calculates the value for the LAPB T1 Timer.

rtxWanT1Value.name: rtxWanT1Value
rtxWanT1Value.description: LAPB T1 Timer Value. This parameter is used to pre-configure the LAPB T1 Timer when it is to not to be calculated by the WAN Protocol Handler. This parameter is specified in units of milliseconds.

rtxWanRetry.name: rtxWanRetry
rtxWanRetry.description: LAPB Retry Limit. This parameter indicates the maximum number of attempts to be made to complete the successful transmission of a frame. The default value for this parameter is 4.

rtxWanBlockSize.name: rtxWanBlockSize
rtxWanBlockSize.description: Block Size. The value of this parameter indicates the block size, in bytes, to be indicated to the remote partner in the link negotiate packets sent. This however cannot be assumed to be the value of the actual block size to be used on the link, as it will be the smaller of this value and that indicated by the remote unix. The default value for the block size is 552 bytes.

rtxWanNegBlockSize.name: rtxWanNegBlockSize
rtxWanNegBlockSize.description: Negotiated Block Size. The value returned for this parameter is the negotiated physical block size in bytes. When the block size has not been negotiated, the configured block size is returned. This parameter is specified in units of bytes.

rtxWanMeasuredDelay.name: rtxWanMeasuredDelay
rtxWanMeasuredDelay.description: Measured Network Transit Delay. The value returned for this parameter will be the result of the measured transit delay in milliseconds for the link. A value of -1 indicates that the delay has not been measured.

rtxWanMeasuredLineSpeed.name: rtxWanMeasuredLineSpeed
rtxWanMeasuredLineSpeed.description: This parameter is a measure of the links speed in bits per second.

tkrPortTable.name: tkrPortTable
tkrPortTable.description: Table of Token Ring per Port parameters.

tkrPortEntry.name: tkrPortEntry
tkrPortEntry.description: Entries of Table of Source Routing per port parameters.

tkrPortIndex.name: tkrPortIndex
tkrPortIndex.description: The physical port for which this entry applies.

tkrNoOfLinkResets.name: tkrNoOfLinkResets
tkrNoOfLinkResets.description: This object is a count of the number of resets which have occurred on this Token Ring link, since the last reinitialization of the unit.

tkrLastLinkResetReason.name: tkrLastLinkResetReason
tkrLastLinkResetReason.description: This object gives the a reason code for the last reset which occurred on this Token ring port.

tkrTimeSinceLastLinkReset.name: tkrTimeSinceLastLinkReset
tkrTimeSinceLastLinkReset.description: This is a time (in hundredths of seconds) since the last link reset, eg. the time since the link last went down. The value of this object is zero if no link resets have occurred since the last reinitialization of the unit.

ipxRouting.name: ipxRouting
ipxRouting.description: This object is used to enable or disable IPX routing. It indicates whether the unit is functioning as an IPX router. A value of 1 is used to enable IPX routing while a value of 2 is used to disable it. The default value is Disable(2).

ipxSecurity.name: ipxSecurity
ipxSecurity.description: This parameter is used to enable or disable the security features for the IPX protocol.

ipxInternetBcastProcessing.name: ipxInternetBcastProcessing
ipxInternetBcastProcessing.description: This parameter is used to enable or disable the Internet broadcast processing feature. If the value is enabled(1), then IPX internet broadcast packets are processed otherwise they are discarded.

ipxTotalInHdrErrors.name: ipxTotalInHdrErrors
ipxTotalInHdrErrors.description: The total number of IPX datagrams received by the unit and discarded due to having a bad checksum, incorrect length or a hop count expiry (i.e. a hop count value of 0).

ipxTotalAccessViolations.name: ipxTotalAccessViolations
ipxTotalAccessViolations.description: This is the total number of IPX datagrams received by the unit and discarded because they were not permitted access to the network.

ipxTotalInDiscards.name: ipxTotalInDiscards
ipxTotalInDiscards.description: This is the total number of IPX datagrams received by the unit and discarded because the internal queues are full.

ipxTotalOutDiscards.name: ipxTotalOutDiscards
ipxTotalOutDiscards.description: This is the total number of IPX datagrams received by the unit and discarded because the transmit queues are full.

ipxTotalOtherDiscards.name: ipxTotalOtherDiscards
ipxTotalOtherDiscards.description: This is the total number of IPX datagrams received by the unit and discarded for other reasons, such as an incorrectly configured WAN port.

ipxTotalTransmittedDgms.name: ipxTotalTransmittedDgms
ipxTotalTransmittedDgms.description: This is total number of IPX datagrams which have been transmitted by the unit.

ipxTotalReceivedDgms.name: ipxTotalReceivedDgms
ipxTotalReceivedDgms.description: This is the total number of IPX datagrams which have been received by the unit.

ipxTotalForwardedDgms.name: ipxTotalForwardedDgms
ipxTotalForwardedDgms.description: The number of IPX datagrams for which this entry was not their final destination, as a result of which an attempt was made to find a route to forward them to that final destination.

ipxTotalRxNotRoutedDgms.name: ipxTotalRxNotRoutedDgms
ipxTotalRxNotRoutedDgms.description: This is the total number of IPX datagrams received and then discarded by the unit because no route is available.

ipxTotalInDelivers.name: ipxTotalInDelivers
ipxTotalInDelivers.description: This is the total number of IPX datagrams received and then passed to the upper layers.

ipxTotalInAddrErrors.name: ipxTotalInAddrErrors
ipxTotalInAddrErrors.description: This is a count of the total number of IPX frames which were received and then discarded due to having a bad IPX address value.

ipxRoutingInformationTable.name: ipxRoutingInformationTable
ipxRoutingInformationTable.description: This is a list of the entries in the IPX Routing Information Table.

ipxRITEntry.name: ipxRITEntry
ipxRITEntry.description: This is an entry in the IPX Routing Information Table.

ipxRITDestNwkNumber.name: ipxRITDestNwkNumber
ipxRITDestNwkNumber.description: This string contains the IPX Network Number. The address contained in the returned string is in hexadecimal form. If the network number is not a full 4 bytes long, then it is zero-filled, e.g. a network number, 0x234fd will appear as 0x000234fd.

ipxRITGwyHostAddress.name: ipxRITGwyHostAddress
ipxRITGwyHostAddress.description: This is the Host Address or the gateway to the network specified by the corresponding ipxRITNwkNumber.

ipxRITHopCount.name: ipxRITHopCount
ipxRITHopCount.description: This is the hop count to reach the specified network. It has a range of values from 0 to 15.

ipxRITDelay.name: ipxRITDelay
ipxRITDelay.description: This is the estimated delay to reach the specified network.

ipxRITInterface.name: ipxRITInterface
ipxRITInterface.description: This is the interface through which the IPX datagram is routed to the gateway identified by the corresponding entry for ipxRITGwyHostAddress.

ipxRITDirectConnect.name: ipxRITDirectConnect
ipxRITDirectConnect.description: This object is used to indicate whether the gateway is directly connected or not. If the value of this object is direct(1), this indicates a directly connected gateway, if the value is indirect(2) then the gateway is not directly connected.

ipxRITAge.name: ipxRITAge
ipxRITAge.description: This is the age of this entry.

ipxSAPBinderyTable.name: ipxSAPBinderyTable
ipxSAPBinderyTable.description: This is the Service Advertising Protocol Table which holds information about the different servers visible to the device.

ipxSAPBinderyEntry.name: ipxSAPBinderyEntry
ipxSAPBinderyEntry.description: This is an entry in the SAP Bindery Table.

ipxSAPBinderyType.name: ipxSAPBinderyType
ipxSAPBinderyType.description: This is the type of the server whose IPX address is given by ipxSAPBinderyServerIPXAddress.

ipxSAPBinderyServerIPXAddress.name: ipxSAPBinderyServerIPXAddress
ipxSAPBinderyServerIPXAddress.description: This string contains the network number and host address, i.e. the IPX address of an IPX Server.

ipxSAPBinderyServerName.name: ipxSAPBinderyServerName
ipxSAPBinderyServerName.description: This is the name of the server. It is a textual string up to 48 characters long.

ipxSAPBinderyHopCount.name: ipxSAPBinderyHopCount
ipxSAPBinderyHopCount.description: This is the hop count to reach the specified server. This object can take any value in the range 0 to 15.

ipxSAPBinderySocket.name: ipxSAPBinderySocket
ipxSAPBinderySocket.description: This is the number of the socket at which the server provides the service.

ipxIfConfigTable.name: ipxIfConfigTable
ipxIfConfigTable.description: This table contains a list of objects which are used to configure an IPX logical port.

ipxIfCfgEntry.name: ipxIfCfgEntry
ipxIfCfgEntry.description: This is an entry in the IPX interfaces table.

ipxIfCfgIndex.name: ipxIfCfgIndex
ipxIfCfgIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the logical port to which this entry is applicable.

ipxIfRoutingFlag.name: ipxIfRoutingFlag
ipxIfRoutingFlag.description: The value of this object indicates the current state of IPX routing on the logical port.

ipxIfNwkNumber.name: ipxIfNwkNumber
ipxIfNwkNumber.description: This string contains this interface`s IPX Network Number. The address contained in the returned string is in hexadecimal form. If the network number is not a full 4 bytes long, then it is zero-filled, e.g. a network number, 0x234fd will appear as 0x000234fd.

ipxIfHostAddress.name: ipxIfHostAddress
ipxIfHostAddress.description: This is the host address for the LP. The combination of the ipxIfNwkNumber and this object gives the full IPX address for the LP. If the LP is attached to a LAN PP then this object will have the same value as the MAC address of the PP. For a WAN PP, the host address takes the value of the unit host address, i.e. the lowest MAC Address on the system

ipxIfLANEncapsulation.name: ipxIfLANEncapsulation
ipxIfLANEncapsulation.description: This is the datagram encapsulation which applies to the interface. The default value is IEEE802.3(1). A Token Ring logical port will only support iee802-2(3) encapsulation.

ipxIfDisposition.name: ipxIfDisposition
ipxIfDisposition.description: This parameter determines the action taken on a received IPX datagram if routing is disabled for this port, and the global routing flag is set to enabled (1). If routing is disabled for this port and this object has a value of discard (2), than all IPX datagrams received on this interface and not addressed to the unit,will be discarded.

ipxIfDelay.name: ipxIfDelay
ipxIfDelay.description: This is the delay associated with a specific path.

ipxIfAccessList1.name: ipxIfAccessList1
ipxIfAccessList1.description: The first entry in the AccessList Table which will be used by this port. This entry also associates a table of entries from the Security Table with this LP. A value of zero indicates that the default entry is used i.e. there is no access checking done at all.

ipxIfAccessList2.name: ipxIfAccessList2
ipxIfAccessList2.description: The second entry in the AccessList Table which will be used by this port. This entry also associates a table of entries from the Security Table with this LP. A value of zero indicates that the default entry is used i.e. there is no access checking done at all.

ipxIfRIPTimer.name: ipxIfRIPTimer
ipxIfRIPTimer.description: This timer controls the rate of generation of RIP messages and their transmission on this logical port.

ipxIfSAPTimer.name: ipxIfSAPTimer
ipxIfSAPTimer.description: This timer controls the rate of generation of SAP messages and their transmission on this logical port.

ipxIfSAPFilteringOutFlag.name: ipxIfSAPFilteringOutFlag
ipxIfSAPFilteringOutFlag.description: The value of this object indicates the current state of IPX Sap Filtering for outgoing Saps on the logical port.

ipxIfSAPFilteringInFlag.name: ipxIfSAPFilteringInFlag
ipxIfSAPFilteringInFlag.description: The value of this object indicates the current state of IPX Sap Filtering for incoming Saps on the logical port.

ipxIfSAPFilteringActionNoMatch.name: ipxIfSAPFilteringActionNoMatch
ipxIfSAPFilteringActionNoMatch.description: This object indicates the action to be taken for an incoming/outgoing Sap which does not match any entry in the Sap Filtering Table.

ipxAccessListTable.name: ipxAccessListTable
ipxAccessListTable.description: This is a table of the Access list parameters, these parameters are used to define particular security characteristics for an LP.

ipxAccessListEntry.name: ipxAccessListEntry
ipxAccessListEntry.description: An entry in the access list table. To set an entry in this table, ALL the objects must be present in a single SET PDU.

ipxAccessListIndex.name: ipxAccessListIndex
ipxAccessListIndex.description: This index uniquely identifies an entry in the access list table. Each LP can reference any two of these entries.

ipxTxCheck.name: ipxTxCheck
ipxTxCheck.description: Indicates whether checking of IPX packets to be transmitted, is enabled or not.

ipxNoMatchTxAction.name: ipxNoMatchTxAction
ipxNoMatchTxAction.description: When an IPX datagram is to be transmitted, the addressing information in the packet is compared against the filters in the security table. If there is a no match then the frame is either accepted (queued for transmission) or it is denied, depending on the value of this object.

ipxRxCheck.name: ipxRxCheck
ipxRxCheck.description: Indicates whether received IPX packets are checked or not.

ipxNoMatchRxAction.name: ipxNoMatchRxAction
ipxNoMatchRxAction.description: When an IPX datagram is to be received, the addressing information in the packet is compared against the filters in the security table. If there is a no match then the frame is either accepted or it is denied, depending on the value of this object.

ipxIfSecurityTable.name: ipxIfSecurityTable
ipxIfSecurityTable.description: A table of the interface security parameters.

ipxIfSecurityEntry.name: ipxIfSecurityEntry
ipxIfSecurityEntry.description: An entry in the security table. For each entry in the Access List Table, there is a list(table) of Security entries. Therefore, as each port has 2 access List entries associated with it, then the port has access to two separate lists of security entries within this table. To set an entry in this table, ALL the objects must be supplied in a single SET PDU.

ipxIfSecurityAccessListNum.name: ipxIfSecurityAccessListNum
ipxIfSecurityAccessListNum.description: The access list entry number with which this security entry is attached.

ipxIfSecurityIndex.name: ipxIfSecurityIndex
ipxIfSecurityIndex.description: An index into the security table.

ipxIfSecuritySrcNwkNum.name: ipxIfSecuritySrcNwkNum
ipxIfSecuritySrcNwkNum.description: The network number of the source. A value of zero means the entry applies to all networks.

ipxIfSecuritySrcHost.name: ipxIfSecuritySrcHost
ipxIfSecuritySrcHost.description: The source host address. If this is set to the Broadcast Address ( all f's ), then the entry applies to all hosts. The combination of this parameter and the ipxIfSecuritySrcNwkNum gives the full IPX address of the source.

ipxIfSecurityDestNwkNum.name: ipxIfSecurityDestNwkNum
ipxIfSecurityDestNwkNum.description: The network number of the destination. A value of zero means the entry applies to all networks.

ipxIfSecurityDestHost.name: ipxIfSecurityDestHost
ipxIfSecurityDestHost.description: The destination host address. If this is set to the Broadcast Address ( all f's ), then the entry applies to all hosts. The combination of this parameter and the ipxIfSecurityDestNwkNum gives the full IPX address of the destination.

ipxIfSecurityDestSocket.name: ipxIfSecurityDestSocket
ipxIfSecurityDestSocket.description: This parameter identifies the destination socket.

ipxIfSecurityAction.name: ipxIfSecurityAction
ipxIfSecurityAction.description: Indicates the action in case of a match occurring between the this filter and the addressing information in the IPX Packet.

ipxIfSecurityEntryType.name: ipxIfSecurityEntryType
ipxIfSecurityEntryType.description: This parameter is used to indicate whether the entry is to be added or removed from the ipxIfSecurityTable. If the value is valid(1) then this indicates that this is a request to add this entry to the table. A value of valid(1) is always returned to a GetRequest in the case where the entry exists.

ipxIfStatsTable.name: ipxIfStatsTable
ipxIfStatsTable.description: This table contains a list of all the statistics objects for an IPX logical port.

ipxIfStatsEntry.name: ipxIfStatsEntry
ipxIfStatsEntry.description: This is an entry in the IPX interface statistics table.

ipxIfStatsIndex.name: ipxIfStatsIndex
ipxIfStatsIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the logical port to which this entry is applicable.

ipxIfReceivedDgms.name: ipxIfReceivedDgms
ipxIfReceivedDgms.description: The number of IPX datagrams which have been received on this interface.

ipxIfTransmittedDgms.name: ipxIfTransmittedDgms
ipxIfTransmittedDgms.description: The number of IPX datagrams which have been transmitted on this interface.

ipxIfNoRouteDgms.name: ipxIfNoRouteDgms
ipxIfNoRouteDgms.description: This is the number of IPX datagrams which have been received on this interface and then discarded due to no route being found for them.

ipxIfDgmsInDelivers.name: ipxIfDgmsInDelivers
ipxIfDgmsInDelivers.description: This is the total number of IPX datagrams received on this interface and routed inwards to either SAP or RIP.

ipxIfInHdrErrors.name: ipxIfInHdrErrors
ipxIfInHdrErrors.description: This is a count of the number of IPX datagrams which have been received but discarded due to having an invalid checksum, incorrect length field or hop count expiry.

ipxIfInAddrErrors.name: ipxIfInAddrErrors
ipxIfInAddrErrors.description: This is a count of the number of IPX datagrams which have been received but discarded due to having an invalid IPX address.

ipxIfInDiscards.name: ipxIfInDiscards
ipxIfInDiscards.description: This is a count of the number of IPX datagrams which have been received on this port but discarded because the internal queue is full.

ipxIfInForwardedFrames.name: ipxIfInForwardedFrames
ipxIfInForwardedFrames.description: This is a count of the number of IPX datagrams which have been received and forwarded.

ipxIfOtherDiscards.name: ipxIfOtherDiscards
ipxIfOtherDiscards.description: This is a count of the number pf IPX datagrams which have been received on this port but discarded due to other reasons, such as an incorrectly configured WAN port.

ipxPPPConfigTable.name: ipxPPPConfigTable
ipxPPPConfigTable.description: This table contains objects which contain config information about the use of IPX over a logical port which is attached to a physical port which is running PPP.

ipxPPPConfigEntry.name: ipxPPPConfigEntry
ipxPPPConfigEntry.description: This is and entry in the IPX PPP status table. A SNMP error or noSuchName is returned to a request for an object in this table if the IPX port identified by the value of ipxIfIndex for this entry, is attached to a physical port which is not a PPP physical port.

ipxPPPConfigIfIndex.name: ipxPPPConfigIfIndex
ipxPPPConfigIfIndex.description: The value of the index uniquley specifies the logical port for which this entry is applicable.

ipxPPPAdminStatus.name: ipxPPPAdminStatus
ipxPPPAdminStatus.description: This is the immediate desired state of the IPX network protocol. Setting this object to open(1) will inject an administrative open event into the IPX network protocol's finite state machine. Setting this object to close(2) will inject an administrative close event into the IPX network protocol's finite state machine.

ipxPPPStatusTable.name: ipxPPPStatusTable
ipxPPPStatusTable.description: This table contains object which hold status information about PPP on a IPX port.

ipxPPPStatusEntry.name: ipxPPPStatusEntry
ipxPPPStatusEntry.description: This is and entry in the IPX PPP status table. A SNMP error or noSuchName is returned to a request for an object in this table if the IPX port identified by the value of ipxIfIndex for this entry, is attached to a physical port which is not a PPP physical port.

ipxPPPStatusIfIndex.name: ipxPPPStatusIfIndex
ipxPPPStatusIfIndex.description: The value of the index uniquley specifies the logical port for which this entry is applicable.

ipxPPPOperStatus.name: ipxPPPOperStatus
ipxPPPOperStatus.description: This is the current operational status of the IPX network protocol. If the value of this object is opened(1) then the finite state machine for the IPX protocol has reached the Opened state.

ipxPPPNegotiatedNetworkNumber.name: ipxPPPNegotiatedNetworkNumber
ipxPPPNegotiatedNetworkNumber.description: This is the IPX Network Number which has been negotiated by a local and remote IPXCP for use on this PPP port.

ipxSAPFiltering.name: ipxSAPFiltering
ipxSAPFiltering.description: This parameter is used to enable or disable the SAP filtering feature. If the value is enabled(1), then IPX SAP packets are filtered on the ports which have outgoing and/or incoming SAP filtering enabled.

ipxSAPFilterTestEntry.name: ipxSAPFilterTestEntry
ipxSAPFilterTestEntry.description: Each entry is a Test to be applied to SAP frames on any particular port. There can be up to 30 entries in the table. Each test is carried out in the following manner:-

ipxSAPFilterTestIndex.name: ipxSAPFilterTestIndex
ipxSAPFilterTestIndex.description: This is the entry index number.

ipxSAPFilterTestType.name: ipxSAPFilterTestType
ipxSAPFilterTestType.description: This is the type of the server whose IPX address is given by ipxSAPFilterTestServerIPXAddr.

ipxSAPFilterTestIPXAddr.name: ipxSAPFilterTestIPXAddr
ipxSAPFilterTestIPXAddr.description: This string contains the network number and host address, i.e the IPX address of an IPX Server.

ipxSAPFilterTestSrvName.name: ipxSAPFilterTestSrvName
ipxSAPFilterTestSrvName.description: This is the name of the server. It is a textual string up to 48 characters long.

ipxSAPFilterTestHopCount.name: ipxSAPFilterTestHopCount
ipxSAPFilterTestHopCount.description: This is the hop count to reach the specified server. This object can take any value in the range 0 to 15.

ipxSAPFilterTestSocket.name: ipxSAPFilterTestSocket
ipxSAPFilterTestSocket.description: This is the number of the socket at which the server provides the service.

ipxSAPFilterStmtEntry.name: ipxSAPFilterStmtEntry
ipxSAPFilterStmtEntry.description: Each entry is a Test statement. There are up to 30 entries per port. Each entry links a Test with the actions to be carried out depending on the test's success or failure. To set an entry in the table, all the objects must be present in the SET PDU.

ipxSFStmtPortNumber.name: ipxSFStmtPortNumber
ipxSFStmtPortNumber.description: This is the Logical Port No. for which the table exists.

ipxSFStmtIndex.name: ipxSFStmtIndex
ipxSFStmtIndex.description: This is the table index number

ipxSFStmtTestName.name: ipxSFStmtTestName
ipxSFStmtTestName.description: This is the name of the Test to apply for this statement. It should match a Test name in the ipx SAP Filter Test Table. It is an ascii string, of up to 20 characters.

ipxSFStmtActionOnSuccess.name: ipxSFStmtActionOnSuccess
ipxSFStmtActionOnSuccess.description: If an incoming/outgoing SAP matches the filter test indexed in this table, then the SAP is either allowed into the SAP Bindery table (incoming filtering), or send out on this port (outgoing filtering).

dcntRouting.name: dcntRouting
dcntRouting.description: This object defines whether DECnet Routing has been enabled or not. DECnet routing may only be enabled if a valid DECnet address has been configured for the device. If a valid address has not been configured then a SetRequest to enable dcntRouting will cause a badValue error to be generated.

dcntRoutingLevel.name: dcntRoutingLevel
dcntRoutingLevel.description: This object will always return a value of level1(1).

dcntAreaAddress.name: dcntAreaAddress
dcntAreaAddress.description: This is the DECnet area identification number. It can take on any value between 1 and 63. If this object's value is set to zero then the DECnet address is deleted. This operation can only be performed if decnetRouting {decnet 1} had been disabled. If an attempt is made to set this object to a value of zero while dcntRouting is enabled, a badValue error will be generated.

dcntNodeAddress.name: dcntNodeAddress
dcntNodeAddress.description: This is the node address of the device. It can take on any value in the range 1 to 1023. If the dcntAreaAddress is zero i.e. the decnetAddress has been cleared, then the value returned to a GetRequest on this object will also be zero.

dcntInterAreaMaxCost.name: dcntInterAreaMaxCost
dcntInterAreaMaxCost.description: This is the maximum cost possible in a path to a reachable area in which his device is situated.

dcntInterAreaMaxHops.name: dcntInterAreaMaxHops
dcntInterAreaMaxHops.description: This is the maximum number of hops allowed in a path to another reachable area.

dcntIntraAreaMaxCost.name: dcntIntraAreaMaxCost
dcntIntraAreaMaxCost.description: The maximum cost possible in a path from the device to a reachable node within the same area.

dcntIntraAreaMaxHops.name: dcntIntraAreaMaxHops
dcntIntraAreaMaxHops.description: This is the maximum number of hops allowed from this device to a reachable node within the same area.

dcntMaxVisits.name: dcntMaxVisits
dcntMaxVisits.description: This is the maximum number of nodes which a data packet can traverse before being discarded.

dcntRtngMsgTimerBCT1.name: dcntRtngMsgTimerBCT1
dcntRtngMsgTimerBCT1.description: This is the maximum time period between broadcasted routing messages on the Ethernet.

dcntRateControlFreqTimerT2.name: dcntRateControlFreqTimerT2
dcntRateControlFreqTimerT2.description: This is the rate control frequency timer.

dcntSecurity.name: dcntSecurity
dcntSecurity.description: This parameter is used to enable or disable the security features for the DECnet protocol.

dcntSplitPathRouting.name: dcntSplitPathRouting
dcntSplitPathRouting.description: This object is used to enable or disable split path routing for the DECnet protocol. If this object has a value of enabled(1) then the router will try several path to reach a destination.

dcntTotalReceivedDgms.name: dcntTotalReceivedDgms
dcntTotalReceivedDgms.description: This is the total count of all DECnet datagrams received by the device on all interfaces. This count includes data packets, hello messages and routing messages.

dcntTotalTransmittedDgms.name: dcntTotalTransmittedDgms
dcntTotalTransmittedDgms.description: This is the total count of all DECnet datagrams transmitted by the device on all interfaces.

dcntTotalForwardedDgms.name: dcntTotalForwardedDgms
dcntTotalForwardedDgms.description: This is a count of the total number of data packets which have been forwarded by the device on all interfaces.

dcntTotalOutRequestedDgms.name: dcntTotalOutRequestedDgms
dcntTotalOutRequestedDgms.description: This is a count of the total number of DECnet hello messages and DECnet routing messages which have been transmitted by the device.

dcntTotalInDiscards.name: dcntTotalInDiscards
dcntTotalInDiscards.description: This is a count of the total number of DECnet packets which have been received, but discarded. These packets are discarded by the DECnet protocol level.

dcntTotalOutDiscards.name: dcntTotalOutDiscards
dcntTotalOutDiscards.description: This is a count of the total number of DECnet packets which have been discarded due to a lack of internal resources. These packets are discarded by the DECnet protocol layer.

dcntTotalNoRoutes.name: dcntTotalNoRoutes
dcntTotalNoRoutes.description: This is the total number of DECnet packets for which no route could be found.

dcntTotalInHdrErrors.name: dcntTotalInHdrErrors
dcntTotalInHdrErrors.description: This is a count of the total number of DECnet packets found with an invalid header in the data packet.

dcntTotalInAddrErrors.name: dcntTotalInAddrErrors
dcntTotalInAddrErrors.description: This is a count of the total number of DECnet packets received but discarded because the destination address was not a valid address for this entity.

dcntTotalInDelivers.name: dcntTotalInDelivers
dcntTotalInDelivers.description: This is a count of the total number of DECnet packets which have been successfully delivered to DECnet Routing Protocols.

dcntTotalOtherDiscards.name: dcntTotalOtherDiscards
dcntTotalOtherDiscards.description: This is a count of the total number of DECnet packets which which have been received on this port but discarded due to other reasons, such as an incorrectly configured WAN port.

dcntTotalAccessViolations.name: dcntTotalAccessViolations
dcntTotalAccessViolations.description: This is a count of the total number of access violations which have occurred.

dcntIfCfgTable.name: dcntIfCfgTable
dcntIfCfgTable.description: This is a table of configuration parameters for a DECnet circuit.

dcntIfCfgTableEntry.name: dcntIfCfgTableEntry
dcntIfCfgTableEntry.description: This is an entry in the configuration table.

dcntIfCfgIndex.name: dcntIfCfgIndex
dcntIfCfgIndex.description: This index uniquely identifies the logical port to which this entry is applicable.

dcntIfCfgRouting.name: dcntIfCfgRouting
dcntIfCfgRouting.description: The value of this object indicates the current state of DECnet routing on the interface. If the global Routing flag is not enabled, then this has no effect.

dcntIfCfgDisposition.name: dcntIfCfgDisposition
dcntIfCfgDisposition.description: This parameter determines the action taken on a received DECnet datagram if routing is disabled for this port, and the global routing flag is set to enabled (1). If routing is disabled for this port and this object has a value of discard (2), than all DECnet datagrams received on this interface and not addressed to the unit,will be discarded.

dcntIfCfgRtrPriority.name: dcntIfCfgRtrPriority
dcntIfCfgRtrPriority.description: This is the priority associated with this interface, it is used to determine the designated route. The interface with the highest priority is the designated route.

dcntIfCfgHelloTimerBCT3.name: dcntIfCfgHelloTimerBCT3
dcntIfCfgHelloTimerBCT3.description: This is the maximum time period between two hello messages, transmitted consecutively.

dcntIfCfgCost.name: dcntIfCfgCost
dcntIfCfgCost.description: This is the the cost which will be added to the path cost for this interface. There is one cost for each logical port.

dcntIfCfgAccessList1.name: dcntIfCfgAccessList1
dcntIfCfgAccessList1.description: The first entry in the AccessList Table which will be used by this port. This entry also associates a table of entries from the Security Table with this LP. A value of zero indicates that the default entry is used i.e. there is no access checking done at all.

dcntIfCfgAccessList2.name: dcntIfCfgAccessList2
dcntIfCfgAccessList2.description: The second entry in the AccessList Table which will be used by this port. This entry also associates a table of entries from the Security Table with this LP. A value of zero indicates that the default entry is used i.e. there is no access checking done at all.

dcntIfStatsTable.name: dcntIfStatsTable
dcntIfStatsTable.description: This is a table of statistics and status information for a DECnet logical port.

dcntIfStatsTableEntry.name: dcntIfStatsTableEntry
dcntIfStatsTableEntry.description: This is an entry in the status and statistics table.

dcntIfStatsIndex.name: dcntIfStatsIndex
dcntIfStatsIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the logical port to which this entry is applicable.

dcntIfDesignatedRouter.name: dcntIfDesignatedRouter
dcntIfDesignatedRouter.description: This parameter indicates if the router is the designated router on this interface. There is one designated router on each circuit. A value of designated (1) is returned to a Get request if the router is the designated router for this circuit, otherwise a value of notDesignated (2) is returned.

dcntIfReceivedDgms.name: dcntIfReceivedDgms
dcntIfReceivedDgms.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been received on this logical port.

dcntIfTransmittedDgms.name: dcntIfTransmittedDgms
dcntIfTransmittedDgms.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been transmitted on this logical port.

dcntIfNoRouteDgms.name: dcntIfNoRouteDgms
dcntIfNoRouteDgms.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been received on this logical port and then discarded due to no route being found for them.

dcntIfDgmsInDiscards.name: dcntIfDgmsInDiscards
dcntIfDgmsInDiscards.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been received on this logical port and then discarded due to the receive queue being full.

dcntIfInHdrErrors.name: dcntIfInHdrErrors
dcntIfInHdrErrors.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been received but discarded due to having an invalid checksum, incorrect length field or hop count expiry.

dcntIfFrowardedFrames.name: dcntIfFrowardedFrames
dcntIfFrowardedFrames.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been forwarded by this unit.

dcntIfInAddrErrors.name: dcntIfInAddrErrors
dcntIfInAddrErrors.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been received but discarded due to having an invalid address, for this unit.

dcntIfInDelivers.name: dcntIfInDelivers
dcntIfInDelivers.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been received and delivered user protocols.

dcntIfOtherDiscards.name: dcntIfOtherDiscards
dcntIfOtherDiscards.description: This is a count of the number of DECnet datagrams which have been discarded on this logical port due an error e.g. incorrect WAN configuration.

dcntRoutingTable.name: dcntRoutingTable
dcntRoutingTable.description: This is the DECnet routing information table.

dcntRITEntry.name: dcntRITEntry
dcntRITEntry.description: This is an entry in the routing information table, each entry specifies a particular node's routing information.

dcntRITDestNode.name: dcntRITDestNode
dcntRITDestNode.description: This is the address id of the node which uniquely identifies the node within a given area.

dcntRITNextHop.name: dcntRITNextHop
dcntRITNextHop.description: This is the address of the next hop in the path.

dcntRITCost.name: dcntRITCost
dcntRITCost.description: This is the path cost of this route.

dcntRITHops.name: dcntRITHops
dcntRITHops.description: This is the number of hops that have to be traversed to get to the destination.

dcntRITInterface.name: dcntRITInterface
dcntRITInterface.description: This is the logical port through which the DECnet datagram is routed to the gateway identified by the corresponding entry for dcntRITNextHop.

dcntAreaRoutingTable.name: dcntAreaRoutingTable
dcntAreaRoutingTable.description: This is the DECnet area routing table. Its entries are used to route packets from the area in which this device resides to other areas in the network. This table has a maximum of 63 entries.

dcntAreaRITEntry.name: dcntAreaRITEntry
dcntAreaRITEntry.description: An entry specifies a particular node's routing information.

dcntAreaRITDestArea.name: dcntAreaRITDestArea
dcntAreaRITDestArea.description: This is the area id of the node which uniquely identifies the node.

dcntAreaRITNextHop.name: dcntAreaRITNextHop
dcntAreaRITNextHop.description: This is the address of the next hop in the path.

dcntAreaRITCost.name: dcntAreaRITCost
dcntAreaRITCost.description: This is the path cost of this route.

dcntAreaRITHops.name: dcntAreaRITHops
dcntAreaRITHops.description: This is the number of hops between here and the destination.

dcntAreaRITInterface.name: dcntAreaRITInterface
dcntAreaRITInterface.description: This is the logical port through which the DECnet datagram is routed to the gateway identified by the corresponding entry for dcntAreaRITNextHop.

dcntAccessListTable.name: dcntAccessListTable
dcntAccessListTable.description: This is a table of the Access list parameters, these parameters are used to define the particular security characteristic for a logical port.

dcntAccessListEntry.name: dcntAccessListEntry
dcntAccessListEntry.description: An entry in the access table. To set an entry in this table all the objects must be present in a SET PDU.

dcntAccessListIndex.name: dcntAccessListIndex
dcntAccessListIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the entry in this table.

dcntTxCheck.name: dcntTxCheck
dcntTxCheck.description: Indicates whether checking of DECnet packets to be transmitted, is enabled or not.

dcntNoMatchTxAction.name: dcntNoMatchTxAction
dcntNoMatchTxAction.description: When a DECnet datagram is to be transmitted, the source and destination addresses are ANDed with their masks and compared with those in the security entry. This object indicates the action to be taken if these two don't match.

dcntRxCheck.name: dcntRxCheck
dcntRxCheck.description: Indicates whether received DECnet packets are checked or not.

dcntNoMatchRxAction.name: dcntNoMatchRxAction
dcntNoMatchRxAction.description: When a DECnet datagram is to be received, the source and destination addresses are ANDed with their masks and compared with those in the security entry. This object indicates the action to be taken if these two don't match.

dcntIfSecurityEntry.name: dcntIfSecurityEntry
dcntIfSecurityEntry.description: An entry in the security table. For each entry in the Access List Table, there is a list(table) of Security entries. Therefore, as each port has 2 access List entries associated with it, then the port has access to two separate lists of security entries within this table. To set an entry in this table, ALL the objects must be supplied in a single SET PDU.

dcntIfSecurityAccessListNum.name: dcntIfSecurityAccessListNum
dcntIfSecurityAccessListNum.description: The access list entry number with which this security entry is associated.

dcntIfSecurityIndex.name: dcntIfSecurityIndex
dcntIfSecurityIndex.description: An index into the security table.

dcntIfSecurityAction.name: dcntIfSecurityAction
dcntIfSecurityAction.description: Indicates the action in case of a match occurring between the src/dest addr in the DECnet packet rxd/txd and the src/dest addr in the security entry.

dcntIfSecuritySrcArea.name: dcntIfSecuritySrcArea
dcntIfSecuritySrcArea.description: The area number of the source. A value of 0 means that the entry refers to all areas

dcntIfSecuritySrcNode.name: dcntIfSecuritySrcNode
dcntIfSecuritySrcNode.description: The source node number. A value of 0 means that the entry refers to all nodes

dcntIfSecurityDestArea.name: dcntIfSecurityDestArea
dcntIfSecurityDestArea.description: The area number of the destination. A value of 0 means that the entry refers to all areas

dcntIfSecurityDestNode.name: dcntIfSecurityDestNode
dcntIfSecurityDestNode.description: The destination node number. A value of 0 means that the entry refers to all nodes

dcntIfSecurityEntryType.name: dcntIfSecurityEntryType
dcntIfSecurityEntryType.description: This parameter is used to indicate whether the entry is to be added or removed from the dcntIfSecurityTable. If the value is valid(1) then this indicates that this is a request to add this entry to the table. A value of valid(1) is always returned to a GetRequest in the case where the entry exists.

dcntPPPConfigTable.name: dcntPPPConfigTable
dcntPPPConfigTable.description: This table contains objects which hold information about the operation of a DECnet logical port, over a PPP physical port.

dcntPPPConfigEntry.name: dcntPPPConfigEntry
dcntPPPConfigEntry.description: This is and entry in the DECnet PPP status table. A SNMP error or noSuchName is returned to a request for an object in this table if the DECnet port identified by the value of dcntIfIndex for this entry, is attached to a physical port which is not a PPP physical port.

dcntPPPConfigIfIndex.name: dcntPPPConfigIfIndex
dcntPPPConfigIfIndex.description: The value of the index uniquley specifies the logical port for which this entry is applicable.

dcntPPPAdminStatus.name: dcntPPPAdminStatus
dcntPPPAdminStatus.description: This is the immediate desired state of the DECnet network protocol. Setting this object to open(1) will inject an administrative open event into the DECnet network protocol's finite state machine. Setting this object to close(2) will inject an administrative close event into the DECnet network protocol's finite state machine.

dcntPPPStatusTable.name: dcntPPPStatusTable
dcntPPPStatusTable.description: This table contains object which hold status information about PPP on a DECnet port.

dcntPPPStatusEntry.name: dcntPPPStatusEntry
dcntPPPStatusEntry.description: This is and entry in the DECnet PPP status table. A SNMP error or noSuchName is returned to a request for an object in this table if the IPX port identified by the value of ipxIfIndex for this entry, is attached to a physical port which is not a PPP physical port.

dcntPPPStatusIfIndex.name: dcntPPPStatusIfIndex
dcntPPPStatusIfIndex.description: The value of the index uniquley specifies the logical port for which this entry is applicable.

dcntPPPOperStatus.name: dcntPPPOperStatus
dcntPPPOperStatus.description: This is the current operational status of the DECnet network protocol. If the value of this object is opened(1) then the finite state machine for the DECnet protocol has reached the Opened state.

x25OperTable.name: x25OperTable
x25OperTable.description: The common operation parameters in use by the X.25 Packet Level Entity (PLE) on a physical interface..

x25OperPort.name: x25OperPort
x25OperPort.description: A value that uniquely identifies the X.25 PLE subnetwork (physical interface on the fp) and matches its physical port value.

x25OperComments.name: x25OperComments
x25OperComments.description: An ASCII comment string which describes the interface. This defaults to a NULL string

x25OperEnable.name: x25OperEnable
x25OperEnable.description: This object is an operation switch, it enables or disables the operation of x25 on the interface. Setting this parameter to enable from a disable condition will result in the transmission of a RESTART packet.

x25OperProtocolVersionSupported.name: x25OperProtocolVersionSupported
x25OperProtocolVersionSupported.description: This object is an operation switch, allowing the user to change the operating mode of x25 on this interface. A value of 1 sets the operating mode to 1980 operating mode, whereas a value of 5 sets it to 1984.

x25OperPacketSequencing.name: x25OperPacketSequencing
x25OperPacketSequencing.description: The modulus of the packet sequence number space. This object determines the maximum value for x25OperDefWinSize and x25OperDefReqWinSIze. A mod8 setting limits the maximum value to 7, A mod128 setting limits the maximum value to 127. Default value mod8. If this object is set to mod8, all packet window size objects: x25OperDefWinSize, x25OperDefReqWinSize, and x25RAFTNegWindowSize must be less than 8

x25OperDefPktSize.name: x25OperDefPktSize
x25OperDefPktSize.description: The default send/receive packet size in octets for a circuit. Default value is 128.

x25OperDefReqPktSize.name: x25OperDefReqPktSize
x25OperDefReqPktSize.description: The default request packet size in octets for a circuit. Used if flow control is enabled. Ignored if flow control is not enabled. The setting of x25RAFTNegPacketSize will over-ride the setting of this object. Setting this object to a size0(1) value allows flow control negotiation to be configured but disables the packet size portion of flow control negotiation. Default value is 128.

x25OperDefWinSize.name: x25OperDefWinSize
x25OperDefWinSize.description: The default window size for a circuit. The value of this object is limited by the setting of x25OperPacketSequencing This value must be less than 8 if sequencing is mod8. Default value is 2.

x25OperDefReqWinSize.name: x25OperDefReqWinSize
x25OperDefReqWinSize.description: The default request window size for a circuit. Used if flow control is enabled. The value of this object is limited by the setting of x25OperPacketSequencing. This value must be less than 8 if sequencing is mod8. The setting of the x25RAFTNegWindowSize object will over-ride the setting of this object. Default value is 2.

x25OperFlowCntrlNegEnab.name: x25OperFlowCntrlNegEnab
x25OperFlowCntrlNegEnab.description: Enable/disable flow control negotiation. The setting of this parameter determines if x25OperDefReqWinSize or x25OperDefReqPktSize will be used in establishing the call. This parameter will be over-ridden by the setting of the x25RAFTNegWindowSize or the x25RAFTNegPacketSize object.

x25OperCUGSub.name: x25OperCUGSub
x25OperCUGSub.description: Enable/disable the basic form of closed user group. This parameter determines if CUG facility can be used on this interface. The x25RAFTCUGValue will override this parameter. If this object is set to enabled then CUG values in received call request packets will be validated against entries in the x25CUGTable. Call requests containing CUG facility will be refused

x25OperRvrsChrgReq.name: x25OperRvrsChrgReq
x25OperRvrsChrgReq.description: Enable/disable reverse charge request. If this parameter if set to enabled, the reverse charge request facility will be placed in all call request packets. The x25RAFTProposeReverseCharging object will override the setting of this object.

x25OperRvrsChrgAcc.name: x25OperRvrsChrgAcc
x25OperRvrsChrgAcc.description: Enable/disable reverse charge accept. If this object is set to disabled then all received calls containing reverse charging will be refused. The x25RAFTAcceptReverseCharging object will over-ride the setting of this object

x25OperLow2WayChan.name: x25OperLow2WayChan
x25OperLow2WayChan.description: The starting value of two way logical channels. The number of usable logical channels on the interface will be (x25OperLow2WayChan + x25OperNumSVCs -1 ).

x25OperNumSVCs.name: x25OperNumSVCs
x25OperNumSVCs.description: This is the number of SVCs on a physical port.

x25OperLocalAddress.name: x25OperLocalAddress
x25OperLocalAddress.description: The local address for this PLE subnetwork. This object will provide the source DTE address provided in call request packets. If this object is set to a NULL string or to 00000000000000000 then the source DTE address in the call request packets will be absent.

x25OperImmDataAck.name: x25OperImmDataAck
x25OperImmDataAck.description: Enable/disable immediate data ack. This parameter is used when connected to a network which requires immediate acknowledgement of a data packet regardless of whether the window is full. Example Accunet. Setting this parameter to enabled will result in a RR packet sent for every data packet received.

x25OperAccUnknownAdd.name: x25OperAccUnknownAdd
x25OperAccUnknownAdd.description: Enable/disable unknown address acceptance. This parameter will allow call packets to be received for which a RAFT entry does not exist. If a RAFT entry does not exist for an incoming call request source address, then the default parameters on the physical port will determine acceptability of the call.

x25OperLnkReset.name: x25OperLnkReset
x25OperLnkReset.description: Operational parameter to reset link level, This parameter will cause the link level to be reset. The packet will restart if the X25 protocol is enabled for that port (see x25OperEnable)

x25OperT20RestartTimer.name: x25OperT20RestartTimer
x25OperT20RestartTimer.description: The T20 restart timer in seconds. This determines the amount of time allowed for a restart confirm to be received for a restart request. See restart count.

x25OperT21CallTimer.name: x25OperT21CallTimer
x25OperT21CallTimer.description: The T21 call timer in seconds. Maximum time allowed to receive acceptance response to call attempt. There is no call count.

x25OperT22ResetTimer.name: x25OperT22ResetTimer
x25OperT22ResetTimer.description: The T22 Reset timer in seconds. The maximum time allowed to receive reset confirm to a reset request. See reset count.

x25OperT23ClearTimer.name: x25OperT23ClearTimer
x25OperT23ClearTimer.description: The T23 Clear timer in seconds. The maximum time allowed to receive a clear confirm in response to a clear request. See clear count.

x25OperR20RestartCount.name: x25OperR20RestartCount
x25OperR20RestartCount.description: The R20 restart retransmission count. The maximum number of times which a restart request packet will be retransmitted on expiration of the restart timer.

x25OperR22ResetCount.name: x25OperR22ResetCount
x25OperR22ResetCount.description: The r22 Reset retransmission count. The maximum number of times which a reset request packet will be retransmitted on expiration of the reset timer.

x25OperR23ClearCount.name: x25OperR23ClearCount
x25OperR23ClearCount.description: The r23 Clear retransmission count. The maximum number of times which a clear request packet will be retransmitted on expiration of the clear timer.

x25OperInterfaceMode.name: x25OperInterfaceMode
x25OperInterfaceMode.description: Identifies DCE/DTE mode in which the interface operates. A value of lapb indicates the mode will be determined by the address at the Link Layer, otherwise the interface will operate as specified DTE or DCE.

x25OperSubAddress.name: x25OperSubAddress
x25OperSubAddress.description: This object is an operation switch, it enables or disables the use of sub-addressing in x25 DTE addresses. If enabled the last 2 digits of the x25 address is the sub-address identifying the channel number.

x25OperAddrInCallAcc.name: x25OperAddrInCallAcc
x25OperAddrInCallAcc.description: This object is an operation switch, it enables or disables the placement of the calling/called x25 addresses in the call accept packet. If this parameter is set to disabled and the call request contains calling/called addresses the addresses will not be placed into the call accept packet.

x25CUGTable.name: x25CUGTable
x25CUGTable.description: The table of CUG values which can be received in call request packets, by this X.25 Packet Level Entity (PLE).

x25CUGPort.name: x25CUGPort
x25CUGPort.description: A value that uniquely identifies the X.25 PLE subnetwork (physical interface on the fp) and matches its physical port value.

x25CUGTableIndex.name: x25CUGTableIndex
x25CUGTableIndex.description: A value that uniquely identifies the entry in the CUG table for the PLE.

x25CUGValue.name: x25CUGValue
x25CUGValue.description: A closed User Group value for the PLE.

x25CUGStatus.name: x25CUGStatus
x25CUGStatus.description: Enable or disable this CUG value. Disabling the value is the equivalent of deleting it.

x25StatTable.name: x25StatTable
x25StatTable.description: Statistics information about this X.25 PLE. These statistics describe the general operation of X.25 on the physical interface.

x25StatPort.name: x25StatPort
x25StatPort.description: A value that uniquely identifies the X.25 PLE subnetwork (physical interface on the fp) and matches its physical port value.

x25StatComments.name: x25StatComments
x25StatComments.description: An ASCII comment string which describes the interface.

x25StatPktStatus.name: x25StatPktStatus
x25StatPktStatus.description: This object reports the current status of the packet level, and indicates if the packet level is ready for use. The r4 state places the interface in the disabled state, ignoring all packets.

x25StatTotalCircuits.name: x25StatTotalCircuits
x25StatTotalCircuits.description: This object quantifies the total number of virtual circuits (logical channels) available for connection

x25StatActiveCircuits.name: x25StatActiveCircuits
x25StatActiveCircuits.description: This object quantifies the total number of virtual circuits currently connected (states p4, d2, d3)

x25StatInClearCauseDiag.name: x25StatInClearCauseDiag
x25StatInClearCauseDiag.description: This object defines the cause/diag code in the last received clear packet. The form of this is 'nnn nnn' where the first 3 digits give the cause code and the second 3 the diagnostic code.

x25StatInClearAddr.name: x25StatInClearAddr
x25StatInClearAddr.description: The X25 address which originated the last received clear

x25StatOutClearCauseDiag.name: x25StatOutClearCauseDiag
x25StatOutClearCauseDiag.description: This object defines the cause/diag code in the last received clear packet. The form of this is 'nnn nnn' where the first 3 digits give the cause code and the second 3 the diagnostic code.

x25StatOutClearAddr.name: x25StatOutClearAddr
x25StatOutClearAddr.description: The X25 address to which the last locally originated clear packet was sent

x25StatInDataPackets.name: x25StatInDataPackets
x25StatInDataPackets.description: The number of data pkts received on the interface (PLE).

x25StatOutDataPackets.name: x25StatOutDataPackets
x25StatOutDataPackets.description: The number of data packets sent on the interface (PLE).

x25StatInCalls.name: x25StatInCalls
x25StatInCalls.description: The number of incoming call packets received on the interface (PLE).

x25StatOutCallAttempts.name: x25StatOutCallAttempts
x25StatOutCallAttempts.description: The number of call packets sent on the interface (PLE).

x25StatInClears.name: x25StatInClears
x25StatInClears.description: The number of clear packets received on the interface (PLE).

x25StatOutClears.name: x25StatOutClears
x25StatOutClears.description: The number of clear packets transmitted on the interface (PLE)

x25StatInResets.name: x25StatInResets
x25StatInResets.description: The number of reset packets received on the interface (PLE)

x25StatOutResets.name: x25StatOutResets
x25StatOutResets.description: The number of reset packets transmitted on the interface (PLE)

x25StatInRestarts.name: x25StatInRestarts
x25StatInRestarts.description: The number of restart packets received on the interface (PLE)

x25StatOutRestarts.name: x25StatOutRestarts
x25StatOutRestarts.description: The number of restart packets sent on the interface (PLE)

x25StatDiscards.name: x25StatDiscards
x25StatDiscards.description: The total number of transmit frames, before segmentation, discarded due to lack of buffers

x25CircuitTable.name: x25CircuitTable
x25CircuitTable.description: This table contains statistics information about a specific logical channel channel on a physical interface (X.25 PLE).

x25CircuitPort.name: x25CircuitPort
x25CircuitPort.description: A value that uniquely identifies the X.25 PLE subnetwork (physical interface on the fp) and matches its physical port value.

x25CircuitNumber.name: x25CircuitNumber
x25CircuitNumber.description: The logical channel number for this switched virtual circuit (SVC).

x25CircuitStatus.name: x25CircuitStatus
x25CircuitStatus.reference: See ISO 8208, table 33 for (p<n>) state table
x25CircuitStatus.description: This object reports the current packet level state of the switched virtual circuit. See annex B of CCITT X.25 specification for more information.

x25CircuitRemoteDteAddress.name: x25CircuitRemoteDteAddress
x25CircuitRemoteDteAddress.description: The remote X.25 DTE address associated with this switched virtual circuit

x25CircuitType.name: x25CircuitType
x25CircuitType.description: The type of user of this circuit. This parameter identifies the encapsulation and/or the type of router at the remote destination. rx7000 indicates a RX7000 type router is at the remote end of the SVC, b4800 indicates that there is a 4800/4900 router at the remote end of the SVC, isis indicates that the SVC is solely used by the ISIS protocol to communicate to another ISIS router, rfc877 indicates that the SVC is solely used by the IP protocol to communicate to another IP router, test indicates that this is a test SVC.

x25CircuitComments.name: x25CircuitComments
x25CircuitComments.description: An ASCII comment string which describes this entry. This parameter is a NULL string if the x25CircuitType object is ISIS or IP. This parameter will contain the string defined in x25ChanComments if the x25CircuitType object is RX7000 or 4800.

x25CircuitEstablishTime.name: x25CircuitEstablishTime
x25CircuitEstablishTime.description: The amount of time in seconds that the switched virtual circuit has been established.

x25CircuitClearCauseDiag.name: x25CircuitClearCauseDiag
x25CircuitClearCauseDiag.description: This object defines the cause/diag code in the last received clear packet. The form of this is 'nnn nnn' where the first 3 digits give the cause code and the second 3 the diagnostic code. This object indicates the clear cause/diag code in the last clear packet sent or received. The first byte is cause code, the second byte is diagnostic code.

x25CircuitWinSize.name: x25CircuitWinSize
x25CircuitWinSize.description: The packet level window size currently in use on the switched virtual circuit.

x25CircuitPktSize.name: x25CircuitPktSize
x25CircuitPktSize.description: The x25 packet size currently in use on the switched virtual circuit.

x25CircuitInOctets.name: x25CircuitInOctets
x25CircuitInOctets.description: The number of data octets received on this x25 switched virtual circuit .

x25CircuitInPdus.name: x25CircuitInPdus
x25CircuitInPdus.description: The number of data PDUs received on this switched virtual circuit.

x25CircuitOutOctets.name: x25CircuitOutOctets
x25CircuitOutOctets.description: The number of data octets sent on this switched virtual circuit.

x25CircuitOutPdus.name: x25CircuitOutPdus
x25CircuitOutPdus.description: The number of data PDUs sent on this switched virtual circuit.

x25CircuitInResets.name: x25CircuitInResets
x25CircuitInResets.description: The number of Reset packets received on this switched virtual circuit

x25CircuitOutResets.name: x25CircuitOutResets
x25CircuitOutResets.description: The number of Reset packets sent on this switched virtual circuit

x25RAFTable.name: x25RAFTable
x25RAFTable.description: These objects contain the parameters that can be varied between X.25 calls. There is one table for each interface (PLE). The use of entries in this table is based on the x25RAFTAddr object. When a switched virtual circuit is being established this table is searched for a match between the x25RAFTAddr object and the x25 address of the remote DTE. If a match is found then the x25 parameters configured in the x25RAFTable for the x25RAFTAddr will be used to establish the x25 virtual circuit. Entries in this table will over-ride the default values in the Operational table (x25OperTable).

x25RAFTPort.name: x25RAFTPort
x25RAFTPort.description: A value that uniquely identifies the X.25 PLE subnetwork (physical interface on the fp) and matches its physical port value.

x25RAFTIndex.name: x25RAFTIndex
x25RAFTIndex.description: A value that uniquely identifies the entry in the RAFT table. The maximum No. of entries is 64 per Port.

x25RAFTAddr.name: x25RAFTAddr
x25RAFTAddr.description: The address string which identifies this entry. A x25 address which matches this string will result in the facilities being applied to the virtual circuit being established. This string must contain BCD digits 0 to 9. This string can contain two wild card characters which are * or ?. * will match any string or portion of a string. ? will match any character. Example 1* will match 12 123 1234 12345 etc, 1? will match 12 13 14 15 etc. Any other character is not allowed. In reality a NULL string is not allowed

x25RAFTComments.name: x25RAFTComments
x25RAFTComments.description: An ASCII comment string which describes this RAFT entry.

x25RAFTNegWindowSize.name: x25RAFTNegWindowSize
x25RAFTNegWindowSize.description: The window size which will be negotiated for a circuit. A size of zero for a circuit means no negotiation, If non-zero then call request and call accept packets will contain negotiated window size. The value of this object is limited by the setting of x25OperPacketSequencing. This value must be less than 8 if sequencing is mod8. If this parameter is non-zero then flow control negotiation for window size is enabled.

x25RAFTNegPacketSize.name: x25RAFTNegPacketSize
x25RAFTNegPacketSize.description: The packet size in octets negotiated for a circuit. A size of zero for a circuit means no negotiation. If set then call request and call accept packets will contain negotiated window size. If this parameter is non-zero then flow control negotiation for packet size is enabled.

x25RAFTProposeReverseCharging.name: x25RAFTProposeReverseCharging
x25RAFTProposeReverseCharging.description: Identify if the PLE should propose reverse charging. If this parameter is set, then the originated call packet will contain the reverse charge request facility.

x25RAFTAcceptReverseCharging.name: x25RAFTAcceptReverseCharging
x25RAFTAcceptReverseCharging.description: Identify if the PLE will accept or refuse charges. If this paramter is set, then a received call packet which contains reverse charge request facility will be allowed.

x25RAFTCUGStatus.name: x25RAFTCUGStatus
x25RAFTCUGStatus.description: Enable/disable the basic form of closed user group. This parameter determines if CUG facility can be used on this interface. Setting this value to enable will override the x25OperCUGSub parameter.

x25RAFTCUGValue.name: x25RAFTCUGValue
x25RAFTCUGValue.reference: See ISO 8208 Section 15.2.2.3. This implementation supports only the basic CUG facility
x25RAFTCUGValue.description: The Closed User Group to be used on the call.

x25RAFTEnable.name: x25RAFTEnable
x25RAFTEnable.description: Determines the status of the entry in the RAFT table. When set to disabled, the entry in the table is ignored. When set to delete, the entry is deleted from the table. When an entry is first created it is disabled. The remaining parameters are filled in. The last operation should be to set this object to enable, which then makes the table entry an active entry, to be searched.

x25ChanTable.name: x25ChanTable
x25ChanTable.description: This table contains parameters which are configured for channels. A channel is an entity internal to the RX7000. It is a place holder for x25 parameters and control options which will apply to a switched virtual circuit established for a logical port in the RX7000 system.

x25ChanEntry.name: x25ChanEntry
x25ChanEntry.description: Entries of x25ChanTable. A set to any object within this table results in a channel being created, if it did not already exist.

x25ChanPort.name: x25ChanPort
x25ChanPort.description: A value that uniquely identifies the X.25 PLE subnetwork (physical interface on the fp) and matches its physical port value.

x25ChanNumber.name: x25ChanNumber
x25ChanNumber.description: A value that uniquely identifies the entry in the x25ChanTable. There is a maximum of 64 channels per port.

x25ChanState.name: x25ChanState
x25ChanState.description: This gives the state of the configured channel. The values of this state are the same as those of the SVC. This object has meaning only if a logical port is attached to the channel. The ready state indicates that the channel is ready to accept or originate an x25 switched virtual circuit connection.

x25ChanRmtAddr.name: x25ChanRmtAddr
x25ChanRmtAddr.description: The remote x25 DTE address for the channel. This address will be used to provide the called address in the x25 call request packet.

x25ChanComments.name: x25ChanComments
x25ChanComments.description: An ASCII comment string which describes the entry in the channel table.

x25ChanConnect.name: x25ChanConnect
x25ChanConnect.description: This is a runtime parameter to instruct the system to activate the virtual circuit. This command can only be executed if a logical port is attached to the channel. If a logical port is not attached to the channel then the command is ignored.

x25ChanDisconnect.name: x25ChanDisconnect
x25ChanDisconnect.description: This is a runtime parameter to instruct the system to de-activate the virtual circuit. This command can only be executed if a logical port is attached to the channel. If a logical port is not attached to the channel then the command is ignored.

x25ChanAutoConnect.name: x25ChanAutoConnect
x25ChanAutoConnect.description: This is a configurable parameter to instruct the system to automatically attempt to establish a virtual circuit, when the packet layer is ready, a logical port is attached to the channel, and the direction object x25ChanDirection for the channel is set to originate or both. The parameter is ignored if any of these conditions are not met. When set to zero the autoconnect function is disabled. When set to non zero this parameter will determine the frequency in seconds which the system will retry the attempt to establish the switched virtual circuit, if the previous attempt failed. This timer can be ineffective if the interface is not responding to call request or clear request packets.

x25ChanAutoConnectCount.name: x25ChanAutoConnectCount
x25ChanAutoConnectCount.description: This is a configurable parameter to determine the number of attempts which the system will make to establish the circuit. The x25ChanAutoConnect object must be set to non-zero for this parameter to be effective. A value of 0, will try forever. Manual connect request will restart the process if the previous attempts exhausted the retry count.

x25ChanDataInactivity.name: x25ChanDataInactivity
x25ChanDataInactivity.description: This is a configurable parameter which enables control of the virtual circuit through data activity, this parameter also sets the amount of time which must elapse without data activity in order for the virtual circuit to be disconnected. If the value is set to 0, then data inactivity operation is disabled. Recommended value for enabled is 90 seconds. A virtual circuit used for bridging may make this mode of operation ineffective. This parameter cannot be set to enabled at the same time that x25ChanTimeOfDay is set to enabled. The object x25ChanDirection must be set to originate or both for data inactivity control to function.

x25ChanTimeOfDay.name: x25ChanTimeOfDay
x25ChanTimeOfDay.description: This is a configurable parameter which enables time of day control of the virtual circuit. If this parameter is set to enabled then x25ChanDataTimeON and x25ChanDataTimeOFF will determine when the switched virtual is established and disconnected. This parameter cannot be set to enabled at the same time that x25ChanDataInactivity is set to enabled. The object x25ChanDirection must be set to originate or both for time of day control to function.

x25ChanDataTimeOn.name: x25ChanDataTimeOn
x25ChanDataTimeOn.description: This is a configurable parameter which sets the time of day to activate the SVC, Format of string is hh:mm. First 2 bytes are hours, second 2 bytes are minutes The parameter x25ChanTimeOfDay must be set to enabled for this to function. This defaults to '00:00' or midnight.

x25ChanDataTimeOff.name: x25ChanDataTimeOff
x25ChanDataTimeOff.description: This is a configurable parameter which sets the time of day to de-activate the SVC, Format of string is hh:mm. First 2 bytes are hours, second 2 bytes are minutes The parameter x25ChanTimeOfDay must be set to enabled for this to function. This defaults to '00:00' or midnight.

x25ChanDirection.name: x25ChanDirection
x25ChanDirection.description: This parameter will determine the direction call can take on the SVC. When set to originate, a call request packet can be originated on the interface. When set to receive, a call request packet can only be received on the interface. When set to both then a call request packet can be both originated or received on the interface. This parameter must be set to originate or both for the objects x25ChanTimeOfDay x25ChanDataInactivity x25ChanAutoConnectTime to be effective.

x25ChanEnable.name: x25ChanEnable
x25ChanEnable.description: When set to enabled, the entry in the x25ChanTable will be created. When set to delete the entry will be deleted.

x25CircuitTestTable.name: x25CircuitTestTable
x25CircuitTestTable.description: This table has one entry per port. It allows a user to request a test connection to a remote unit. The table entry will show the status of a test call made to this unit or from this unit. Only one circuit is allowed at a time. A call can be requested or received but not both simultaneously.

x25CircuitTestPort.name: x25CircuitTestPort
x25CircuitTestPort.description: A value that uniquely identifies the X.25 PLE subnetwork (physical interface on the fp) and matches its physical port value.

x25CircuitTestRemoteAddress.name: x25CircuitTestRemoteAddress
x25CircuitTestRemoteAddress.description: The x25 DTE address to be used as the called address, when a call packet is originated from this RX7000 unit.

x25CircuitTestInRemoteAddress.name: x25CircuitTestInRemoteAddress
x25CircuitTestInRemoteAddress.description: The x25 DTE address in the calling address field of a received call packet.

x25CircuitTestComments.name: x25CircuitTestComments
x25CircuitTestComments.description: An ASCII comment string which describes this test. This string is sent to the remote site as a data packet when the circuit is established. This defaults to a NULL string.

x25CircuitTestInComments.name: x25CircuitTestInComments
x25CircuitTestInComments.description: The ASCII comment string configured at the remote site. This only has meaning if the test call was received. The contents of this object are meaningless if the test call was originated from this RX7000 unit.

x25CircuitTestStatus.name: x25CircuitTestStatus
x25CircuitTestStatus.description: This object reports the current packet level status of the switch virtual circuit.

x25CircuitTestClearCauseDiag.name: x25CircuitTestClearCauseDiag
x25CircuitTestClearCauseDiag.description: This object defines the cause/diag code in the last received clear packet. The form of this is 'nnn nnn' where the first 3 digits give the cause code and the second 3 the diagnostic code.

x25CircuitTestWinSize.name: x25CircuitTestWinSize
x25CircuitTestWinSize.description: The window size currently in use on the switched virtual circuit.

x25CircuitTestPktSize.name: x25CircuitTestPktSize
x25CircuitTestPktSize.description: The packet size currently in use on the switched virtual circuit.

x25CircuitTestReverseCharging.name: x25CircuitTestReverseCharging
x25CircuitTestReverseCharging.description: Identify if the test circuit used reverse charging when establishing the call. Use of this facility is determined by the RAFT or the interface default

x25CircuitTestCUGValue.name: x25CircuitTestCUGValue
x25CircuitTestCUGValue.description: Indicates if the Closed User Group facility was used on the circuit. The object consists of two octets containing the characters 0 through 9. A zero length string indicates no CUG facility was used on the test circuit. Use of this facility is determined by the RAFT or the interface default

x25CircuitTestCmd.name: x25CircuitTestCmd
x25CircuitTestCmd.description: The command which requests an action on the test circuit. connect - this command will attempt to originate a test connection provided a test connection is not already established. clear- this command will clear the test connection if it is established. clearConnect - this command will clear the test connection if it is established and then attempt to originate a test connection.

x25CircuitTestConnResponse.name: x25CircuitTestConnResponse
x25CircuitTestConnResponse.description: This indicates the action which last occurred on the circuit. incoming_connected indicates that the switched virtual circuit was connected as a result of an incoming call, outgoing_connected indicates that the circuit was connected as a result of an outgoing call, rcv_cleared indicates that the switched virtual circuit is disconnected as a result of receiving a clear packet from the remote end, sent_cleared indicates that the switched virtual circuit is disconnected as a result of sending a clear packet to the remote end

ethernetPortParameterTable.name: ethernetPortParameterTable
ethernetPortParameterTable.description: A table of ethernet physical port parameters.

ethernetPortEntry.name: ethernetPortEntry
ethernetPortEntry.description: An entry in the ethernet port table.

ethernetPortNumber.name: ethernetPortNumber
ethernetPortNumber.description: The value of the index uniquley specifies the physical port number to which this entry is applicable.

ethernetSQEErrors.name: ethernetSQEErrors
ethernetSQEErrors.description: The number of SQE/Heartbeat errors detected.

ethernetRxMissedFrames.name: ethernetRxMissedFrames
ethernetRxMissedFrames.description: The number of receive frames missed because no buffers were available to accept the incoming data.

ethernetRetries.name: ethernetRetries
ethernetRetries.description: Total number of transmission retries by this station on the attached LAN.

ethernetCollisions.name: ethernetCollisions
ethernetCollisions.description: Total collisions detected on the attached LAN.

ethernetRunts.name: ethernetRunts
ethernetRunts.description: Total number of runts detected on the attached LAN.

ethernetFRAMorCRCErrors.name: ethernetFRAMorCRCErrors
ethernetFRAMorCRCErrors.description: Total number of Framing or CRC errors detected on LAN.

ethernetTxDeferrals.name: ethernetTxDeferrals
ethernetTxDeferrals.description: The total number of TX deferrals required on the LAN segment.

ethernetLateCollisions.name: ethernetLateCollisions
ethernetLateCollisions.description: Total number of late collisions encountered during transmission by this port.

ethernetLossofCarrierErrors.name: ethernetLossofCarrierErrors
ethernetLossofCarrierErrors.description: Total number of loss of carrier errors encountered by this port

ethernetRetryErrors.name: ethernetRetryErrors
ethernetRetryErrors.description: Total number of TX retry limit errors encountered during transmission by this port.

ethernetTDRUnits.name: ethernetTDRUnits
ethernetTDRUnits.description: Most recently detected TDR figure detected by this port. This is the time from the start of transmission to the occurrence of of a collision or loss of carrier, and is updated only when a retry error is detected on transmission.

ethernetTxUnicastFrames.name: ethernetTxUnicastFrames
