ethernetTxUnicastFrames.description: Total number of unicast frames transmitted.

ethernetRxUnicastFrames.name: ethernetRxUnicastFrames
ethernetRxUnicastFrames.description: Total number of unicast frames received.

ethernetTxMulticastFrames.name: ethernetTxMulticastFrames
ethernetTxMulticastFrames.description: Total number of Multicast frames transmitted.

ethernetRxMulticastFrames.name: ethernetRxMulticastFrames
ethernetRxMulticastFrames.description: Total number of Multicast frames received.

ethernetTxBroadcastFrames.name: ethernetTxBroadcastFrames
ethernetTxBroadcastFrames.description: Total number of Broadcast frames transmitted.

ethernetRxBroadcastFrames.name: ethernetRxBroadcastFrames
ethernetRxBroadcastFrames.description: Total number of Broadcast frames received.

ethernetNoOfLinkResets.name: ethernetNoOfLinkResets
ethernetNoOfLinkResets.description: This is the number of link resets which have occurred since the last reinitialization of the unit.

ethernetLastLinkResetReason.name: ethernetLastLinkResetReason
ethernetLastLinkResetReason.description: This object gives the reason code for the last reset which occurred on this LAN physical link. A value of noReason(1) is returned if the link has not reset. A value of management(2) is returned when a link reset has been caused by a management protocol (either SNMP or by LMS). A value of deviceReset(3) is returned if the link reset was caused by a hardware failure. A value of cableDrop(4) is returned when the link reset was caused by a missing or faulty cable.

ethernetTimeSinceLastLinkReset.name: ethernetTimeSinceLastLinkReset
ethernetTimeSinceLastLinkReset.description: This is the time (in hundredths of seconds) since the last link reset.

frmRelPortTable.name: frmRelPortTable
frmRelPortTable.description: A table containing per port information for Frame Relay interfaces.

frmRelPortEntry.name: frmRelPortEntry
frmRelPortEntry.description: The error information for a single frame relay interface.

frmRelPortIndex.name: frmRelPortIndex
frmRelPortIndex.description: The value of this index uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is applicable.

frmRelPortMaxFrameSize.name: frmRelPortMaxFrameSize
frmRelPortMaxFrameSize.description: This is the frame size used between this port (DTE) and the network (DCE).

frmRelPortDlcmiErrors.name: frmRelPortDlcmiErrors
frmRelPortDlcmiErrors.description: This is the number of Error frames that have occurred on the management channel, i.e. the Dlcmi

frmRelPortDlcmiRxedStatus.name: frmRelPortDlcmiRxedStatus
frmRelPortDlcmiRxedStatus.description: This is the number of Status messages received from the network, on the Dlcmi.

frmRelPortDlcmiTxedStatus.name: frmRelPortDlcmiTxedStatus
frmRelPortDlcmiTxedStatus.description: This is the number of Status messages transmitted to the network, via this port, on the Dlcmi.

frmRelPortCircuits.name: frmRelPortCircuits
frmRelPortCircuits.description: This is the number of circuits which are currently configured for this port.

bootpServerIpAddress.name: bootpServerIpAddress
bootpServerIpAddress.description: The IP Address of the BootP server

bootpFileName.name: bootpFileName
bootpFileName.description: The path name and name of the file to be downloaded.

bootpAction.name: bootpAction
bootpAction.description: Indicates whether to stop or start bootp/tftp download. This always returns the value no_action to a get request

ospfImportRipRoutes.name: ospfImportRipRoutes
ospfImportRipRoutes.description: This flag indicates if OSPF can import routes learned through RIP locally and insert into OSPF routing.

ospfRipFilterDefaultAction.name: ospfRipFilterDefaultAction
ospfRipFilterDefaultAction.description: This object indicates the action-on-no-match for RIP routes.

ospfImportStaticRoutes.name: ospfImportStaticRoutes
ospfImportStaticRoutes.description: If enabled, OSPF can import static routes.

ospfStaticFilterDefaultAction.name: ospfStaticFilterDefaultAction
ospfStaticFilterDefaultAction.description: This object indicates the action-on-no-match for Static routes.

ospfRipFilterTable.name: ospfRipFilterTable
ospfRipFilterTable.description: This table contains filter information for RIP routes importation.

ospfRipFilterEntry.name: ospfRipFilterEntry
ospfRipFilterEntry.description: An entry in the OSPF Rip Filter Table. To set an entry, all the objects in this entry must be supplied within a single SET PDU

ospfRipFilterIpAddress.name: ospfRipFilterIpAddress
ospfRipFilterIpAddress.description: Destination IP address found by RIP to which the filter should be applied.

ospfRipFilterIpMask.name: ospfRipFilterIpMask
ospfRipFilterIpMask.description: The mask associated with the IpAddress.

ospfRipFilterAction.name: ospfRipFilterAction
ospfRipFilterAction.description: This object indicates whether to import or not import a route in case of a match.

ospfRipFilterStatus.name: ospfRipFilterStatus
ospfRipFilterStatus.description: This object indicates if the entry is valid or invalid.

ospfRipConvertTable.name: ospfRipConvertTable
ospfRipConvertTable.description: This table contains information for converting RIP's hop count to OSPF's metric for each pair of configured destination IP address and its mask.

ospfRipConvertEntry.name: ospfRipConvertEntry
ospfRipConvertEntry.description: An entry in the OSPF RIP Convert Table. To set an entry, all the objects in this entry must be supplied within a single SET PDU

ospfRipConvertIpAddress.name: ospfRipConvertIpAddress
ospfRipConvertIpAddress.description: Destination IP address found by RIP.

ospfRipConvertHop.name: ospfRipConvertHop
ospfRipConvertHop.description: The hop count measured in RIP.

ospfRipConvertMetric.name: ospfRipConvertMetric
ospfRipConvertMetric.description: The metric in OSPF converted from RIP.

ospfRipConvertStatus.name: ospfRipConvertStatus
ospfRipConvertStatus.description: This object tells us if this entry in the table is valid or invalid.

ospfRipDefaultConvertTable.name: ospfRipDefaultConvertTable
ospfRipDefaultConvertTable.description: This table contains the default conversion from hop counts measured in RIP to metrics measured in OSPF.

ospfRipDefaultConvertEntry.name: ospfRipDefaultConvertEntry
ospfRipDefaultConvertEntry.description: An entry in the OSPF RIP DefaultConvert Table. To set an entry, all the objects in this entry must be supplied within a single SET PDU

ospfRipDefaultConvertHop.name: ospfRipDefaultConvertHop
ospfRipDefaultConvertHop.description: The hop count measured in RIP.

ospfRipDefaultConvertMetric.name: ospfRipDefaultConvertMetric
ospfRipDefaultConvertMetric.description: The metric in OSPF converted from RIP.

ospfRipDefaultConvertStatus.name: ospfRipDefaultConvertStatus
ospfRipDefaultConvertStatus.description: The object indicates if this entry is valid or invalid.

ospfStaticFilterTable.name: ospfStaticFilterTable
ospfStaticFilterTable.description: This table contains filter information for static routes importation.

ospfStaticFilterEntry.name: ospfStaticFilterEntry
ospfStaticFilterEntry.description: An entry in the OSPF Static Filter Table To set an entry, all the objects in this entry must be supplied within a single SET PDU

ospfStaticFilterTOS.name: ospfStaticFilterTOS
ospfStaticFilterTOS.description: Type Of Service for this route.

ospfStaticFilterAction.name: ospfStaticFilterAction
ospfStaticFilterAction.description: Action to be taken in case of a match.

ospfStaticFilterStatus.name: ospfStaticFilterStatus
ospfStaticFilterStatus.description: The object indicates if this entry is valid or invalid.

ospfStaticConvertTable.name: ospfStaticConvertTable
ospfStaticConvertTable.description: This table contains information for converting hop count of static routes to OSPF's metric for each configured pair of IP Address and its mask.

ospfStaticConvertEntry.name: ospfStaticConvertEntry
ospfStaticConvertEntry.description: An entry in the OSPF Static Convert Table. To set an entry, all the objects in this entry must be supplied within a single SET PDU

ospfStaticConvertTOS.name: ospfStaticConvertTOS
ospfStaticConvertTOS.description: Type of Service for this route.

ospfStaticConvertHop.name: ospfStaticConvertHop
ospfStaticConvertHop.description: The hop count for static route.

ospfStaticConvertMetric.name: ospfStaticConvertMetric
ospfStaticConvertMetric.description: The metric in OSPF, converted from RIP.

ospfStaticConvertStatus.name: ospfStaticConvertStatus
ospfStaticConvertStatus.description: This object indicates if the entry is valid or invalid.

ospfStaticDefaultConvertTable.name: ospfStaticDefaultConvertTable
ospfStaticDefaultConvertTable.description: This table contains default conversion from hop counts measured for static routes to metrics measured in OSPF.

ospfStaticDefaultConvertEntry.name: ospfStaticDefaultConvertEntry
ospfStaticDefaultConvertEntry.description: An entry in the OSPF Static Default Convert Table. To set an entry, all the objects in this entry must be supplied within a single SET PDU

ospfStaticDefaultConvertTOS.name: ospfStaticDefaultConvertTOS
ospfStaticDefaultConvertTOS.description: Type Of Service for this route.

ospfStaticDefaultConvertHop.name: ospfStaticDefaultConvertHop
ospfStaticDefaultConvertHop.description: The hop count measured for static routes.

ospfStaticDefaultConvertMetric.name: ospfStaticDefaultConvertMetric
ospfStaticDefaultConvertMetric.description: The metric in OSPF converted from static routes.

ospfStaticDefaultConvertStatus.name: ospfStaticDefaultConvertStatus
ospfStaticDefaultConvertStatus.description: This object indicates if the entry is valid or invalid.

rtxospfHostTable.name: rtxospfHostTable
rtxospfHostTable.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.6 Host route parameters.
rtxospfHostTable.description: The list of Hosts, and their metrics, that the router will advertise as host routes.

rtxospfHostEntry.name: rtxospfHostEntry
rtxospfHostEntry.description: A metric to be advertised, for a given type of service, when a given host is reachable.

rtxospfHostIpAddress.name: rtxospfHostIpAddress
rtxospfHostIpAddress.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.6 Host route parameters.
rtxospfHostIpAddress.description: The IP Address of the Host.

rtxospfHostTOS.name: rtxospfHostTOS
rtxospfHostTOS.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.6 Host route parameters.
rtxospfHostTOS.description: The Type of Service of the route being configured.

rtxospfHostMetric.name: rtxospfHostMetric
rtxospfHostMetric.reference: OSPF Version 2, Appendix C.6 Host route parameters.

rtxospfHostIf.name: rtxospfHostIf
rtxospfHostIf.description: This variable contains the logical port on which the IPAdress(Host) is reachable.

rtxospfHostStatus.name: rtxospfHostStatus
rtxospfHostStatus.description: This variable contains the validity or invalidity of the entry. Setting it to 'invalid' has the effect of rendering it inoperative. The internal effect (row removal) is implementation dependent.

rtxFddiStatusTable.name: rtxFddiStatusTable
rtxFddiStatusTable.description: This table contains status and configuration information for a FDDI physical port.

rtxFddiStatusIndex.name: rtxFddiStatusIndex
rtxFddiStatusIndex.description: This object identifies the phycial port which is a FDDI physical port.

rtxFddiNoOfLinkResets.name: rtxFddiNoOfLinkResets
rtxFddiNoOfLinkResets.description: This object is a count of the number of times this link has reset has occurred on the FDDI link, since the last reinitialisation of the unit.

rtxFddiLastLinkResetReason.name: rtxFddiLastLinkResetReason
rtxFddiLastLinkResetReason.description: This object gives the a reason code for the last reset which occurred on this FDDI physical link. A value of noReason(1) is returned if the link has not reset. A value of management(2) is returned when a link reset has been caused by a management protocol (either SNMP or by LMS). A value of deviceReset(3) is returned if the link reset was caused by a hardware failure. A value of cableDrop(4) is returned when the link reset was caused by a missing or faulty cable. A value of protocol(5) is returned when the link reset is caues by the link protocol which is running on this link e.g. a Disconnet Request etc.

rtxFddiTimeSinceLastLinkReset.name: rtxFddiTimeSinceLastLinkReset
rtxFddiTimeSinceLastLinkReset.description: This is a time (in hundredths of seconds) since the last link reset

rtxFddiRFC1188Support.name: rtxFddiRFC1188Support
rtxFddiRFC1188Support.description: This object is used to indicate if this instance of the FDDI protocol supports RFC1188 compliance. If this support is not required then the object is set to a value of notSupported(2).

rtxPPPConfigTable.name: rtxPPPConfigTable
rtxPPPConfigTable.description: This is a table of the configuration objects which are the Retix Extensions to the standard PPP mib.

pppConfigIfIndex.name: pppConfigIfIndex
pppConfigIfIndex.description: The interface number. This number is numerically equal to the physical port ID (portPhysPortID).

pppRestartTimer.name: pppRestartTimer
pppRestartTimer.description: This object shows the current value of the Restart Timer. This is the timer which is used in retransmission Configure Request or Terminate Request packets.

pppMaxTerminate.name: pppMaxTerminate
pppMaxTerminate.description: This object shows the maximum retry count for sending a Terminate Request packet without receiving a Terminate Ack.

pppMaxConfigure.name: pppMaxConfigure
pppMaxConfigure.description: This object shows the maximum retry count for sending a Configure Request packet without receiving a Configure Ack, or Configure Nak, or Configure Reject Packet. If set to zero, then the protocol will keep retrying forever.

pppMaxFailure.name: pppMaxFailure
pppMaxFailure.description: This object shows the maximum retry count for sending a Configure Nak without sending a Configure Ack packet.

pppEchoTest.name: pppEchoTest
pppEchoTest.description: By setting this object, a test pattern will be generated and sent to the peer. An echo reply will be expected from the peer. To begin the test, a SET will enable the process; otherwise a disable is returned. Currently, the test pattern is configured internally, and is fixed. The length of the test packet is equal to the negotiated packet length between the peers.

rtxPPPStatsTable.name: rtxPPPStatsTable
rtxPPPStatsTable.description: This is a table of the statistics objects which are the Retix Extensions to the standard PPP mib.

pppStatsIfIndex.name: pppStatsIfIndex
pppStatsIfIndex.description: The interface number which corresponds to the physical port number.

pppInvalidTransmitFrames.name: pppInvalidTransmitFrames
pppInvalidTransmitFrames.description: This object is a count of the number of frames which were not transmitted successfull.

pppInvalidReceivedFrames.name: pppInvalidReceivedFrames
pppInvalidReceivedFrames.description: This object is a count of the number of frames which were received in error.

pppTotalTransmitFrames.name: pppTotalTransmitFrames
pppTotalTransmitFrames.description: This object is a count of the number of frames which have been transmitted successfully, or unsuccessfully.

pppTotalReceivedFrames.name: pppTotalReceivedFrames
pppTotalReceivedFrames.description: This object is a count of the number of frames which were received successfully, or unsuccessfully.

pppTotalTransmitOctets.name: pppTotalTransmitOctets
pppTotalTransmitOctets.description: This object is a count of the number of octets which were transmitted successfully, or unsuccessfully.

pppTotalReceivedOctets.name: pppTotalReceivedOctets
pppTotalReceivedOctets.description: This object is a count of the number of octets which were received successfully, or unsuccessfully.

pppTotalTransmitEchoPackets.name: pppTotalTransmitEchoPackets
pppTotalTransmitEchoPackets.description: This object is a count of the number of echo packets which were transmitted successfully, or unsuccessfully.

pppTotalReceivedEchoPackets.name: pppTotalReceivedEchoPackets
pppTotalReceivedEchoPackets.description: This object is a count of the number of echo packets which were received with a positive or negative results

pppTotalReceivedGoodEchoPackets.name: pppTotalReceivedGoodEchoPackets
pppTotalReceivedGoodEchoPackets.description: This object is a count of the number of echo packets which were received with a positive result

atmRtxAtmLayerTable.name: atmRtxAtmLayerTable
atmRtxAtmLayerTable.description: A table of ATM layer status and parameter information for the UNI's physical interface

atmRtxAtmLayerIndex.name: atmRtxAtmLayerIndex
atmRtxAtmLayerIndex.description: A unique value which identifies this port. The value of 0 has the special meaning of identifying the local UNI

atmRtxAtmLayerMaxVCs.name: atmRtxAtmLayerMaxVCs
atmRtxAtmLayerMaxVCs.description: Mamimum number of vitual circuits allowed.

atmRtxAtmLayerLastResetReason.name: atmRtxAtmLayerLastResetReason
atmRtxAtmLayerLastResetReason.description: The reason the ATM signaling VC goes down last time.

atmRtxAtmStatsTable.name: atmRtxAtmStatsTable
atmRtxAtmStatsTable.description: A table of ATM layer statistics information for the UNI's physical interface.

atmRtxAtmStatsEntry.name: atmRtxAtmStatsEntry
atmRtxAtmStatsEntry.description: A entry in the table, containing statistics for the ATM layer of a UNI interface

atmRtxAtmStatsIndex.name: atmRtxAtmStatsIndex
atmRtxAtmStatsIndex.description: A unique value which identifies this port. The value of 0 has the special meaning of identifying the local UNI

atmRtxAtmStatsDroppedTxFrames.name: atmRtxAtmStatsDroppedTxFrames
atmRtxAtmStatsDroppedTxFrames.description: Number of transmitted frames dropped by software.

atmRtxAtmStatsDroppedRxFrames.name: atmRtxAtmStatsDroppedRxFrames
atmRtxAtmStatsDroppedRxFrames.description: Number of received frames dropped by software.

atmRtxAtmStatsRxErrorFrames.name: atmRtxAtmStatsRxErrorFrames
atmRtxAtmStatsRxErrorFrames.description: Number of received frames with error (other than mismatched BE Tags).

atmRtxAtmStatsRxBETagFrames.name: atmRtxAtmStatsRxBETagFrames
atmRtxAtmStatsRxBETagFrames.description: Number of received frames with mismatched BE Tags.

atmRtxAtmStatsChipDroppedRxFrames.name: atmRtxAtmStatsChipDroppedRxFrames
atmRtxAtmStatsChipDroppedRxFrames.description: Number of received frames dropped by chip(hardware).

atmRtxAtmStatsRxErrorCells.name: atmRtxAtmStatsRxErrorCells
atmRtxAtmStatsRxErrorCells.description: Number of received cells with error.

atmRtxAtmStatsFifoFullRxFrames.name: atmRtxAtmStatsFifoFullRxFrames
atmRtxAtmStatsFifoFullRxFrames.description: Number of received FIFO is full.

atmRtxVcTable.name: atmRtxVcTable
atmRtxVcTable.description: A table of status and parameter information on the virtual connections which are visible at this UNI.

atmRtxVcEntry.name: atmRtxVcEntry
atmRtxVcEntry.description: A entry in the table, containing information about a particular virtual connection.

atmRtxVcPortIndex.name: atmRtxVcPortIndex
atmRtxVcPortIndex.description: A unique value which identifies this port. The value of 0 has the special meaning of identifying the local UNI

atmRtxVcInVpci.name: atmRtxVcInVpci
atmRtxVcInVpci.description: The VPCI value of this Virtual Connection at the local UNI.

atmRtxVcLgclPortIndex.name: atmRtxVcLgclPortIndex
atmRtxVcLgclPortIndex.description: A unique value which identifies the logical port to which this vc belong

atmRtxVcOperStatus.name: atmRtxVcOperStatus
atmRtxVcOperStatus.description: The present actual operational status of the VC.

atmRtxVcStatsTable.name: atmRtxVcStatsTable
atmRtxVcStatsTable.description: A table of statistics on the virtual connections which are visible at this UNI.

atmRtxVcStatsEntry.name: atmRtxVcStatsEntry
atmRtxVcStatsEntry.description: A entry in the table, containing statistics about a particular virtual connection.

atmRtxVcStatsPortIndex.name: atmRtxVcStatsPortIndex
atmRtxVcStatsPortIndex.description: A unique value which identifies this port. The value of 0 has the special meaning of identifying the local UNI

atmRtxVcStatsInVpci.name: atmRtxVcStatsInVpci
atmRtxVcStatsInVpci.description: The VCI value of this Virtual Connection at the local UNI.

atmRtxVcStatsLgclPortIndex.name: atmRtxVcStatsLgclPortIndex
atmRtxVcStatsLgclPortIndex.description: A unique value which identifies the logical port to which this vc belong

atmRtxVcStatsReceivedPkts.name: atmRtxVcStatsReceivedPkts
atmRtxVcStatsReceivedPkts.description: Number of received packtets on this virtual circuit.

atmRtxVcStatsTransmittedPkts.name: atmRtxVcStatsTransmittedPkts
atmRtxVcStatsTransmittedPkts.description: Number of transmitted packtets on this virtual circuit.

atmRtxVcStatsTimeouts.name: atmRtxVcStatsTimeouts
atmRtxVcStatsTimeouts.description: Number of timeouts of this virtual circuit.

atmRtxPVCLayerTable.name: atmRtxPVCLayerTable
atmRtxPVCLayerTable.description: A table of ATM/PVC layer status and parameter information for the UNI's physical interface

atmRtxPVCLayerIndex.name: atmRtxPVCLayerIndex
atmRtxPVCLayerIndex.description: A unique value which identifies this port. The value of 0 has the special meaning of identifying the local UNI

atmRtxPVCLayerMaxPVCs.name: atmRtxPVCLayerMaxPVCs
atmRtxPVCLayerMaxPVCs.description: Maximum number of permanent vitual circuits.

atmRtxPVCLayerLastResetReason.name: atmRtxPVCLayerLastResetReason
atmRtxPVCLayerLastResetReason.description: The reason the ATM signaling VC goes down last time.

atmRtxPVCLayerVirtualPathId.name: atmRtxPVCLayerVirtualPathId
atmRtxPVCLayerVirtualPathId.description: Indicates the number of Virtual Path Identifier configured for each logical port on this interface.

srtBridgeNumber.name: srtBridgeNumber
srtBridgeNumber.description: A bridge number uniquely identifies a bridge when more than one bridge is used to span the same segments. This object can have values between 0..15 inclusive and also a value 65535. When set to 65535, source routing on the unit is DISABLED.

srtPortTable.name: srtPortTable
srtPortTable.description: Table of Source Routing per Port parameters.

srtPortEntry.name: srtPortEntry
srtPortEntry.description: Entries of Table of Source Routing per logical port parameters.

srtPortIfIndex.name: srtPortIfIndex
srtPortIfIndex.description: The logical port number corresponding to the value of ifIndex.

srtPortSecurityMode.name: srtPortSecurityMode
srtPortSecurityMode.description: Disable/Enable filtering on frame destination address for source routed frames.

srtPortSrcAddrFiltering.name: srtPortSrcAddrFiltering
srtPortSrcAddrFiltering.description: Disable/Enable source address filtering for source routed frames.

srtPortCustomFiltering.name: srtPortCustomFiltering
srtPortCustomFiltering.description: Disable/Enable custom filtering for source routed frames. Note that both Source Routing and Transparent Bridging use the same Custom Filter Tables, but are enabled to use Custom Filtering separately

srtProcessForRIFInsertion.name: srtProcessForRIFInsertion
srtProcessForRIFInsertion.description: If this object has the value enable(1), then the ring driver for the token ring port to which this logical port is attached will, in appropriate cases, insert a Routing Information Field into the frame to be transmitted.

srtProcessForSourceRoute.name: srtProcessForSourceRoute
srtProcessForSourceRoute.description: If this object has the value enable(1), token ring frames originated by the RX7000 or bridged via translational bridging will be sebt according to th rule set used by the Source Route Manager. If this object has a value of disable(2), token ring frames originated by the RX7000 will always be sent as transparent frames.

rtxSourceRouteVirtRingNum.name: rtxSourceRouteVirtRingNum
rtxSourceRouteVirtRingNum.description: This parameter defines the Virtual ring number for this unit. This number is used by the Source Route Manager. This number is added to the RIF of frames processed by the Source Route Manager.

rtxSourceRouteAgingTime.name: rtxSourceRouteAgingTime
rtxSourceRouteAgingTime.description: If no frames from a source are received for this time, any associated routing information in the Source Route Table is purged. The granularity is seconds.

rtxSourceRouteTable.name: rtxSourceRouteTable
rtxSourceRouteTable.description: This table contains a list of stored destination address and the routing information fields which will be inserted in frames sent to those destinations.

rtxSourceRouteSlotID.name: rtxSourceRouteSlotID
rtxSourceRouteSlotID.description: This identifies the FP from which this entry originated.

rtxSourceRouteAddress.name: rtxSourceRouteAddress
rtxSourceRouteAddress.description: This is the source address which was stored when the Source Routing frame which contained it was processed by the Source Route Manager. The address is in the form it was received from the ring network.

rtxSourceRouteRIF.name: rtxSourceRouteRIF
rtxSourceRouteRIF.description: This object contains all the routing information which was extracted from the received Source Routed frame. The data is in the form it was received from the ring network

rtxSourceRouteType.name: rtxSourceRouteType
rtxSourceRouteType.description: This object represents the type of the entry. If the value returned is sameRing (1), then this indicates that the frame from which this entry was taken originated on our local ring. A value of locked (2) is used for entries which have been learned from ARE type frames. The value provisional(3) is used for frames which have been learned from STE frames and the responsWithARE (4) values is used to indicate that when a response is sent to this entry's address is should be sent as an ARE frame.

rtxSourceRouteDirection.name: rtxSourceRouteDirection
rtxSourceRouteDirection.description: If this object returns a value of inOrder(0), then this means that the D bit is zero and that the frame traverses the LANs in the order in which they are specified in the routing information field. Conversely, if the D bit is set to 1 the frame will traverse the LANs in the reverse order. The D bit is meaningful only for source routed frames (SRF). For STE and ARE frames the D bit is ignored and is not altered by the unit.

rtxRptrBasicTable.name: rtxRptrBasicTable
rtxRptrBasicTable.description: This table contains the status information and control parameters for a particular 10 Base-T I/O card in the RX7000 chassis.

rtxRptrBasicEntry.name: rtxRptrBasicEntry
rtxRptrBasicEntry.description: This is an entry in the rtxRptrBasicTable.

rtxRptrBasicId.name: rtxRptrBasicId
rtxRptrBasicId.description: This object uniquely identifies the 10 Base-T I/O card to which the entries in this table apply. It takes a value numerically equal to the portPhysPortID for the I/O card. This means that the indexing of hub cards is sparse.

rtxRptrBasicGroupCapacity.name: rtxRptrBasicGroupCapacity
rtxRptrBasicGroupCapacity.description: The rtxRptrGroupCapacity is the number of groups that can be contained within the repeater. Within each managed repeater, the groups are uniquely numbered in the range from 1 to rtxRptrGroupCapacity. In the RX7000 system this object will only take the fixed value 1.

rtxRptrBasicOperStatus.name: rtxRptrBasicOperStatus
rtxRptrBasicOperStatus.description: The rtxRptrOperStatus object indicates the operational state of the repeater. The rtxRptrHealthText object may be consulted for more specific information about the state of the repeater's health. In the case of multiple kinds of failures (e.g., repeater failure and port failure), the value of this attribute shall reflect the highest priority failure in the following order: rtxRptrFailure(3) groupFailure(4) portFailure(5) generalFailure(6). For the RX7000 a groupFailure(4) is indistinguishable from a rtxRptrFailure(3), which will be reported by preference.

rtxRptrBasicHealthText.name: rtxRptrBasicHealthText
rtxRptrBasicHealthText.description: The health text object is a text string that provides information relevant to the operational state of the repeater. Agents may use this string to provide detailed information on current failures, including how they were detected, and/or instructions for problem resolution. The contents are agent-specific.

rtxRptrBasicReset.name: rtxRptrBasicReset
rtxRptrBasicReset.description: Setting this object to reset(2) causes a transition to the START state of Fig 9-2 in section 9 [IEEE 802.3 Std]. Setting this object to noReset(1) has no effect. The agent will always return the value noReset(1) when this object is read. This action does not reset the management counters defined in this document nor does it affect the portAdminStatus parameters. Included in this action is the execution of a disruptive Self-Test. As a result of the action of this test a rtxRptrResetEvent Trap may be sent. Note: This action may result in the loss of packets. For the RX7000, the 'disruptive self-test' involves a RIC loopback and collision test.

rtxRptrBasicGroupDescr.name: rtxRptrBasicGroupDescr
rtxRptrBasicGroupDescr.description: This object contains a textual description of the group. This string should contain the full name and version identification of the group's hardware type and indicate how the group is differentiated from other groups in the repeater. 'Wilma Flintstone 6-Port FOIRL Plug-In module, Rev A' or 'Barney Rubble 10Base-T 4-port SIMM socket V, 2.1' are examples of valid group descriptions. It is mandatory that this only contain printable ASCII characters.

rtxRptrBasicGroupObjectId.name: rtxRptrBasicGroupObjectId
rtxRptrBasicGroupObjectId.description: The vendor's authoritative identification of the group. This is the value allocated within the SMI enterprises subtree (1.3.6.1.4.1) and provides a straight-forward and unambiguous means for determining the type of group being managed. For Example, this variable could take the value : 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.2.14 if vendor 'Flintstone Inc.' was assigned subtree 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242, and had assigned 1.3.6.1.4.1.4242.1.2.14 to its 'Wilma Flintstone 6-Port FOIRL Plug-In module, Rev A'. The definition of the value assigned for the RX7000 10 Base-T cards follow the definition of the rtxRtpr traps.

rtxRptrBasicGroupOperState.name: rtxRptrBasicGroupOperState
rtxRptrBasicGroupOperState.description: This object indicates the operational status of the group. A state of notPresent(4) indicates that the group has been physically removed from the repeater. A status of operational(2) indicates that the group is functioning, and a status of malFunctioning(3) indicates that the group is malfunctioning in some way.

rtxRptrBasicGroupLastOperStatusChange.name: rtxRptrBasicGroupLastOperStatusChange
rtxRptrBasicGroupLastOperStatusChange.description: This object contains the value of sysUpTime at the time that the value of the rtxRptrOprtStatus object was last changed. A value of zero indicates that the oper status has not been changed since the agent last reset.

rtxRptrBasicGroupPortCapacity.name: rtxRptrBasicGroupPortCapacity
rtxRptrBasicGroupPortCapacity.description: The rtxRptrBasicGroupPortCapacity is the number of ports that can be contained within the group. Valid range is 1 to 1024. Within each group, the ports are uniquley numbered in the range 1 to rtxRptrBasicGroupPortCapacity. Note : In practice, this will generally be the number of ports on a module, card, or board, and the port numbers will correspond to numbers marked on the physical embodiment.

rtxRptrPortTable.name: rtxRptrPortTable
rtxRptrPortTable.description: Table of descriptive and status information about the ports.

rtxRptrPortEntry.name: rtxRptrPortEntry
rtxRptrPortEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing information about a single port.

rtxRptrPortRptrIndex.name: rtxRptrPortRptrIndex
rtxRptrPortRptrIndex.description: This index uniquley identifies a single 10 Base-T card. It takes a value numerically equal to the physical port index (portPhysPortID) of the I/O card. Note that this means that indexing of hub cards is sparse.

rtxRptrPortIndex.name: rtxRptrPortIndex
rtxRptrPortIndex.description: This variable identifies the port within the group within the repeater for which this entry contains management information. This value can never be greater that rtrRptrGroupPortCapacity.

rtxRptrPortAdminStatus.name: rtxRptrPortAdminStatus
rtxRptrPortAdminStatus.description: Setting this object to disable(2) disables the port. A disabled port neither transmits nor receives. Once disabled, a port must be explicitly enabled to restore operation. A port which is disabled when power is lost or when a reset is exerted shall remain disabled when normal operation resumes. The admin state takes precedence over auto- partition and functionally operates between the auto-partition mechanism and the AUI/PMA. Setting this object to enable(1) enables the port and exerts a BEGIN on the port's auto-partition state machine. (In effect, when a port is disabled, the value of rtxRptrPortAutoPartitionState for that port is frozen until the port is next enabled. When the port becomes enabled, the rtxRptrPortAutoPartitionState becomes notAutoPartitioned(1), regardless of its pre-disabling state.)

rtxRptrPortAutoPartitionState.name: rtxRptrPortAutoPartitionState
rtxRptrPortAutoPartitionState.description: The autoPartitionState flag indicates whether the port is currently partitioned by the repeater's auto-partition protection. The conditions that cause port partitioning are specified in partition state machine in Section 9 [IEEE 802.3 Std]. They are not differentiated here.

rtxRptrPortOperStatus.name: rtxRptrPortOperStatus
rtxRptrPortOperStatus.description: This object indicates the port's operational status. The notPresent(3) status indicates the port is physically removed (note this may or may not be possible depending on the type of port.) The operational(1) status indicates that the port is enabled (see rtxRptrPortAdminStatus) and working, even though it might be auto-partitioned (see rtxRptrPortAutoPartitionState). For the RX7000, the value notPresent(3) can never be returned notOperational(2) is returned if either the port is disabled via rtxRptrPortAdminState, or if Link Pulses are not being received.

rtxRptrMonitorTable.name: rtxRptrMonitorTable
rtxRptrMonitorTable.description: This table contains statistics information for a collection of repeaters in a given system.

rtxRptrMonitorEntry.name: rtxRptrMonitorEntry
rtxRptrMonitorEntry.description: This is an entry in the table containing statistics for single repeater.

rtxRptrMonitorIndex.name: rtxRptrMonitorIndex
rtxRptrMonitorIndex.description: This index uniquley identifies a single 10 Base-T I/O card. It takes the value numerically equal to the physical port ID (portPhysPortID) of the I/O card. Note that this means that indexing of hub cards is sparse.

rtxRptrMonitorTransmitCollisions.name: rtxRptrMonitorTransmitCollisions
rtxRptrMonitorTransmitCollisions.description: This counter is incremented every time the repeater state machine enters the TRANSMIT COLLISION state from any state other than ONE PORT LEFT (Ref: Fig 9-2, IEEE 802.3 Std). The approximate minimum time for rollover of this counter is 16 hours.

rtxRptrMonitorMJLPs.name: rtxRptrMonitorMJLPs
rtxRptrMonitorMJLPs.description: The repeater MJLPs object counts the number of times the repeater enters a DISABLE OUTPUT state in the MAU Jabber Lockup Protection state diagram.

rtxRptrMonitorPortTable.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortTable
rtxRptrMonitorPortTable.description: Table of performance and error statistics for the ports.

rtxRptrMonitorPortEntry.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortEntry
rtxRptrMonitorPortEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing performance and error statistics for a single port.

rtxRptrMonitorPortGroupIndex.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortGroupIndex
rtxRptrMonitorPortGroupIndex.description: This index uniquley identifies a single 10 Base-T I/O card. It takes a value numerically equal to the physical port id (portPhysPortID) for the I/O card. Note that this means that indexing of hub cards is sparse.

rtxRptrMonitorPortReadableFrames.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortReadableFrames
rtxRptrMonitorPortReadableFrames.description: This object's value is a representation of the total number of frames of valid length. This counter is incremented by one for each frame whose Octet count is greater that or equal to the minFrameSize and less that or equal to the maxFrameSize (Ref : 4.4.2.1 [11]) and for which FCSError is not asserted.

rtxRptrMonitorPortReadableOctets.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortReadableOctets
rtxRptrMonitorPortReadableOctets.description: This value of this object is incremented by OctetCount for each readable frame which has been determined to be a readable frame. Note : The approximate minimum time between counter rollovers is 58 minutes.

rtxRptrMonitorPortFCSErrors.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortFCSErrors
rtxRptrMonitorPortFCSErrors.description: This counter is incremented by one for each frame received on this port with the FCSError signal asserted and the FramingError and CollisionEvent signals deasserted and whose OctetCount is greater than or equal to minFrameSize and less than or equal to maxFrameSize (Ref: 4.4.2.1, IEEE 802.3 Std). The approximate minimum time for rollover of this counter is 81 hours.

rtxRptrMonitorPortAlignmentErrors.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortAlignmentErrors
rtxRptrMonitorPortAlignmentErrors.description: This counter is incremented by one for each frame received on this port with the FCSError and FramingError signals asserted and CollisionEvent signal deasserted and whose OctetCount is greater than or equal to minFrameSize and less than or equal to maxFrameSize (Ref: IEEE 802.3 Std, 4.4.2.1). If rtxRptrMonitorPortAlignmentErrors is incremented then the rtxRptrMonitorPortFCSErrors Counter shall not be incremented for the same frame. The approximate minimum time for rollover of this counter is 81 hours.

rtxRptrMonitorPortFrameTooLongs.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortFrameTooLongs
rtxRptrMonitorPortFrameTooLongs.description: This counter is incremented by one for each frame received on this port whose OctetCount is greater than maxFrameSize (Ref: 4.4.2.1, IEEE 802.3 Std). If rtxRptrMonitorPortFrameTooLongs is incremented then neither the rtxRptrMonitorPortAlignmentErrors nor the rtxRptrMonitorPortFCSErrors counter shall be incremented for the frame. The approximate minimum time for rollover of this counter is 61 days.

rtxRptrMonitorPortShortEvents.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortShortEvents
rtxRptrMonitorPortShortEvents.description: This counter is incremented by one for each CarrierEvent on this port with ActivityDuration less than ShortEventMaxTime. ShortEventMaxTime is greater than 7.4 us and less than 8.2 us. ShortEventMaxTime has tolerances included to provide for circuit losses between a conformance test point at the AUI and the measurement point within the state machine. Note: shortEvents may indicate an externally generated noise hit which will cause the repeater to transmit Runts to its other ports, or propagate a collision (which may be late) back to the transmitting DTE and damaged frames to the rest of the network. Such shortEvents are not a feature of normal network activity. Also it should be noted that a MAU that is attached to a coax segment may have several carrier droupouts on the DI circuit before the CI circuit is active and stable. Such droupouts will increment the shortEvent counter but are considered normal for a coax segment.

rtxRptrMonitorPortRunts.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortRunts
rtxRptrMonitorPortRunts.description: This counter is incremented by one for each CarrierEvent hose ActiveDuration is greater that ShortEventsMaxtime and less than RuntMaxTime. RuntMaxTime is greater than 53.2us and less than 56.0us. An event whose length is greater than 7.4us but less than 8.2us shall increment either the shortEvents counter or the runts counter but not both. A non-collision event greater that 53.2us but less than 56.0us may or may not be counted as a runt. A non-collision event greater than or equal to 56.0us shall not be counted as a Runt. RuntMaxTime has tolerances included to provide for circuit losses between a conformance test point at the AUI and a measurement point within the state machine. Note : Runts do not indicate a problem in the network. The approximate minimum time for rollover of this counter is 16 hours.

rtxRptrMonitorPortCollisions.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortCollisions
rtxRptrMonitorPortCollisions.description: This counter is incremented by one for any carrier event for which the CIPresent(X) variable has the value SQE. The approximate minimum time for rollover of this counter is 16 hours.

rtxRptrMonitorPortLateCollisions.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortLateCollisions
rtxRptrMonitorPortLateCollisions.description: This counter is incremented by one for each carrier event in which the CIPresent(X) variable has the value SQE (Ref: 9.6.6.2, IEEE 802.3 Std) at any time when the ActivityDuration is greater than the RuntMaxTime. A late collision is counted twice, as both a collision and as a late collision. LateCollisionThreshold has tolerances included to provide for circuit losses between a conformance test point at the AUI and the measurement point within the state machine. Note : The approximate minimum time for rollover of this counter is 81 hours.

rtxRptrMonitorPortVeryLongEvents.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortVeryLongEvents
rtxRptrMonitorPortVeryLongEvents.description: This counter is incremented by one for each CarrierEvent on this port whose ActivityDuration is greater than the MAU Jabber Lockup Protection timer TW3 (Ref: 9.6.1 & 9.6.5, IEEE 802.3 Std). Other counters may be incremented as appropriate.

rtxRptrMonitorPortDataRateMismatches.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortDataRateMismatches
rtxRptrMonitorPortDataRateMismatches.description: This object counts the number of times that a packet has been received by this port with the transmission frequency (data rate) detectably mismatched from the local transmit frequency. The exact degree is implementation specific and is to be defined by the implementor for conformance testing. Note : Whether or not the repeater was able to maintain data integrity is beyond the scope of this standard.

rtxRptrMonitorPortAutoPartitions.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortAutoPartitions
rtxRptrMonitorPortAutoPartitions.description: This counter is incremented by one for each time the repeater has automatically partitioned this port. The conditions that cause port partitioning are specified in the partition state machine in Section 9 [IEEE 802.3 Std]. They are not differentiated here. Note : the approximate minimum time between counter rollovers is 20 days.

rtxRptrMonitorPortTotalErrors.name: rtxRptrMonitorPortTotalErrors
rtxRptrMonitorPortTotalErrors.description: The total number of errors which have occurred on this port. This counter is the summation of the values of other error counters (for the same port), namely: rtxRptrMonitorPortFCSErrors, rtxRptrMonitorPortAlignmentFrames, rtxRptrMonitorPortFrameTooLongs, rtxRptrMonitorPortShortEvents, rtxRptrMonitorPortLateEvents, rtxRptrMonitorPortVeryLongEvents and rtxRptrMonitorPortDataRateMismatches. This counter is redundant in the sense that it is the summation of information already available through other objects. However, it is included specifically because the regular retrieval of this object as a means of tracking the health of a port provides a considerable optimization of network management traffic over the otherwise necessary retrieval of the summed counters.

rtxRptrAddrTrackTable.name: rtxRptrAddrTrackTable
rtxRptrAddrTrackTable.description: Table of address mapping information about the ports.

rtxRptrAddrTrackEntry.name: rtxRptrAddrTrackEntry
rtxRptrAddrTrackEntry.description: An entry in the table, containing address mapping information about a single port.

rtxRptrAddrTrackGroupIndex.name: rtxRptrAddrTrackGroupIndex
rtxRptrAddrTrackGroupIndex.description: This index uniquley identifies a single 10 Base-T I/O card It takes a value numerically equal to the physical port ID (portPhysPortID) of the I/O card. Note that this means the indexing of hub cards is sparse.

rtxRptrAddrTrackLastSourceAddress.name: rtxRptrAddrTrackLastSourceAddress
rtxRptrAddrTrackLastSourceAddress.description: This object is the SourceAddress of the last readable frame (i.e., counted by rtxRptrMonitorPortReadableFrames) received by this port.

rtxRptrAddrTrackSourceAddrChanges.name: rtxRptrAddrTrackSourceAddrChanges
rtxRptrAddrTrackSourceAddrChanges.description: This counter is incremented by one for each time that the rtxRptrAddrTrackLastSourceAddress attribute for this port has changed. Note : This may indicate whether a link is connected to a single DTE or another multi-user segment. The approximate minimum time for rollover of this counter is 81 hours.

cmprsnPortTable.name: cmprsnPortTable
cmprsnPortTable.description: This table contains the Compression Port Information.

cmprsnPortEntry.name: cmprsnPortEntry
cmprsnPortEntry.description: An Entry in this table contains information about each logical port in the system that uses compression. Compression can only be used on Logical Ports which have underlying physical ports which are running Retixwan or x25 as the Link Protocol.

cmprsnPortIfIndex.name: cmprsnPortIfIndex
cmprsnPortIfIndex.description: This object is the Logical Port to which this table entry refers. The Port must be of type Retixwan or X.25 to run compression.

cmprsnPortEnable.name: cmprsnPortEnable
cmprsnPortEnable.description: This enables or disables Compression on this port.

cmprsnPortRatio.name: cmprsnPortRatio
cmprsnPortRatio.description: This is the compression Ratio for this port. It is calculated as follows :- Total Bytes into Compression Algorithm -------------------------------------- Total Bytes out of Compression Algorithm It is expressed as a percentage, the OCTET STRING allowing us to return the floating point calculation in the form xx.yy

isdnTable.name: isdnTable
isdnTable.description: A table of parameters specifying whether and how ISDN TA support is provided on a serial interface physical port.

isdnEntry.name: isdnEntry
isdnEntry.description: An entry in the ISDN table.

isdnIndex.name: isdnIndex
isdnIndex.description: The index value which uniquely identifies the physical port to which this entry is applicable.

isdnEnabled.name: isdnEnabled
isdnEnabled.description: This parameter determines whether ISDN TA support procedures are invoked for this port. When set to disabled, no TA support is provided and the values of the remaining parameters in the isdnEntry are ignored. The parameter can only be set to enabled if the physical port is of type V35 or X21.

isdnMode.name: isdnMode
isdnMode.description: This parameter selects the call setup and answer algorithms desired.

isdnInitialRetryInterval.name: isdnInitialRetryInterval
isdnInitialRetryInterval.description: The interval in seconds initially in force between successive call attempts, until the isdnRetryThresh is reached

isdnRetryThresh.name: isdnRetryThresh
isdnRetryThresh.description: The first isdnRetryThresh call attempts are made at the isdnInitialRetryInterval, all subsequent attempts are made at the isdnBackupInterval.

isdnBackupRetryInterval.name: isdnBackupRetryInterval
isdnBackupRetryInterval.description: The interval in seconds at which call attempts are made, once isdRetryThresh is passed. A value of 0 means no further call attempts will be made.

isdnCallExpirationTime.name: isdnCallExpirationTime
isdnCallExpirationTime.description: The time in seconds to wait for an answer after a call has been issued.

isdnTimeOn.name: isdnTimeOn
isdnTimeOn.description: This is a configurable parameter which sets the time of day to make the call. Format of string is hh:mm. First 2 bytes are hours, second 2 bytes are minutes The parameter isdnMode must be set to timedCall for this to function.This defaults to '00:00' or midnight.

isdnTimeOff.name: isdnTimeOff
isdnTimeOff.description: This is a configurable parameter which sets the time of day to clear the call. Format of string is hh:mm. First 2 bytes are hours, second 2 bytes are minutes The parameter isdnMode must be set to timedCall for this to function.This defaults to '00:00' or midnight.

isdnControl.name: isdnControl
isdnControl.description: This parameter allows a network manager to make or clear an ISDN call. When read, the value noAction will always be returned. When set to makeCall, the port will initiate an ISDN call if this is allowed by the current setting of isdnMode. When set to clearCall, the call will be cleared if this is allowed by the current setting of isdnMode.

isdnStatus.name: isdnStatus
isdnStatus.description: Returns the current status of the ISDN call.

isdnInactivityTime.name: isdnInactivityTime
isdnInactivityTime.description: The time in seconds to wait, while not receiving or transmitting data, before a call is cleared when in On Demand mode.

dot5Table.name: dot5Table
dot5Table.description: This table contains Token Ring interface parameters and state variables, one entry per 802.5 interface.

dot5Entry.name: dot5Entry
dot5Entry.description: A list of Token Ring status and parameter values for an 802.5 interface.

dot5IfIndex.name: dot5IfIndex
dot5IfIndex.description: The value of this object identifies the 802.5 interface for which this entry contains management information. The value of this object for a particular interface has the same value as the ifIndex object, defined in [4,6], for the same interface.

dot5Commands.name: dot5Commands
dot5Commands.description: When this object is set to the value of open(2), the station should go into the open state. The progress and success of the open is given by the values of the objects dot5RingState and dot5RingOpenStatus. When this object is set to the value of reset(3), then the station should do a reset. On a reset, all MIB counters should retain their values, if possible. Other side affects are dependent on the hardware chip set. When this object is set to the value of close(4), the station should go into the stopped state by removing itself from the ring. Setting this object to a value of no-op(1) has no effect. When read, this object always has a value of no-op(1).

dot5RingStatus.name: dot5RingStatus
dot5RingStatus.description: The current interface status which can be used to diagnose fluctuating problems that can occur on token rings, after a station has successfully been added to the ring. Before an open is completed, this object has the value for the 'no status' condition. The dot5RingState and dot5RingOpenStatus objects provide for debugging problems when the station can not even enter the ring. The object's value is a sum of values, one for each currently applicable condition. The following values are defined for various conditions: 0 = No Problems detected 32 = Ring Recovery 64 = Single Station 256 = Remove Received 512 = reserved 1024 = Auto-Removal Error 2048 = Lobe Wire Fault 4096 = Transmit Beacon 8192 = Soft Error 16384 = Hard Error 32768 = Signal Loss 131072 = no status, open not completed.

dot5RingState.name: dot5RingState
dot5RingState.description: The current interface state with respect to entering or leaving the ring.

dot5RingOpenStatus.name: dot5RingOpenStatus
dot5RingOpenStatus.description: This object indicates the success, or the reason for failure, of the station's most recent attempt to enter the ring.

dot5UpStream.name: dot5UpStream
dot5UpStream.description: The MAC-address of the up stream neighbor station in the ring.

dot5ActMonParticipate.name: dot5ActMonParticipate
dot5ActMonParticipate.description: If this object has a value of true(1) then this interface will participate in the active monitor selection process. If the value is false(2) then it will not. Setting this object might not have an effect until the next time the interface is opened.

dot5Functional.name: dot5Functional
dot5Functional.description: The bit mask of all Token Ring functional addresses for which this interface will accept frames.

dot5StatsTable.name: dot5StatsTable
dot5StatsTable.description: A table containing Token Ring statistics, one entry per 802.5 interface. All the statistics are defined using the SYNTAX Counter as 32-bit wrap around counters. Thus, if an interface's hardware maintains these statistics in 16-bit counters, then the agent must read the hardware's counters frequently enough to prevent loss of significance, in order to maintain 32-bit counters in software.

dot5StatsEntry.name: dot5StatsEntry
dot5StatsEntry.description: An entry contains the 802.5 statistics for a particular interface.

dot5StatsIfIndex.name: dot5StatsIfIndex
dot5StatsIfIndex.description: The value of this object identifies the 802.5 interface for which this entry contains management information. The value of this object for a particular interface has the same value as the ifIndex object, defined in [4,6], for the same interface.

dot5StatsLineErrors.name: dot5StatsLineErrors
dot5StatsLineErrors.description: This counter is incremented when a frame or token is copied or repeated by a station, the E bit is zero in the frame or token and one of the following conditions exists: 1) there is a non-data bit (J or K bit) between the SD and the ED of the frame or token, or 2) there is an FCS error in the frame.

dot5StatsBurstErrors.name: dot5StatsBurstErrors
dot5StatsBurstErrors.description: This counter is incremented when a station detects the absence of transitions for five half-bit timers (burst-five error).

dot5StatsACErrors.name: dot5StatsACErrors
dot5StatsACErrors.description: This counter is incremented when a station receives an AMP or SMP frame in which A is equal to C is equal to 0, and then receives another SMP frame with A is equal to C is equal to 0 without first receiving an AMP frame. It denotes a station that cannot set the AC bits properly.

dot5StatsAbortTransErrors.name: dot5StatsAbortTransErrors
dot5StatsAbortTransErrors.description: This counter is incremented when a station transmits an abort delimiter while transmitting.

dot5StatsInternalErrors.name: dot5StatsInternalErrors
dot5StatsInternalErrors.description: This counter is incremented when a station recognizes an internal error.

dot5StatsLostFrameErrors.name: dot5StatsLostFrameErrors
dot5StatsLostFrameErrors.description: This counter is incremented when a station is transmitting and its TRR timer expires. This condition denotes a condition where a transmitting station in strip mode does not receive the trailer of the frame before the TRR timer goes off.

dot5StatsReceiveCongestions.name: dot5StatsReceiveCongestions
dot5StatsReceiveCongestions.description: This counter is incremented when a station recognizes a frame addressed to its specific address, but has no available buffer space indicating that the station is congested.

dot5StatsFrameCopiedErrors.name: dot5StatsFrameCopiedErrors
dot5StatsFrameCopiedErrors.description: This counter is incremented when a station recognizes a frame addressed to its specific address and detects that the FS field A bits are set to 1 indicating a possible line hit or duplicate address.

dot5StatsTokenErrors.name: dot5StatsTokenErrors
dot5StatsTokenErrors.description: This counter is incremented when a station acting as the active monitor recognizes an error condition that needs a token transmitted.

dot5StatsSoftErrors.name: dot5StatsSoftErrors
dot5StatsSoftErrors.description: The number of Soft Errors the interface has detected. It directly corresponds to the number of Report Error MAC frames that this interface has transmitted. Soft Errors are those which are recoverable by the MAC layer protocols.

dot5StatsHardErrors.name: dot5StatsHardErrors
dot5StatsHardErrors.description: The number of times this interface has detected an immediately recoverable fatal error. It denotes the number of times this interface is either transmitting or receiving beacon MAC frames.

dot5StatsSignalLoss.name: dot5StatsSignalLoss
dot5StatsSignalLoss.description: The number of times this interface has detected the loss of signal condition from the ring.

dot5StatsTransmitBeacons.name: dot5StatsTransmitBeacons
dot5StatsTransmitBeacons.description: The number of times this interface has transmitted a beacon frame.

dot5StatsRecoverys.name: dot5StatsRecoverys
dot5StatsRecoverys.description: The number of Claim Token MAC frames received or transmitted after the interface has received a Ring Purge MAC frame. This counter signifies the number of times the ring has been purged and is being recovered back into a normal operating state.

dot5StatsLobeWires.name: dot5StatsLobeWires
dot5StatsLobeWires.description: The number of times the interface has detected an open or short circuit in the lobe data path. The adapter will be closed and dot5RingState will signify this condition.

dot5StatsRemoves.name: dot5StatsRemoves
dot5StatsRemoves.description: The number of times the interface has received a Remove Ring Station MAC frame request. When this frame is received the interface will enter the close state and dot5RingState will signify this condition.

dot5StatsSingles.name: dot5StatsSingles
dot5StatsSingles.description: The number of times the interface has sensed that it is the only station on the ring. This will happen if the interface is the first one up on a ring, or if there is a hardware problem.

dot5StatsFreqErrors.name: dot5StatsFreqErrors
dot5StatsFreqErrors.description: The number of times the interface has detected that the frequency of the incoming signal differs from the expected frequency by more than that specified by the IEEE 802.5 standard, see chapter 7 in [10].

dot5TimerTable.name: dot5TimerTable
dot5TimerTable.description: This table contains Token Ring interface timer values, one entry per 802.5 interface.

dot5TimerEntry.name: dot5TimerEntry
dot5TimerEntry.description: A list of Token Ring timer values for an 802.5 interface.

dot5TimerIfIndex.name: dot5TimerIfIndex
dot5TimerIfIndex.description: The value of this object identifies the 802.5 interface for which this entry contains timer values. The value of this object for a particular interface has the same value as the ifIndex object, defined in [4,6], for the same interface.

dot5TimerReturnRepeat.name: dot5TimerReturnRepeat
dot5TimerReturnRepeat.description: The time-out value used to ensure the interface will return to Repeat State, in units of 100 micro-seconds. The value should be greater than the maximum ring latency. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerHolding.name: dot5TimerHolding
dot5TimerHolding.description: Maximum period of time a station is permitted to transmit frames after capturing a token, in units of 100 micro-seconds. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerQueuePDU.name: dot5TimerQueuePDU
dot5TimerQueuePDU.description: The time-out value for enqueuing of an SMP PDU after reception of an AMP or SMP frame in which the A and C bits were equal to 0, in units of 100 micro-seconds. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerValidTransmit.name: dot5TimerValidTransmit
dot5TimerValidTransmit.description: The time-out value used by the active monitor to detect the absence of valid transmissions, in units of 100 micro-seconds. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerNoToken.name: dot5TimerNoToken
dot5TimerNoToken.description: The time-out value used to recover from various-related error situations [9]. If N is the maximum number of stations on the ring, the value of this timer is normally: dot5TimerReturnRepeat + N*dot5TimerHolding. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerActiveMon.name: dot5TimerActiveMon
dot5TimerActiveMon.description: The time-out value used by the active monitor to stimulate the enqueuing of an AMP PDU for transmission, in units of 100 micro-seconds. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerStandbyMon.name: dot5TimerStandbyMon
dot5TimerStandbyMon.description: The time-out value used by the stand-by monitors to ensure that there is an active monitor on the ring and to detect a continuous stream of tokens, in units of 100 micro-seconds. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerErrorReport.name: dot5TimerErrorReport
dot5TimerErrorReport.description: The time-out value which determines how often a station shall send a Report Error MAC frame to report its error counters, in units of 100 micro-seconds. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerBeaconTransmit.name: dot5TimerBeaconTransmit
dot5TimerBeaconTransmit.description: The time-out value which determines how long a station shall remain in the state of transmitting Beacon frames before entering the Bypass state, in units of 100 micro-seconds. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

dot5TimerBeaconReceive.name: dot5TimerBeaconReceive
dot5TimerBeaconReceive.description: The time-out value which determines how long a station shall receive Beacon frames from its downstream neighbor before entering the Bypass state, in units of 100 micro-seconds. Implementors are encouraged to provide read-write access to this object if that is possible/useful in their system, but giving due consideration to the dangers of write-able timers.

pppLinkStatusTable.name: pppLinkStatusTable
pppLinkStatusTable.description: A table containing PPP-link specific variables for this PPP implementation.

pppLinkStatusEntry.name: pppLinkStatusEntry
pppLinkStatusEntry.description: Management information about a particular PPP Link.

pppLinkStatusIfIndex.name: pppLinkStatusIfIndex
pppLinkStatusIfIndex.description: A unique value for each PPP link. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is that identified by the same value of an ifIndex object instance. The value for each link must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

pppLinkStatusPhysicalIndex.name: pppLinkStatusPhysicalIndex
pppLinkStatusPhysicalIndex.description: The value of ifIndex that identifies the interface over which this PPP Link is operating. This interface would usually be an HDLC or RS-232 type of interface. If there is no lower-layer interface element, or there is no ifEntry for the element, or the element can not be identified, then the value of this object is 0.

pppLinkStatusBadAddresses.name: pppLinkStatusBadAddresses
pppLinkStatusBadAddresses.description: The number of packets received with an incorrect Address Field. This counter is a component of the ifInErrors variable that is associated with the interface that represents this PPP Link.

pppLinkStatusBadControls.name: pppLinkStatusBadControls
pppLinkStatusBadControls.description: The number of packets received on this link with an incorrect Control Field. This counter is a component of the ifInErrors variable that is associated with the interface that represents this PPP Link.

pppLinkStatusPacketTooLongs.name: pppLinkStatusPacketTooLongs
pppLinkStatusPacketTooLongs.description: The number of received packets that have been discarded because their length exceeded the MRU. This counter is a component of the ifInErrors variable that is associated with the interface that represents this PPP Link. NOTE, packets which are longer than the MRU but which are successfully received and processed are NOT included in this count.

pppLinkStatusBadFCSs.name: pppLinkStatusBadFCSs
pppLinkStatusBadFCSs.description: The number of received packets that have been discarded due to having an incorrect FCS. This counter is a component of the ifInErrors variable that is associated with the interface that represents this PPP Link.

pppLinkStatusLocalMRU.name: pppLinkStatusLocalMRU
pppLinkStatusLocalMRU.description: The current value of the MRU for the local PPP Entity. This value is the MRU that the remote entity is using when sending packets to the local PPP entity.

pppLinkStatusRemoteMRU.name: pppLinkStatusRemoteMRU
pppLinkStatusRemoteMRU.description: The current value of the MRU for the remote PPP Entity. This value is the MRU that the local entity is using when sending packets to the remote PPP entity.

pppLinkStatusLocalToPeerACCMap.name: pppLinkStatusLocalToPeerACCMap
pppLinkStatusLocalToPeerACCMap.description: The current value of the ACC Map used for sending packets from the local PPP entity to the remote PPP entity.

pppLinkStatusPeerToLocalACCMap.name: pppLinkStatusPeerToLocalACCMap
pppLinkStatusPeerToLocalACCMap.description: The ACC Map used by the remote PPP entity when transmitting packets to the local PPP entity.

pppLinkStatusLocalToRemoteProtocolCompre.name: pppLinkStatusLocalToRemoteProtocolCompression
pppLinkStatusLocalToRemoteProtocolCompre.description: Indicates whether the local PPP entity will use Protocol Compression when transmitting packets to the remote PPP entity.

pppLinkStatusRemoteToLocalProtocolCompre.name: pppLinkStatusRemoteToLocalProtocolCompression
pppLinkStatusRemoteToLocalProtocolCompre.description: Indicates whether the remote PPP entity will use Protocol Compression when transmitting packets to the local PPP entity.

pppLinkStatusLocalToRemoteACCompression.name: pppLinkStatusLocalToRemoteACCompression
pppLinkStatusLocalToRemoteACCompression.description: Indicates whether the local PPP entity will use Address and Control Compression when transmitting packets to the remote PPP entity.

pppLinkStatusRemoteToLocalACCompression.name: pppLinkStatusRemoteToLocalACCompression
pppLinkStatusRemoteToLocalACCompression.description: Indicates whether the remote PPP entity will use Address and Control Compression when transmitting packets to the local PPP entity.

pppLinkStatusTransmitFcsSize.name: pppLinkStatusTransmitFcsSize
pppLinkStatusTransmitFcsSize.description: The size of the Frame Check Sequence (FCS) in bits that the local node will generate when sending packets to the remote node.

pppLinkStatusReceiveFcsSize.name: pppLinkStatusReceiveFcsSize
pppLinkStatusReceiveFcsSize.description: The size of the Frame Check Sequence (FCS) in bits that the remote node will generate when sending packets to the local node.

pppLinkConfigTable.name: pppLinkConfigTable
pppLinkConfigTable.description: A table containing the LCP configuration parameters for this PPP Link. These variables represent the initial configuration of the PPP Link. The actual values of the parameters may be changed when the link is brought up via the LCP options negotiation mechanism.

pppLinkConfigEntry.name: pppLinkConfigEntry
pppLinkConfigEntry.description: Configuration information about a particular PPP Link.

pppLinkConfigIfIndex.name: pppLinkConfigIfIndex
pppLinkConfigIfIndex.description: A unique value for each PPP link. Its value ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The interface identified by a particular value of this index is that identified by the same value of an ifIndex object instance. The value for each link must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of the entity's network management system to the next re-initialization.

pppLinkConfigInitialMRU.name: pppLinkConfigInitialMRU
pppLinkConfigInitialMRU.reference: Section 7.2, Maximum Receive Unit of RFC1331.
pppLinkConfigInitialMRU.description: The initial Maximum Receive Unit (MRU) that the local PPP entity will advertise to the remote entity. If the value of this variable is 0 then the local PPP entity will not advertise any MRU to the remote entity and the default MRU will be assumed. Changing this object will have effect when the link is next restarted.

pppLinkConfigReceiveACCMap.name: pppLinkConfigReceiveACCMap
pppLinkConfigReceiveACCMap.reference: Section 7.3, page 4, Async-Control-Character- Map of RFC1331.
pppLinkConfigReceiveACCMap.description: The Asynchronous-Control-Character-Map (ACC) that the local PPP entity requires for use on its receive side. In effect, this is the ACC Map that is required in order to ensure that the local modem will successfully receive all characters. The actual ACC map used on the receive side of the link will be a combination of the local node's pppLinkConfigReceiveACCMap and the remote node's pppLinkConfigTransmitACCMap. Changing this object will have effect when the link is next restarted.

pppLinkConfigTransmitACCMap.name: pppLinkConfigTransmitACCMap
pppLinkConfigTransmitACCMap.reference: Section 7.3, page 4, Async-Control-Character- Map of RFC1331.
pppLinkConfigTransmitACCMap.description: The Asynchronous-Control-Character-Map (ACC) that the local PPP entity requires for use on its transmit side. In effect, this is the ACC Map that is required in order to ensure that all characters can be successfully transmitted through the local modem. The actual ACC map used on the transmit side of the link will be a combination of the local node's pppLinkConfigTransmitACCMap and the remote node's pppLinkConfigReceiveACCMap. Changing this object will have effect when the link is next restarted.

pppLinkConfigMagicNumber.name: pppLinkConfigMagicNumber
pppLinkConfigMagicNumber.description: If true(2) then the local node will attempt to perform Magic Number negotiation with the remote node. If false(1) then this negotiation is not performed. In any event, the local node will comply with any magic number negotiations attempted by the remote node, per the PPP specification. Changing this object will have effect when the link is next restarted.

pppLinkConfigFcsSize.name: pppLinkConfigFcsSize
pppLinkConfigFcsSize.description: The size of the FCS, in bits, the local node will attempt to negotiate for use with the remote node. Regardless of the value of this object, the local node will comply with any FCS size negotiations initiated by the remote node, per the PPP specification. Changing this object will have effect when the link is next restarted.

pppIpTable.name: pppIpTable
pppIpTable.description: Table containing the IP parameters and statistics for the local PPP entity.

pppIpEntry.name: pppIpEntry
pppIpEntry.description: IPCP status information for a particular PPP link. A SNMP error of noSuchName is returned to a request for an object in this table for which the index identifies an IP port which is attached to a physical port which is not a PPP physical port.

pppIpIndex.name: pppIpIndex
pppIpIndex.description: The value of ifIndex that identifies the entry in the ifTable that is associated with the PPP Link over which this instance of the IP network and control protocol are operating.

pppIpOperStatus.name: pppIpOperStatus
pppIpOperStatus.description: The operational status of the IP network protocol. If the value of this object is opened(1) then the finite state machine for the IP network protocol has reached the Opened state.

pppIpLocalToRemoteCompressionProtocol.name: pppIpLocalToRemoteCompressionProtocol
pppIpLocalToRemoteCompressionProtocol.description: The IP compression protocol that the local PPP-IP entity uses when sending packets to the remote PPP-IP entity.

pppIpRemoteToLocalCompressionProtocol.name: pppIpRemoteToLocalCompressionProtocol
pppIpRemoteToLocalCompressionProtocol.description: The IP compression protocol that the remote PPP-IP entity uses when sending packets to the local PPP-IP entity.

pppIpRemoteMaxSlotId.name: pppIpRemoteMaxSlotId
pppIpRemoteMaxSlotId.description: The Max-Slot-Id parameter that the remote node has advertised and that is in use on the link. If vj-tcp header compression is not in use on the link then the value of this object shall be 0.

pppIpLocalMaxSlotId.name: pppIpLocalMaxSlotId
pppIpLocalMaxSlotId.description: The Max-Slot-Id parameter that the local node has advertised and that is in use on the link. If vj-tcp header compression is not in use on the link then the value of this object shall be 0.

pppIpConfigTable.name: pppIpConfigTable
pppIpConfigTable.description: Table containing configuration variables for the IPCP for the local PPP entity.

pppIpConfigEntry.name: pppIpConfigEntry
pppIpConfigEntry.description: IPCP information for a particular PPP link. A SNMP error of noSuchName is returned to a request for an object in this table for which the index identifies an IP port which is attached to a physical port which is not a PPP physical port.

pppIpConfigIndex.name: pppIpConfigIndex
pppIpConfigIndex.description: The value of ifIndex that identifies the entry in the ifTable that is associated with the local IPCP entity.

pppIpConfigAdminStatus.name: pppIpConfigAdminStatus
pppIpConfigAdminStatus.description: The immediate desired status of the IP network protocol. Setting this object to open will inject an administrative open event into the IP network protocol's finite state machine. Setting this object to close will inject an administrative close event into the IP network protocol's finite state machine.

pppIpConfigCompression.name: pppIpConfigCompression
pppIpConfigCompression.reference: Section 4.0, Van Jacobson TCP/IP Header Compression of RFC1332.
pppIpConfigCompression.description: If none(1) then the local node will not attempt to negotiate any IP Compression option. Otherwise, the local node will attempt to negotiate compression mode indicated by the enumerated value. Changing this object will have effect when the link is next restarted.
